"Well, whether you wanted to do it or not, you still did it for me, and you deserve to get something in return." Sasha insists.


"Okay, then what is this 'something' that you had in mind." you ask.


"Oh, you'll have to wait until tonight to find out." she says, chuckling.


"Alright then." you say. You go upstairs to your room and run into Tara on the way. "Hey, Tara." you say. "Have you noticed that Sasha's been acting weird?" "Actually, yes." she answers. "When you left earlier, she seemed to be deep in though for a few minutes, then all of a sudden, she starts acting all cheery and stuff. It's really weird."


"I know." you say. "I'll see you at dinner."


After dinner, you go up to your room, but Sasha stops you before you go in. "Okay, now it's time for your surprise." she says. She pulls you over to her room and lets you in before she enters behind you. You look around and see that it's just an ordinary bedroom, nothing special. "So what's my surprise?" you ask. You promptly get an answer when Sasha wraps her arms around your back, hugging you.


"I'm your surprise." she says, licking your cheek. "Um, Sasha?" you say nervously. "Yes, sweetie?" she answers. "I don't feel too comfortable with this..." She responds by turning you around and pushing you on her bed, after which she straddles you. "Don't worry, you're just nervous. Relax." she says in a caring, yet seductive tone. Out of nowhere, she kisses you, right then and there, making you blush instantly. The kiss lasts a few seconds longer until...
1231112.title: She has something "special" planned.

12311121.content:
While a part of you was enjoying the... "attention" that Sasha was giving you, you put your hands on her shoulders and push her off of you. I took a bit of effort on you part because Sasha, being a husky, was stronger than you.


Sasha looks at you, tilting her head in confusion. "What's the matter?" she asks.


"Why did you kiss me?" you ask back.


"Because I like you, of course." Sasha says with a smile. "I know we haven't known each other for very long, but despite that, you still went out of your way to stand up to Vicky, not knowing what she could do to you, just to make me feel better. Any guy that would be willing to do that for me is worth my affection." she nuzzles up to you, rubbing her cheek to yours.


"Look, Sasha." you say. "This is going a little too fast for me. I don't know if we should have this kind of relationship." you say.


"Is it because you're a human and I'm a furry?" she asks, sounding hurt.


"Well, that has a little to do with it." you say.


"That shouldn't matter." she says. "I'm willing to be with you, regardless of our differences."


You think to yourself for a second. "It's because of Vicky, isn't it?"


"What?"


"When you and Vicky were growing up, all the guys, wanted her, so you're going after the one guy that doesn't so you can get back at her." you explain.


Sasha looks at you and says:
12311121.title: Hold Up, Wait a Minute!

choices: Wait and get to know her first.
123111212.content:
"Well, you're half right..." Sasha says. "I mean, I am genuinely attracted to you.... but part of me wanted to get back at Vicky for what she did all those years ago. All the blogs would go straight to her without giving me a second look, and now you, the ONLY guy that's repulsed by her, is living under the same roof as me. I didn't mean to be so forward. I've never been in a relationship before, so I'm kind of new at this."


"It's fine." you say. "Some guys actually like the forward approach. I'm just not one of them."


Sasha giggles. "Thanks for being so understanding."


"Even though Vicky deserves a little payback, I still feel a little conflicted about being in a relationship with you." you say. "I don't mind that you're a furry, it's just that we just met yesterday, and I don't want to rush into anything."


"I understand." says Sasha. "I don't want to make you feel uncomfortable. It's up to you if you want to wait or not."


You heard her. It's up to you. Sasha is pretty, and she does have some admirable qualities. She's loyal, she's smart, she's friendly, all the qualities of a good woman. But you just met her. You don't know much about her interests. What if the relationship doesn't work out? Maybe you should get to know her a little, first?
123111212.title: Ulterior Motives

1231112122.content:
"Well, Sasha. I'd like to get to know first, before I make any big decisions." you say.


"Alright then. I can live with that." she says. "At least that means I have some hope."


"How about the two of us sleep together again tonight?" you propose.


"I'd like that." says Sasha as she nuzzles up to you, the combined comfort of her fur and her bed quickly putting you to sleep.


The next morning you woke up so the same situation you woke up to the morning before. You were in bed by yourself, wondering if what happened last night was a dream. The only difference was that you were in Sasha's room, not your own. Also, you kind of hoped that what happened last night wasn't a dream. You're train of thought is interrupted by the smell of bacon and eggs. You head downstairs and see Sasha in the kitchen, putting your food on the table. "Good morning!" she says. "Morning," you say back.


After you finish all your chores for the day, you go back to the house and see Sasha on the front porch with a happy look on her face. "No sign of Vicky at all, today." she says. You take this opportunity to get to know Sasha some more.


"So, Sasha." you say. "Aside from Vicky, what was your childhood like?"


What does she say?
1231112122.title: Wait and get to know her first.

choices: Vicky interrupts the two of you.
12311121221.content:
"Well, I had a pretty normal childhood." she says. "My parents were married, an we never had any financial trouble. The only problem that I had during the early years of my life was that I was Lonely. Then one day in kindergarten, I met Vicky, and you know the story from there. Let's see.... I did track and field during junior high and high school, and I was the top athlete." That made sense since Sasha was a husky.


"I never really got that much attention from bays when I was a teenager, since they were all focused on Vicky. As a result of that, I was pretty much a loner throughout my ten years." You really felt bad for Sasha. Prior to living on the farm, Vicky was the first and only friend Sasha had, and Vicky just left her in the dust. "Well, enough about me." she says. "Why don't you tell me about yourself."


"Well, my situation was pretty much the same as yours, except I never had a 'best friend'." you explain. "I'm also terrible at sports too." "You could've fooled me." says Sasha. "You're pretty well-built." You chuckle at that statement. "You're just being nice."


Just then...
12311121221.title: "It was pretty good."

choices: She drops on her knees, defeated and crying.
123111212211.content:
"Oh, how cute! You two getting to know each other?" Sasha starts growling upon hearing the familiar voice. Vicky walks out of the bush she was hiding in. "So you reject me, but you'd rather be with her?"


"Jealous?" Sasha asks. "Why would I be?" Vicky asks back.


"[Your name]'s the one guy that doesn't like you, and of all the other girls he's met, he likes me." Sasha says, feeling that she finally has a one-up on Vicky.


"Okay, so I couldn't get one guy." she says, brushing it off. "I guess since you've went years without a man, God practically owed you one. It's not your fault, though. Guys like women that are more well developed." she pushes out her chest as she says this. "Nobody can blame you for that."


"You ever think that the bigger your breasts are now, the more they're gonna sag when you get older?" you say.


"I'll cross that bridge when I get to it." Damn! It's like nothing can faze this girl. No kind of insult or retort will work on her! "Besides, if that's the case, then I'll just enjoy all the guys I can while I'm in my prime."


"You've become such a slut, you know that?" says Sasha. "All you've done during high school was spread like an eagle. You've had more nuts in you than a Snickers bar!"


"It's the nuts that give the bar more flavor." Vicky says as Sasha grunts in disgust. "You're just jealous. That's all you've ever been. You've never had a guy before, and you're still a virgin at twenty two. I'll bet this cutie will soon realize what a trainwreck you are and come running to me without even giving you a second thought. You're pathetic. I can't believe that I was ever friends with you."


Sasha stands there, taking in everything that Vicky said, and then-
123111212211.title: Vicky interrupts the two of you.

choices: Vicky quietly gets up and leaves, and doesn't come back for weeks.
1231112122111.content:
Well, what would you do in Sasha's position. She and Vicky used to be the best of friends. Then Vicky just betrayed her, for no reason. Sasha's spent many years after that with no friends at all, and now the one girl that she had once thought of as a sister was severely insulting her and saying that their past friendship was a total waste! Who wouldn't punch that bitch!?


With one swift movement, Sasha's fist made full contact with Vicky's face, sending her flying backwards. "I can't believe that you would even say that." she says. "I never regretted being fiends with you." Vicky has a surprised look on her face. "I've treasured every moment of our friendship, good and bad. Even when you abandoned me, there was still a part of me that wanted to forgive you." This really surprised you, because you wouldn't forgive Vicky if you were Sasha.


"But now, after hearing you say all that, I will never forgive you. I can't ever forgive someone who would have the audacity to say something like that to me. Even so, our friendship wasn't worthless. If there's one thing that my friendship with you has taught me.......... IT'S TO NEVER TRUST DECEITFUL BITCHES LIKE YOU!!!" You were sure that everyone on the farm had heard that just now. Vicky just stared at Sasha, who's eyes were burning red. The air is quiet for about a minute until...
1231112122111.title: She punches Vicky!

12311121221111.content:
An angry look forms on Vicky's face, but it quickly disappears as she feels something trickling down her muzzle. She touches it with her finger and sees that Sasha's punch caused her nose to bleed. Her anger quickly comes back, only more intense. She gets up on her feet, and you're shocked to see her ears pointed up and her fur standing on end.


She growls loudly. "HOW DARE YOU!?" she screams. "HOW DARE YOU RUIN MY PERFECT FACE!"


Sasha scoffs at her. "Your face was ruined long before I punched it." she says with an air of confidence. "I say the nosebleed makes it look better."


Vicky becomes infuriated, and charges at Sasha. "Why you little BITCH!" she yells as she tries to punch her , but she misses and is socked in the stomach. "You may have the looks," says Sasha, but I am a lot stronger than you."


"We'll see about that!" yells Vicky as she takes a couple more swings at Sasha, all of them missing. "What's the matter?" says Sasha. "This can't be all you've got. You've gotta try harder than that." Vicky grunts as her attacks become more and more vicious. You watch the two of them as the fight continues, unsure of what to do. Sasha was obviously going to win, but Vicky had gotten a few hits in, albeit they were lucky shots due to Sasha's slight overconfidence. The fight continues for awhile until...
12311121221111.title: Husky vs. Vixen!

123111212211112.content:
You had to stop this before things got more out of hand than they already were. You jump in between the two of them, using your arms to keep them apart. Vicky still tries to punch at Sasha, with no effect. She lets out a yell of frustration.


"What are you doing?" asks Sasha.


"I'm supposed to look after you, right?" you say back. "Besides, I don't want this fight to go on for any longer."


"DON'T JUST IGNORE ME , YOU TWO!" Vicky yells.


"I was just getting to you." you say with a serious tone. "You've caused enough trouble for one day, Vicky. Get out of here. Part of the reason why I stopped this fight was because I felt sorry for you for just a second, so leave before I change my mind and let Sasha pummel you.


Contrary to what you were expecting, Vicky leaves without an argument, but the look on her face says "You two are gonna pay."


The next morning...
123111212211112.title: Alright, Break it Up!

1231112122111121.content:
You and Sasha were cuddling together sleeping soundly when Tara bursts in and wakes the two of you up. "Wake up you two, we got trouble!" Tara yelled. You and Sasha awake with a jolt as Sasha asks, "What's wrong Tara?"

"It's Vicky, she struck the farm last night."

"Oh no, how many chicken did she take this time?"

"It's not chickens this time, its much worse."

You get out of bed and start getting dressed. "How could it be worse?"

"Vicky took..."
1231112122111121.title: Vicky's done something!

choices: The Next Morning, (No Sign of Vicky all day)
12311121221112.content:
The whole world had gone as quiet as the grave after Sasha’s emotional outburst.

You simply stood there behind Sasha completely baffled, not quite sure what to do next. Lying on the ground looking very lost was Vicky, her hair and orange fur disheveled and coated in dirt from her landing. She had one hand on her jaw, which was already looking swollen. Her expression was a strange mix of anger, shock, and to your surprise…..guilt.

Breathing deeply with teeth bared was Sasha, both fists clenched tight and shoulders rigid. Years of pent up rage and sadness had finally been released that sunny afternoon. And you knew without looking that Sasha was seeing red. In spite of your opinion of her, you feared for Vicky’s safety. Leaning back slightly over Sasha’s shoulder to look at her in the eyes, Vicky took notice and looked toward you. Without making a sound, you mouthed the word “go.”

Amazingly, she took the hint. Slowly getting to her feet, Vicky turned and walked away into the woods. Not once looking back. The entire time, Sasha kept her eyes firmly focused on Vicky as she left. With Vicky gone, the task of disarming the husky girl was your next priority. And that had to be done carefully, lest Sasha decide to release her rage upon you.

“Sasha….”

Cautiously, you reached forward and softly grabbed both of her shoulders. She jumped violently at the touch and turned to look at you. Tears were quickly beginning to form in her eyes.

“Sasha, it’s alright.” You say softly.

At last, Sasha’s spirit crumbled. She threw both arms around you and buried her face into your chest, sobbing uncontrollably. You too wrapped your arms around her and pulled her tight. Both of you stood there for several minutes until Sasha’s crying finally subsided. Pulling away from her a little, you reached with your hand to lift her face to look at yours.

“Come on, let’s go back inside.”

Sasha nodded slowly at your suggestion. The two of you slowly walked toward the farm house, your arms still wrapped around each other. Nearby, Bess the Cow and Marie the Mare had watched the whole ordeal in silence. Both feeling immensely proud and sympathetic to Sasha for finally standing up to Vicky, and for all the years of heartache she had to endure. Once inside, Tara met the two of you at the backdoor with one eyebrow raised in curiosity.

“What was going on out there? All that shouting woke me up.” She said impatiently.

“Vicky denounced their friendship completely.” You explained. “She then went back to her den with a dislocated jaw thanks to Sasha.”

You made a gesture with your fist meeting your chin. Tara’s eyes widened at this, but her expression changed to a devious smirk.

“So you finally gave that bitch what she deserved! Oh I wish I could’ve seen that!”

Sasha smiled at Tara’s excitement. Heading into the kitchen, you sat Sasha down at the kitchen while Tara got her a glass of water. Sasha was thankful, but the sadness could still be seen in her eyes.

“You know what, I’ll make dinner tonight. I think Sasha could use a break tonight. Want to help Tara?” you said, heading to the pantry in the basement. It was more of a command than a question.

“Hmph, Fine.” Tara said with a roll of her eyes, following behind.

===================================

After dinner, the three of you retreated into the living room and piled onto the couch, with Sasha leaning up against your arm while Tara sat on the floor against Sasha’s legs. A police drama was playing on the television, bathing everyone in an alien blue light. No one had said a word since coming in. A soft cool breeze blew through the windows from behind.

An officer on the TV opened fire on a terrorist, foiling the criminal’s escape attempt from prison. Tara pumped her fist in celebration, you clapped lightly as the credits rolled.

“It’s getting late” said Sasha.

“Yeah it is.” You said, not really paying attention.

At that moment, Sasha slid herself out from yours arms and began walking toward the stairs. Surprised and a little worried, you turned the TV off and quickly got to your feet.

“Hey, where are you going?” you asked.

“I’m going to bed, it’s been…..a long day” she said without looking at you.

“Are you sure you’re okay?”

“I’m fine, I’m just tired” she said.

“Need anything? Snack? Drink?”

“No I’m fine, goodnight” she said without emotion.

She was halfway up the stairs when you spoke again.

“Do you want to sleep together again?” you asked.

Sasha stopped dead in her tracks, her eyes widening in surprise.

“I know that sounded really REALLY awkward.” You said in defense. “But it’s just, today you just told off one of your oldest friends….because you realized they really weren’t who you thought they were. If I was in that position…..last thing I would want is to be alone.”

Real smooth…. You thought sarcastically.

The silence that pervaded the room was unbearable. If Sasha’s rejection didn’t crush you, the embarrassment from your little speech surely would.

“Yes….”

You flinched.

“….I would like that.” Sasha said with a soft smile.

With a smile of your own, the two of you headed upstairs toward your room. Leaving Tara alone downstairs, who stretched out her arms and legs once before curling into a ball on the floor, having witnessed the whole conversation.

“Moron” Tara said quietly.

=================

Removing your shirt and jeans, you slipped into a pair of clean sleeping shorts. Unbeknownst to you, Sasha was watching you undress and change into your sleep attire very intently. She looked away quickly as soon as you were finished and turned to face her. Pulling the covers back, you allowed Sasha to lay down first before you crawled in bed next to her.

No one said a word for several minutes. The two of you lost in silent thought. Summing up a bit of courage, you decided to try some small talk.

“Quite a day today.” You said.

“Yeah…”

“Marie was fine, she wanted to run with me again, I’ll have to accept her offer eventually I suppose…”

“Hmmm” she said.

“Bess was cheery, quite a chatterbox, where as Jane…..isn’t” you finished lamely.

Sasha didn’t reply. The whole bedroom fell silent. After what seemed to be an eternity, you spoke.

“You had every right to say what you said to her. She was the one who trumped your friendship. She was the one who chose to be heartless, not you”. You said.
“So why doesn’t it feel that way? Why do I feel so….so…so horrible?” she said, nearly breaking into tears again.

Placing both arms around her, you pulled her closer, softly rubbing her back.

“Because…” you began, picking your words carefully, “Because you are a good person Sasha. I haven’t been here long, but I know that much. You are cheery, kind and very sweet from sun rise to sun set. Any problem that arises you tackle it head on. You never give up, especially not on the person you’re helping. I mean, think about it, Tara is still here right?”

Sasha chuckled at that last statement, a smile forming on her face.

“You feel bad because despite your anger, you never gave up on her, did you?”

“…..No” she said with a frown.

“Annnd let me guess, you probably still haven’t, even after today.”

“No, I haven’t” said Sasha more firmly.

“See what I mean? Good person…dog…thingamajig.”

Sasha playfully pounded your shoulder with a fist.

“Ow! What did I say?” You asked, your smile never fading.

Sasha smiled as well. “Thank you for being there. And….I’m really glad you came here to live with us.” She said softly, lowering her head on to a pillow, eyes half shut.

You smiled at her. “Goodnight Sasha.”

“Good….ni…”

You looked down to see why she trailed off her sentence, only to find Sasha fast asleep, snoring gently. Chuckling to yourself, you turned off the bedside lamp and laid back down in bed, keeping the warm husky girl safe in your arms.
12311121221112.title: Vicky quietly gets up and leaves, and doesn'...

1231112122112.content:
For a moment, Sasha just sat there, as though her brain was trying to comprehend what Vicky said. Then,she buries her face in her hands, sobbing and whining like a puppy. "That's right, cry." Said Vicky. "I'd cry too if I was as pathetic as you."



At that point, something deep down in you suddenly boils up, something that makes you want to just grab Vicky by the throat and strangle her. That something...is rage.



You get up off the porch and walk towards Vicky. "See that?" She says. "Already your so called boyfriend is coming to..." WHAM! Vicky is cut off mid-sentence as your fist makes contact with her nose. You hear a loud crunch as the force of your blow sends Vicky onto her back.



Vicky clutches her nose as blood pours down her front. "You deserve worse you heartless bitch!" You yell. "" I love Sasha for who she is, not for how she looks!" Sasha stops crying as hear ear prick up and she looks at you upon hearing that. "All the guys you ever fucked, they just wanted you for your body, didn't they? They never loved you for who you are.What did you do for a living on your home planet anyway? Porn star? Stripper? Hooker? A combination of the three?" Looks like you finally found something that struck a cord with Vicky, because when you say that, her eyes begin to tear.



"Sasha is the nicest, kindest, most beautiful woman I've ever met, much better than a whore like you! Now I'm going inside and getting the shotgun above the fireplace. If you're not gone when I get back, I'm gonna have a new rug in the living room."



You turn on your heel and stomp inside the house. When you come back out, shotgun in hand, Vicky is gone. "Where did she go?" You ask Sasha. "She ran off into the woods, crying." You sit next to Sasha on the steps again, placing the shotgun across your lap, and sigh, releasing some of the raw hatred you felt for Vicky. For a moment, you and Sasha sit there in silence, before she finally says....
1231112122112.title: She Had it Coming

12311121221121.content:
You look to Sasha, smiling a bit in agreement with her words, gently taking her hand and giving it a squeeze. "yeah...and now, I get the feeling we won't be having anymore trouble with our chicken coop." you reply, smiling a bit, before taking the shotgun from your lap and slowly standing up, before walking inside with Sasha, letting her go first in an act of chivalry before following behind and closing the door.

Tara was in the kitchen, looking like she'd been woken up from all the racket, and looking to the two of you with a smirk on her feline face. "you actually did it didn't you? you went and gave that smug bitch what she had coming to her?" she asked, smiling as you nodded, walking past her to the fireplace and slowly dusting off the shotgun, placing it back on its mounting and stepping back, content that you probably wouldn't ever need it again.

you stood there for a little bit, before blushing as you felt Sasha slowly grab your arm, hugging it as she stood next to you, head on your shoulder, eyes closed with a smile on her face. You smiled, knowing in your heart that just one of her was equal to a million Vicky's, you slowly freed your arm, Sasha looking confused till you put your arms around her, pulling the canine into a caring kiss, which happily she reciprocated, tail wagging as Tara watched,proud of Sasha, then went to get something to eat.

That night, Sasha treated you to a specially cooked meal, then you both sat on the porch looking at the moon, till finally she fell asleep in your arms, after which you brought her upstairs to bed, laying her down and then laying with her, putting your arms around her, keeping her safe as you drifted off to sleep in each others arms.
12311121221121.title: "Thanks for that. She deserved it."

12311121221122.content:
"Don't you think that was a little harsh, even for her?" Sasha asks.



You give a long sigh. "You know, looking back on it now, I guess it was. I mean, I've never witnessed someone say those kinds of things up close, even if they were ex-friends. Hearing her say all that just caused my to return everything she gave, with interest. Under normal circumstances, I would never say those kinds of things, or put my hands on a woman. I guess my anger got the best of me. I should've known that I went overboard when I saw her eyes tear up."



"I understand what you're saying." says Sasha. "I only asked because when you asked her about what she did on our home planet, it reminded me of some rumors that I heard about her having sex for money. I don't know if they're true or not. Either Vicky's crying because it is true and she regrets it, or she's crying because what you said reminded her of the rumor."



"Oh, great." you say. "Now I feel kind of bad."



"Well, that just means you have a conscience." she says in an attempt to ease your guilt. "Honestly, I'd be worried if you didn't feel sorry for her."



"Thanks." you say. After a minute of silence, you tell Sasha, "I did mean all that stuff I said about you, though."



"Even the 'beautiful' part?" she asks.



"Especially that part." you answer.



The two of you look into each other's eyes for awhile, until you both kiss passionately for a good ten seconds. When you go inside the house, you sit on the couch with Sasha laying down on your lap, her belly facing up. You gently rub her stomach, which makes her smile as she rests her head on you. Later on, Sasha says to you, "You know, I can't help but wonder how Vicky's doing." You wondered the same thing, too. Then again, you don't want to bother her. What should you do?
12311121221122.title: In Retrospect... Yes.

123111212211221.content:
"You know, I was thinking the same thing." you say. "Maybe we should pay her a visit."



The next day, you were getting ready to make the trip to Vicky's den. When you were about to go downstairs, Tara approaches you. "I saw what happened yesterday." she says. "Needless to say, I'm kind of surprised. Firstly at Sasha crying, secondly at you slugging Vicky, and lastly at her running off, crying." "Yeah, so am I." you answer. "So where are you headed?" she asks. "Sasha and I are going to Vicky's den to see how she's doing." you answer.



"Let me guess, you feel a little guilty." Tara says. "How did you guess?" you ask. "Feline intuition." she answers. "Anyway, I hope all goes well." You look at Tara for a second. "You know, this is the nicest you've ever been to me." you say. "Well, I may be moody, but I don't hold grudges." she says. "Besides, if I could trust Derrick, who's to say I can't trust you?" You smile at what she says. "Thanks." you say to her.



As you get on the porch, you see Sasha waiting for you. "You remember the way to Vicky's den right?" she asks.



"Vaguely." you answer. "I expected as much." she says. The two of you make your way through the forest to Vicky's den. You look into the cave and see that...

1231112122112211.title: Vicky is just fine.

choices: "Let me stay on the farm. Be part of your loving family".
1231112122112212.content:
You both look into the cave and at a wall lies Vicky next to it, still sobbing despite the time. Your words must have impacted like a train. You walk slowly over to her who's looking up at you in both sadness and a bit of fear, after all you did swing her a hook and threatened to kill her and make a rug out of her. It's a surprise she didn't run away. You sat down next to her and stroked your hands through her hair. "Vicky, I didn't really mean those words. Well, at the time I did." You think to yourself as to how you can clarify your prior actions.

"Yes you are beautiful. I find you very desirable. But I don't your a whore, or a stripper or a porn star. Your just shallow. You deserve love from someone. Everyone does, because love can change someone completely. Hopefully it would make you a nicer person, and I know that person is in you somewhere. Bottom line though, I'm sorry for calling you a whore and degrading you and punching you and threatening to kill and skin you. I know I can't make up for it but I can try." It was strange how sorry you felt for her, and she truly does seem misunderstood, possibly showing vanity as a cover.

Vicky looks at you with her beautiful, though sad eyes and gives you a firm hug, with you returning the favor. "Thank you. I'm grateful that you, a virtual stranger, even cared enough to comfort me. I would like to ask you something though." Vicky looks at you in an awkward but hopeful way. "What is it Vicky?"
1231112122112212.title: Comfort

choices: "Sasha, but you are welcome as loving family at the farm."
"Vicky, I will always have a friend in Sasha."
12311121221122121.content:
That one sentence. All it takes to leave you dumbfounded. Sasha was there and heard what she said and she too is left open-mouthed in disbelief. You ask Vicky to explain this. "But why would you want me after all I've done?" you ask aware of the humiliation she suffered at your hands. "I know what you did to me was horrible but you apologized in such a sincere way and gave me hope. And I would like to return the kindness. After all who would have thought you would be so kind to me, never mind come back and see me again?"

Vicky's statement is no doubt sensible and after all she is a gorgeous creature. But you look back at Sasha, still dumbfounded. "If you feel it best, do it. We'll still be best of friends and it would give an old friend hope." It's strange how sincere and open Sasha is being towards Vicky despite her verbal thrashing earlier. So you're at a crossroads. The kindhearted and lovely husky Sasha or the seductive and hopefully reformed vixen Vicky
12311121221122121.title: Crossroads Of Love

This choice will be controversial either way, so the only way to break the deadlock is to put it down to beauty. In this case, you always choose the vixen, even the word is somehow sexy. "I choose Vicky. She needs all the love she can get. I'm... I'm sorry Sasha." You look at Sasha, expecting her to rip your throat out for choosing Vicky, but she kept her promise. "It's okay, Vicky deserves all the love she can get from you." She seems sincere and didn't seem to show any hint of contempt towards either of you. You look at Vicky in her admittedly beautiful eyes and reach in for a kiss. The kiss proves quite a long one at at least a minute, thanks to Vicky's willingness to return the favor.

123111212211221212.title: A Deadlock Broken By Beauty

123112.content:
"I wouldn't worry about that," I said as I put a hand on Sasha's fuzzy shoulder.

She immediately turned to look at me, tilting her head in confusion as a single tear crawled steadily down from her right eye. "Why?" she said slowly.

I breathed in and let out a sigh before answering. "Because, if things had gone down differently back then, you might not have become the awesome person you are today."

Sasha's jaw dropped open as I said that, her face turning bright red. "Aw," she said as she quickly looked away, "You don't really mean that..."

I smiled. "Of course I do," I said happily. "I don't know a lot of girls who can use a lever-action shotgun, and I don't know any girls who can use a lever-action shotgun one-handed."

Sasha chuckled slightly, wiping away her tears with her hand. "Yeah...your uncle taught me. Specifically for when Vicky shows up. I'll have to teach you sometime."

"Are the rounds lethal?" I asked, glancing warily at the shotgun resting on its stand above the fireplace.

"No!" she said quickly. "It's just rubber buckshot! I mean, I'm still pretty mad at her for what she did, but I'm not mad enough to actually kill her."

I nodded. That made sense. As much sense as anything did on my uncle's farm.

"Still," Sasha continued, "Rubber buckshot stings like a bitch. Next time she comes around here, I'll be sure to give her a taste, just for old times' sake."

"That's the spirit," I grinned. Before I could say anything else, Sasha turned and gave me a hug.

"Thank you," she said over my shoulder. "I needed that."

"No problem," I said as I patted her on the back, "It's what I'm here for."

Sasha eventually let me out of the hug, giving me a quick kiss on the cheek before standing up and making her way into the kitchen. I instinctively wiped the side of my face with my hand. Sure, she didn't actually lick me, but her kiss was still somewhat...slobbery. I couldn't help but smile, though. Mission accomplished, I thought to myself.

I sat there in the living room for a while, reflecting on everything that had happened today. My mind came back to Bess and her oversized breasts several times, as much as I tried to avoid picturing them. Even so, I eventually managed to remember the list of tasks Sasha had given me that morning. Accounting for what I had already done, there were only really two things I still had left to do. I could go and shear Jane, or introduce myself to Luna.

Looking at my watch and seeing that it was still before noon, I decided to...
123112.title: Thanks For The Memories

12312.content:
"Wow, that long?" you ask in disbelief.

"What do you mean that long! We're only twenty two years old!" Sasha says, offended.

"No, I didn't mean it like that." you say quickly. "What I meant was-"

"I'm just messing with you." Sasha says, laughing. "You get flustered just as easily as Derrick." You glare at Sasha.

"Anyways, Vicky and I never liked each other," she explains. "It all started when we met in first grade on our home planet, Vicky was-"

"Wait, you guys are all from another planet." you say in shock. How could Sasha just say that so casually as if it weren't important?

"What, did you expect us to be from Earth?" she asks sarcastically.

"No, but... Whatever, keep telling the story."

Sasha rolls her eyes. "As I was saying, Vicky was the new girl at school, and let's just say that she didn't leave a good first impression on me. Since day one, she's been pulling pranks on me. By the time we got to middle school, I had gotten a little wiser and was able to outsmart most of her pranks, but then we got to high school. Vicky dad to have gotten smarter during that summer between middle and high school. Not only did her pranks get more clever, she started gossiping and spreading rumors about me. Needless to say, I was miserable throughout high school."

It was at this point that you begin to feel sorry for Sasha. You had to deal with bullies and rumors during high school, but based on Sasha's description, she had it worse than you. Sasha continues on with her story.

"I didn't see much of Vicky after high school, which gave me some relief, but one day, I was walking down the street when I ran into her. Of course, we started arguing, but then some weird portal appeared near us, and the next thing we knew, we were whisked off to Earth, on this farm."

"Wow, I never would've guessed..." you say.

"Well, since I have you, Tara and the others, dealing with Vicky takes a lot less of a toll on me than it used to." Sasha says.

"That's good to know," you say, as the two of you head into the house.

That night as you were sleeping, something nudges you, and you wake up. "What is it Sasha?" you say, looking up at her, your eyes still focusing on her.

"I heard some shuffling around in the kitchen." she says "I need you to come with me." You wonder why she needed you to go with her, but you go anyway. When the two of you go downstairs, you see the lights on in the kitchen. When you look inside you see...
12312.title: An Extensive History

123121.content:
You were both surprised and relieved to see Tara sitting the in the kitchen, lapping a bowl of milk; you were surprised because Tara looked like the type of girl that would be hard to wake up in the middle of the night, and you were relieved because you were worried that somebody dangerous had broken into the house. Tara looks up at you and Sasha and raises an eyebrow.

"Can I help you two?" she says sarcastically.

"You can help us by getting back to bed." Sasha says back. "What are you even doing here in the middle of the night? You know how I feel about you getting midnight snacks."

"So I guess this has happened before." you think to yourself.

"What's the big deal?" Tara asks.

"The big deal is that you scared me half to death!" Sasha argues. "Besides, just because Bess has had extra milk lately doesn't mean that you can just sneak an extra bowl of milk."

Tara grunts in frustration. "I really hate cliche sayings, Sasha, but there's no use crying over spilled milk. It's not that big of a deal." As she said that, she finished off the rest of her milk and put the bowl in the sink. She then turns around and walks past you and Sasha.

"I'm not one to agree with Vicky," says Tara, "but you really do act like everyone's mother. You need to loosen up a little."

Sasha was going to say something, but decided not to, because at this point, it would just be wasted breath. There was still some leftover tension in the air, so you decide to get rid of it. "Well, since there was nothing to worry about, we should get to bed." you say as you turn off the lights in the kitchen and head upstairs.

The next morning.....

1231212.title: Sasha's acting strange...

123121221.content:
“Hey Sasha,” you say as you walk past her.

“[your name] I need to talk to you,” she say and you both sit on the couch. “Every once and a while anthro females go through a period where their sex drive increases a bit like the heat cycle in females of regular animals making us hyper and sometimes more irritable. It occurs every one to two years at least once sometimes twice in that year and can last for several days to a week.”

“Why are you telling me this?” You ask but as you think it through you understand why. “This has to do with Vicky doesn’t it?”

“Yes, usually females can maintain themselves at not acting on it when they don’t want to, but someone like Vicky might try something. So keep a close eye out for her during the spring and fall because she probably will be more tempted to try something with you at those times,” She says. “Then there’s me.”

“You,” you say in confusion.

“It becomes stronger for us if a male one likes and is starting to have feelings for is around,” she says. That sentence really sticks as you think what she said through.

“What do you mean by that?” You ask.

“I’m start to have feelings…for…you,” She stutters a bit.

“You…you have feelings for me?” You ask uncertain.

“Yes,” she says quietly and stares at you. You both stare into each other’s eyes and kiss.

Then Tara calls from the kitchen, “Hey, don’t mean to interrupt but are you to going to eat breakfast?”

“Come on we have work to do,” Sasha says and heads for the table. You sit there thinking of Sasha’s to your last question until Sasha says, “Are you coming?”

“Yeah,” you say and join her for breakfast. The whole rest of the day you think of what Sasha told you, her answer to your one question and the idea of a relationship with her. ‘Why not?’ You think. ‘She doesn’t mind that I’m human and I like her, okay starting to love her.’ With everything done for the day you head for the house ready to admit your feelings to Sasha.
123121221.title: Sasha admits her feelings

123121222.content:
“Where’s Sasha?” You ask not seeing anywhere.

“She’s still in her room,” Tara says. “I think something’s bothering her, she didn’t sleep well last night and hasn’t come out yet. She’s usually out here before me.”

“I wondered, because she never woke me up this morning,” You say. “Did you ask her if she was alright?”

“I tried talking to her but she didn’t seem interested but you can try if you want,” Tara says.

You knock on the bedroom door, “Sasha may I come in.”

She nods silently and you enter. “Do you want to talk about it?” You ask.

She stays silent for a moment then says, “I’m pregnant and before you ask you’re not the dad. He was an anthro husky I fell in love with.

“There’s more anthros from your home world? When did this happen?” You ask.

“Several years ago,” Sasha says. “He came here the same way the rest of us did but ended up on a railroad track in the mountains. One day he passed through here tired, dehydrated and in need of help because he fell down in rough terrain so we took care of him and he and I fell in love. He was the only other we’ve seen since we got here. I never mentioned him before because I found difficult to talk about this until now and I asked the others not to mention him to you because I wanted to be the one to tell you when I was ready.”

“Where is he? I can’t imagine he wouldn’t be around now,” You say.

“He was attacked by a bear and died in my arms. I never had a chance to tell him I was with child,” she says her voice breaking and then breaks down crying.

“Oh Sasha I’m so sorry,” You say and wrap her in a hug as she silently cries into your shoulder.

“He was great with the farm work so I wasn’t too worried when your uncle died; now with him gone I don’t know how I’ll manage the farm work and being a mother when my child’s born,” she says. “I didn’t sleep well last night because I was stressing about all of this.”
As you’re stroking her head and ears you think of something, a big decision for you. “I doubt I can replace what he was to you but I’m more than willing to help you raise your child.”

Sasha looks up at you, “You really mean that?”

“Of course I do, he or she is going to need a father figure and I’m the only male around. You don’t have to worry either because you also have Tara, Bess, Marie, Luna and Jane to help you,” You say.

“Well when I feel like it, you know me,” Tara says in teasing tone trying to lighten Sasha’s mood as she walked in. Then in a more serious tone says, “[your name] is right Sasha, you’re not alone here we’ll help you when you need it. The only one we’ll have to watch out for is Vicky but with the way you get when she’s causing trouble driven by maternal instinct I think Vicky will some bad luck along the way.”

Sasha gives you a small lick on your lips followed by a kiss, “Thank you [you name] and thank you Tara.”

You pat her head and say, “Now come on, I’m hungry for breakfast and you have to eat for two. Then we have work to do and Tara has naps to take.”

“You haven’t been here for very long yet and you already have me figured out. I guess I’m more predictable than I thought, that’s scary,” Tara says with a big smile.

“Come on Sasha.”

“Do we have to?” She says in a playful tone.

“Yes now let’s go,” You say with a smile holding a hand out. She takes and you walk together into the kitchen with Tara following. The rest of the day passed without incident.
123121222.title: Congradulations Sasha

123122.content:
You and Sasha are surprised to see Vicky just sitting there in the kitchen, as if she lived here. Naturally, Sasha got really upset. "WHAT THE HELL ARE YOU DOING IN HERE!?" Sasha asks furiously.

Vicky sighs. "You know, Sasha, you should really control that temper of yours. It'll make you age quicker."

"Why you-" before Sasha finishes that sentence, you put your arm in front of her. "What do you want, Vicky?" you ask calmly, but sternly.

"Well, a little birdie told me that Sasha told you about her history with me." the vixen explains.

"What of it?" Sasha asks.

Vicky gets up and walks towards you, "Well, I was wondering if you'd like to hear my side of the story." she runs her finger down your chest as she says that.

"Don't you dare touch him!" Sasha yells.

"There you go again Sasha." Vicky says. "Always acting like somebody's mother." You could've sworn that you saw Sasha's face turn red at that remark. "Why should he have to listen to you?" she asks, repressing the urge to attack her. "You always lie through your teeth."

"Don't you think he should be the judge of that?" Vicky says, wrapping her arms around you, laying her head on your chest. You were extremely uncomfortable now, and Sasha started growling. "Besides, it's only fair that he hears both sides of the story."

You were naturally a nice person. You'd always listen to both sides, but Sasha said that Vicky always lies. On the other hand, Sasha might not want you to listen to Vicky because she doesn't like her. What do you do?
123122.title: INTRUDER ALERT! INTRUDER ALERT!

1231221.content:
You sigh and look at Sasha. "You know, let's just listen to her."

"Weren't you listening to me, [your name]!?" Sasha say, even more frustrated. "She lies through her teeth!"

"We'll hear what she has to say, then we'll kick her out." you say.

"Why waste your time?" she asks.

"Just chill out, Sasha." says Vicky. "What's the harm in hearing what I have to say? Just sit and stay like a good wittle doggy."

Sasha growled loudly. She was getting angrier by the second.

"Before you start, Vicky, you should know that I've good reason to doubt you." you say.

"Fine by me. All I ask is that you hear me out." she says, then points to Sasha. "Oh, and keep her under control. I don't want any rude interruptions."

Sasha was about to jump Vicky, but you rub her shoulder to calm her down.
1231221.title: Hear Her Out

1232.content:
Suddenly you hear a loud crash behind you. "Looks like Luna is awake." Bess says.

"Ahh... my head..." Luna says, rubbing the spot where she landed.

"It's not like you to wake up like that." Marie says with a smile. "Bad dream?"

"No, I think I just lost my grip." Luna says. "Who's this." she says, looking at you.

"Oh, this is Derrick's nephew." Bess says. "He looks just like him, doesn't he!"

You were a little confused. When you last looked at a picture of your uncle, the two of you looked nothing alike.

"Eh, I don't see the resemblance." Luna says. "Are you kidding me?" the cow argues. "He's a spitting image!"

"To be honest, Bess, I don't see it, either." Marie says. "Oh you youngsters must be blind!" Bess says. "Or maybe your age is finally catching up with you." Marie mutters with a smirk.

SMACK!

"Ow!" she says.

"That's for calling me old! I'm not that old!" Bess says. You had to agree with her. You didn't know how furries aged, but she looks about 35 at the most. You couldn't help but ask.

"Um... Bess." you say.

"Yes?" she answered.

"If you don't mind my asking, how old are you?"
1232.title: CRASH!

choices: Another loud noise draws your attention.
12322.content:
"32", Bess replies.

"Really?" you say with apprehension.

"Exactly," Bess says. Marie explains: "You might not have known, but we do not age as fast as our normal cousins. We age at the same rate you do."

"So, what age are you?"

"I'm 34."

"I'm 36," Luna says. "Jane is 35, Tara is 30 and Sasha is 37. We were mostly teenagers when your uncle found us."

You are surprised by this last piece of information. That must mean your uncle must have had at most twenty years left. Their slower aging might mean something. You do not know exactly what's going on. You want to get more information, but you do not feel like it right now.
12322.title: She's 32

124.content:
“sorry I can't right now, I think I should get all the chores I have done before I play.” you say

she smiles and says “well your loss, maybe later than?”

“Defiantly” you reply as you begin walking away. Soon he heard the loud clomping of Marie running in the opposite direction as you

Wondering where you should go next you think about Bess probably in some pain from what Sasha told you. But as you look around you see what looks like a white cloud walking around in the grass periodically getting lower and then moments later getting up and moving around some more. Curious, you decide to go investigate what it is.

As you got closer you notice it was a big ball of wool. Thinking back to your talk with Sasha you decide it is probably Jane because Sasha did tell you she hadn't been sheared in a really long time.

As you neared you saw two black things on top of the mass of wool twitch and quickly she turns to look at you, she looked like she was about to run when you said “Wait please don't run I won't hurt you Jane. I am new to this farm and I was just going around to meet everyone and help them out with there “problems”.” she stopped and looked at you then relaxed a little. As you looked at her she looked like she was a little pudgy but there was just so much wool you couldn't tell where the wool ended and she began.

You slowly walked up to her and stuck your hand out suddenly making her jump a little then you said “if you want I can shear you, I mean that coat sure looks hot and heavy.”

she looks you over and then hesitantly takes your hand. You smile at her and say. “Lets head to the barn, I think that is where the shears are.” She nods and follows you still holding your hand.

After you find the barn and look kind of lost she quietly takes the lead and pulls you into a small horse stall that was rigged into a private room with high walls and a completely wooden door with no windows or anything. on one side there was a mirror and on the opposite side There was a desk with an electric razor and a tool box on it, and a dusty note in your uncles hand writing that said

Dear nephew,

if you are reading this note then that means I have passed on and you have come to take care of my farm. I am leaving this note because I finally lost the strength to shear poor Jane. It just hurt me to much to even try which is why she hasn't been shears in a while. But that isn't the reason for this note, it is to tell you how she likes to be trimmed (if you haven’t noticed she is shy and doesn’t like to talk.) but over the years I found she preferred to keep some wool over her privates both above and below. Not much just enough to hide these spots (try to blend them so they look nice).

And finally I wanted to thank you again, there weren’t many people I liked or trusted enough to give this special place to and I am just glad it went to you.

As you finished reading the note you looked at Jane sitting on a stool looking at a bug that was flying around the room.

You smiled and picked up the razor and turned it on. And walked to her back running a straight line down her back you could tell it would take a couple strokes to get the mass of wool off her. It took about 20 minutes to clean off her arms, legs, back and stomach. You were surprised at how good of shape she was in, the more you took off her the better she looked.

Carefully you trimmed the wool off her breasts leaving a line all the way around like a tube top while shearing off enough so it covers just enough. Then you did the same thing to her lower region giving her a short skit looking patch of wool.

You were about to start on her head but she stopped you and pointed to the tool box. You walked over and looked inside. Inside the box you saw some scissors and a straightener thinking you got what she wanted you pulled out the scissors and curler and went to work you told her that you weren’t the best barber but you would give it a shot. She blushed and bowed her head. First thing you did was straighten it careful to avoid her ears. Then you cut it just a little bit so everything was even. You sat there for a couple minutes trying to make sure it looked good. Finally, you stopped and told her to look and see if that was good. She got up and looked at herself in the mirror. She turned from one side to the other and then looked at you.

You were getting kind of tired of her quietness but asked “so do you like it?” she smiled and nodded then looked down at the ground as she blushed a deep red.

“Cool, well is there anything else I can do for you?”

she shook her head still looking at the ground.

“OK I am going to clean up your wool where should I put it?”

she looked at you then walked over to you genitally grabbed your hand and pulled you out of the room then she walked back in and shut the door.

You stood there for a moment before saying to yourself “i guess that is her way of saying she will do that.”
124.title: You go shear Jane

1243.content: As you enter the yard you hear a strange rumbling sound from behind the barn As you walk around you see
1243.title: something else

13.content:
“I guess I should go wake up Luna.” You say. “In that case, wait right here.” Sasha leaves the kitchen and heads upstairs for a minute. When she gets back, she hands you a small revolver pistol. “Don’t worry,” She says. “It’s loaded with blanks.” “What would I need this for?” You ask. Sasha smirks. “Oh, you’ll see. Luna likes to hang out in the barn, so you better get going.”


When you reach the barn and look inside, you see that Sasha had meant that literally. Luna was hanging upside-down from one of the barn’s rafters, her wings wrapped tightly around her body, obscuring her face. “Hello?” You say, with no response. “Hello?” You repeat, louder this time, still nothing. You repeatedly call out to Luna getting progressively louder, but she remains asleep. You look at the revolver in your hand and suddenly realize why Sasha gave it to you. You point it straight up and pull the trigger once.


BANG!


With a cry of surprise, Luna instantly wakes up and lets go of her perch plummeting towards the ground, flailing her wings. Fortunately, there was a large pile of straw right below her, so she landed unharmed. She irritably gets on her feet, brushing straw off of her body. “What the hell is wrong with you?” She says angrily, then she sees notices that it is still morning.


“I’m supposed to get fourteen hours of sleep a day! It can’t be later than 9 AM! Who are you anyway?” “I’m the new caretaker of the farm.” You say. “Sasha told me I should wake you, just so you would know I was here.” Luna visibly calmed down a bit on hearing this. “Oh. Well, I’m sorry I yelled at you then. I just don’t like to be disturbed, you know?” You nod.


Now you were able to get a good look at her. She was covered from head to tow in black fur, except for a single white stripe stretching across her scalp from her nose to her back of her head. Her ears were long and pointy, standing straight up from her head. Her arms doubled as her wings, each on must have been five feet long at least. Her nose was bright pink, giving her a somewhat cute appearance.


“So, now that I’ve met you, can I get back to sleep?” She asks. You nod, but as she spreads her wings to fly up to her perch, her stomach growls. “I suppose I had better have a early-morning snack first.” She says, blushing. “Maybe I can get you something.” You offer. “What do you eat?”
13.title: Go wake Luna

132.content:
"I like fruit, Go get me some. Their should be plenty around." She said grumpily retaining to her beam, "Come back here with some, I'm not ready to move about so much."
She warped herself in her wings, "Go all ready," She moaned.

Having no idea wear to check, you left.
You were looking all over the place for some, when you came across Sasha.
"Hey there," she said happy to see you, "How are you."
"I'm good, but do you know were any fruit is?" You ask
"Yeah, their are some in the fridge, but if it's for Luna, you will need a lot more, she has an appetite at this time and she dislikes the chilled food.
There will be plenty of fruit on trees. I could help you pick them if you want."
"Thank you," You said.

She turned and walked over to the nearby arched.
Sasha looked up the tree, as you did.
You could see in this tree, were hundreds of apples.
And the tree behind held all-kinds of fruit.
"Luna like a varied meal, so get some of each fruit. You can collect the fruit with the baskets in there," Sasha said pointing at the shed nearby.

You walked over their and looked inside.
There was hand-weaved baskets, varies old garden tools and other things.
You picked up a baskets, as you let the barn you noticed a ladder was resting against the shed.
You grabbed it and dragged it with you to the tree that Sasha was stood by.

When you got their as she was gone, you looked around when, "Head's up"
Then, a figure dropped by, making you jump.
"You got the basket," she said pouring the arms full of apples into the basket.
"Lets go fruit picking," She says.
After a 10-15 minutes routine, of her charging up a tree to get some fruit and jump down, while you move the ladder and go up, collect fruit and climb down, You two had filled the basket.

"Thank for helping me pick these fruit," you thanked Sasha, while you two took the basket to the barn.
"I'm glad to help out," she smiled.

You two entered the barn.
"Luna," Sasha yelled.
She twitched, loosening her wings and sniffed at the air.
Her wings flung open and she flew down, to the basket.
"Don't you have choirs to do," she said after you watched her eat for several minutes, "Surely they is something better for you to do, then watch me eat."
"Oh yeah," you said going to.....
132.title: "Fruit."

choices: There's a noise from the barn
133.content:
"I drink blood" Luna replies a small smile spreading across her face as she stared at you. You froze realizing that what you thought had been her simply looking you over was probably her trying to find the best spot to bite you. Before you could move you felt her grab your shoulders, completely forgetting the length of her arms she had easily gotten within reach and now while you couldn't feel the claws on her fingers pressing into your skin, you could feel the strength of her grip.

"Luna, isn't there something else I could get you, milk, fruit juice, maybe we have some tomato juice that's kind of like blood" you say trying to keep calm, Luna just shakes her head and takes a step towards you, causing you to take one back. The smile on her face grows as step by step you both move backwards until "thunk" you fell your body hit the bard door.

Luna smiles for a second at you her calm demeanor doing little to soothe your nerves, "don't worry it doesn't hurt" she says before she was upon you. She somehow covered the meter length between the two of you in a second her mouth opening revealing her fangs which glittered in the morning sun for just a second before sinking into the area between your shoulder and your neck. You recoiled instinctively your body pressing itself flat against the door as Luna pressed herself against you. True to her word it didn't hurt, and unlike all those vampires movies it didn't seem that she was sucking up the blood, in fact she just let the blood well up from the wound, then she lapped it up. She continued this for a few minutes thankfully it seemed she only took as much as they'd take if you gave blood, so Luna took about a pint as you didn't feel too light-headed as she lifted her head from the wound. You were suprised as Luna pressed her lips against your cheek giving you a bloody kiss "you were delicious farmer" she says letting her weight and her body rest on you for a few seconds before taking a step back. "If you're up late, you should come meet me out in the field, I promise you'll enjoy what you find" she says before taking a few steps back, jumping, and flying back up into the rafters where she cocooned herself in her wings and went back to sleep.

You slid back against the door, suddenly all strength leaving your body. You just lay there for a few seconds, finally having the sense to look over at the wound in your upper body. Surprisingly it wasn't bleeding, in fact other than two small almost pinprick sized wounds in your shoulder, it looked like nothing had happened. You sat there for a minute just getting your strength back before standing up, you see a tub and since you were in the barn anyways you decided you might as well milk Bess. Grabbing the tub you pull it over to the one stall that looked occupied. You looked inside to see a black and white cow who had to be Bess as she stood against the back of the wall although she was having difficulty standing, what with the fact there were two pink beach balls hanging from the front of her body.

"Hello" she says her a smile quickly breaking out over her face.

"Hi" you reply a small smile crossing your face as she looked at you. She took a single step forward, then rushed towards you seeming to forget about the size of her overfilled mamarries.

Needless to say you were knocked over into the hay and she stopped, blushing for a second, "I'm sorry about that, it's just your shoulder" she says pointing to the wound Luna had caused.

"Oh that" you say waving it off, "Luna was hungry and well.." you trail off.

"You offered her breakfast, I heard...I don't know why Sasha didn't tell you" Bess says.

"It's fine, besides I'm not the one with the big problem" you say indicating Bess' front. She nods and moves back into the stall letting you pull the tub in so it sat between the two of you.

Leaning over she looks up at you "ready farmer" she says, in a soft voice.

You nod slowly in reply as you had been a bit...caught up in the sight of Bess leaning over "just let me know if I do even the slightest thing wrong, this is my first time milking" you say. Bess nods and you begin, grabbing one nipple between two fingers of each hand you gently push down, and pull forwards a small squirt of milk coming out before you let up a bit let the nipple move back and repeat the process. This continues for a straight half hour, by the end of the session Bess' breasts had deflated greatly in size although you could still see she was a very well-endowed cow, and the tub was completely full of milk. "Where do I put the milk?" you ask, Bess indicates a spot on the far wall of the barn and you drag the heavy tub of milk over to the spot.

"Sasha will come and get it in a few hours, so you don't have to worry about it" Bess says, you nod and give off a small sigh letting yourself fall back into the hay. Near instantly Bess was above you "are you alright?" she asks concern evident in her voice.

"I'm fine" you say but instead of letting you get back up she pushes you gently back into the hay, then seeming to think better of it, lifts your head into her lap. "Comfy?" she says as you don't initially react to her action, "yeah" you reply quietly, quite embarrassed by how close you were to her. Now that you had time to observe her, Bess was a quite beautiful figure, sure she had "curves" but it was in all the right places and even if her beautiful green eyes and her caring personality were very appealing. You just lay there for a while her hand gently stroking over the top of your head, "thanks Bess" you mutter.

"You're welcome" she softly replies. After a few minutes however you remember that you have other stuff to do, and you were sure even though grooming Marie, may not be high priority, you couldn't imagine how hot Jane must be in all her wool.

"Sorry but I need to get going, i've still got other chores to do" you say sitting up.

Bess nods slowly before she hugged you quite tightly to her chest "come visit me again, even if I don't need to be milked every day, it can get lonely" she says.

"Of course Bess" you reply, slowly standing up and wiping a few stray strands of hay off your pants. You walked out of the barn, and headed off for the fields where you were sure Jane would be when....
133.title: "Blood."

choices: She walks toward you, albeit slowly.
She stands upright and runs away.
1332.content:
"Hey, Sasha," you say.


"Hi, [your name]," she says. "How're the chores comin' along?"


"Pretty good," you say. "I'm just looking for Jane so I can shear her, but I don't know where to look."


"Oh, she's usually in the grazing fields behind the barn at this hour," she says.


"Okay, thanks," you say, as you take off to the grazing fields. When you get there, you see what looks like a cloud, low to the ground, moving around the field. After close observation, you realize that it's actually Jane. You didn't want to scare her wile she ate, so you walk closer to her slowly, and call out to her, but not too loud.


"Hello? Jane?" you call. Jane turns to you, at least you think she did. What happens?
1332.title: Shearing Session

13322.content:
The giant cloud that was Jane stays still for a second, but then she moves towards you, although she was moving pretty slowly. You decide to let her take her time, and she finally reaches you.


"Who... are you?" the sheep asks.


"Oh, I'm [your name]," you say, maintaining your quiet tone. "I'm Derrick's nephew. I'm looking after the farm now. I was told that you needed to be sheared, so I came to do just that."


"Okay..." says Jane. "Follow me."


The sheep leads you to a shed with a stool and some clipping shears. She takes a seat on the stool, and you start up the shears so you can get to work. As you were shearing Jane, you wonder if you should try and talk to her. You were told that Jane didn't talk much, so you were on the fence about whether or not you should strike up a conversation. You could end up making some kind of connection with her, but you also could end up making the situation very awkward for the both of you. What do you do?
13322.title: She walks toward you, albeit slowly.

133222.content:
The silence in the room was starting to get to you. This is way different from milking Bess, where you two would talk nonstop. Maybe, just maybe, Jane will open up if you take the initiative to talk to her, first.


"So," you say. "I was told that you don't talk to the others."


"Yeah..." she says. "I don't."


Well, you got a response from her. That's progress, right.


"Okay. Well, is there a reason why?" you say, trying not to sound like you're prying.


"Well, it's just..." Jane struggles to say. "It's just that... I don't feel very comfortable around others."


"Well, doesn't it get lonely just hanging around by yourself?" you ask.


Jane stays quiet for a minute. "Sometimes," she says, but something told you that she really meant "all the time."


"Do you ever think about trying to open up to the others?" you ask.


"It... crosses my mind from time to time," she answers. You get the feeling that's Jane's starting to trust you.


Now comes the hard part. It's one thing for Jane to be able to talk to you, but you're hoping that she'll want to try to make friends with the other furries on the farm. Then again, she and the others have lived here for years, and she hasn't spoken a word to anyone in all that time. You're sure that Uncle Derrick has tried in vain to do this, so what are the chances of you pulling it off. Well, you never know until you try.


"Well, if I were to, I don't know, help you reach out to the others, would you give it a try?"


What does Jane say?
133222.title: An Awkward Talk

choices: Vicky comes and stirs up trouble.
1332221.content:
Jane stays quiet as she ponders your offer. While it is true that she'd like some companionship, she's been just fine as is for years, so why change it now? Then again, the loneliness did get to her from time to time so, taking this into account, she accepts.


"...Okay," she says, and a smile grows on your face.


"Alright then," you say. "So, do you want me to take you to the house after we're done here?" you ask.


"...Sure," she says.


You continue shearing Jane, which takes awhile considering the insane amount of wool she has, but you eventually finish, and put a mirror in front Jane.


"So, what do you think?" you ask.


Jane stands up and looks at herself in the mirror. You had sheared her wool so it looked like she had on a long-sleeved shirt and a skirt. The sheep turns around a couple times, still looking at her reflection.


"I... I really like it," she says.


"Really?" you say. "Thanks."


Jane then takes your hand as a way of telling you that she's ready to go to the house. The two of you walk hand in hand to the front door, and you let Jane in. She looks around the living room, admiring what she sees.


"It looks nice in here," she says. "Very cozy."


"It is, isn't it?" you say.


Just then, Sasha comes downstairs. "Hey, [your name]," she says, then she stops when she sees Jane. "Wait, is that..."


"Yep, it's Jane," you say, as the sheep gives a timid wave.


"Wow, i'm impressed," says Sasha. "You actually got her to talk to you, and come out of her shell. Not to mention, the excellent shearing job you did. Not bad for your first time."


You blush at Sasha's compliment. "So, Jane," she says. "Would you like something to drink?"


"Yes, please," Jane answers.


What happens next?
1332221.title: Coming Out of One's Wool

choices: "I'd rather spend some time with [your name] today. Perhaps another time?"
13322211.content:
Just then, Tara comes down the stairs. This surprised you and Sasha, since Tara is usually napping at this hour.


"*YAWN!* That was a good nap," she says. She then looks in Jane's direction with a quizzical expression on her face, then she rubs her eyes.


"That can't be who I think it is," she says.


"It is," says Sasha. "You're looking at Jane!"


"Wow," says the cat. "I've never seen her without all that wool on her. You're very pretty, Jane."


The sheep blushes a deep red and smiles. "Thank you, Tara," she says. "It's thanks to [your name] that I look this way,"


"Oh, really?" asks Tara. "That's a shocker. Maybe he was a groomer before he moved here."


You chuckle. "Well, I volunteered at the local animal shelter, and they had me groom the animals from time to time, but this is my first time shearing a sheep."


"You used to groom animals, huh?" asks Sasha. "Well, maybe you could groom me one of these days."


You nervously chuckle. "Yeah, maybe..."


"So Jane," she continues. "Tara and I could use another girl to spend girl time with. Would you like to join us?"


Jane looks down for a second and says-
13322211.title: Tara comes downstairs.

133222111.content:
"I'd love to..." Jane says with a small smile and a blush.


"Phew! I was hoping you'd say that," says Sasha. "Spending time with just Tara has been getting pretty dull."


"Hey!" says Tara.


"You know I'm just kidding," Sasha says, looking back at the cat with her tongue playfully sticking out of her mouth.


"In that case, I'll leave you three alone," you say. "Besides, I still haven't met Marie yet, and I'm sure she needs to be groomed."


"Okay, later," says Sasha.


You leave the house and make your way to the stables, where Marie is. You peer inside, and see a tall anthro horse leaning the against the wall in a relaxed pose. As you walk in, she notices you. "Hey, you look familiar," she says.


Having a strong resemblance to Uncle Derrick, you got that a lot. "Yeah, I'm Derrick's nephew," you say.


"Oh, yeah!" says the horse. "Sasha mentioned you'd be here. I'm Marie. You came at a perfect time, too. I've been getting a ton of knots in my mane, and trying to pick them out myself only makes it worse."


"Don't worry," you say, getting a comb and some spray from a nearby cabinet. After several minutes, you finally get all the knots out of Marie's mane.


"Ah, that feels much better," she says as she runs her fingers though her mane. "Nice and silky smooth. So, now that that's out of the way...."
133222111.title: Girl Time

choices: You see Luna flying up in the sky.
1332221111.content:
"Go for a run?" you ask, confused at the way Marie worded that question.


"Yeah, didn't Sasha tell you?" she asks. "We can all transform into regular animals."


"Really?" you ask. "I guess she forgot."


"She was probably so excited that you were coming," says Marie. "Ah well, it's no big deal. The only drawback of the transformation is that we can't talk, but we can still understand when someone talks to us."


"Interesting..." you say.


"So, before I forget, you should get that saddle hanging on the wall over there," she says. You walk over to where the saddle was hanging and get it off the wall, but when you turn back around, you don't see an anthro horse. Instead, you see a normal horse. You chuckle at the fact that Marie transformed behind your back to tease you. After strapping the saddle onto Marie and taking her outside, you mount the saddle and tell Marie to go whenever she's ready. All of a sudden, she takes off at a speed that's damn near neck breaking. You struggle to keep your cool as Marie runs across the farm with you holding on for dear life. After what felt like forever, even though it was only a few minutes, Marie finally comes to a stop. You dizzily dismount the saddle, and the mare transforms back into her anthro form.


"Whew!" she says, stretching her legs. "That was the best run I've had in a long time!"


"Glad you enjoyed it..." you say, still disoriented.


"I guess I overdid it a little," she says. "Why don't you go home and get some rest."


"Good idea..." you say.


After going home and taking a long nap, you wake up at around eight thirty in the night. That run with Marie obviously took more out of you than you thought. You go downstairs to the kitchen and see a note on the fridge.


Your dinner is in here in a blue bowl. Heat it up for two minutes in the microwave.

-Sasha


You smile. It's nice to know that Sasha's looking out for you. As you eat, you look out the window at the night sky, then suddenly remember what Luna told you this morning.


"If you're up late, you should come meet me out in the field. I promise you'll enjoy what you find."


Curious as to what she meant, you walk out into the field after you eat. After wandering around for a minute...
1332221111.title: "Wanna go for a run?"

14.content:
You decide to go shear Jane, you find the shy little sheep out in the pasture grazing on grass

"Um...Hi." You say "Are you Jane?"


Jane looks up from her grazing "W-Why are you talking to me?" She asks shyly

"I heard you need shearing." You say

Jane starts to pace nervously in place, you can tell she's the shy and meek type, all that wool makes her look really plump, that's probably why she seems so self conscious.

"It's OK." You say "I won't hurt you."

Jane starts to run, you sprint and catch her,you take the shears and as gingerly as you can start to shear her.

After you're done you can see she is actually has a rather trim figure, She blushes and whispers 'Thank you."

"You welcome." You say
14.title: Go shear Jane

144.content:
You suddenly hear the loud squawking of chickens. "Oh crap!" you exclaim. You rush over to the chicken coop and look inside. You see a fox furry holding a plump chicken. This must've been Vicky.

"You're all mine, little chicken. No use struggling." she says.

"You mind explaining what you're doing here?" you ask.

Vicky looks up at you in surprise since she didn't recognize your voice. Then she smirks. "Oh, I heard that someone would be coming to this farm. You're the old caretaker's nephew, right?"

"I asked you a question." you say again. "What are you doing here?"

"Oh, I'm just getting some lunch." she says casually. "You don't mind, right?"

"Of course I mind!" you say.

"Temper, temper." she says with a chuckle. "I'll tell ya what. If you let me have this chicken, I'll give you a kiss. A good, long one too, since you're so handsome."

You give a disgusted look. "Ugh... I think I'll pass. You're not that pretty."

Vicky's pissed now. "NOT PRETTY!? WHY I OUGHTA TEAR YOU TO SHREDS FOR THAT!!!"

"Not while I'm here." you hear someone say. You turn and see Sasha standing with her hands on her hips. "You heard him. Drop the chicken and get out."

Knowing that she couldn't take on two of you, the vixen puts the chicken down and walks off, leaving the farm.

"That was pretty impressive." Sasha says. "Your uncle would usually fall for her charms. That makes one thing that you two don't have in common."

The two of you laugh while you walk back home.
144.title: Uninvited Visitor

1441.content:
Later that day, after all the chores were done, you go home and eat a well-cooked dinner that Sasha made. After dinner, you go upstairs and you see a string hanging from the ceiling that you didn't notice before. You look up and see what looks like a door. You pull the string and the door opens, a ladder folding out. This must've been the way to the house's attic.

When you get up there, you take a look around. An object shines in the distance. You walk closer to see what it is, and you find a small chest, with the key inside the keyhole. You unlock the chest and find a folded piece of paper. You unfold it to see that it was a note written by Uncle Derrick. It seemed to be for you, since the first line was "Hello, Nephew." You continue to read the note.

"By now, you must have been here for at least a day. I hope that you've enjoyed your time here so far. These last few years have been the best of my life, and I want you to feel the same about your time here.

There is, however, one thing you need to know. It's about-"
1441.title: The Attic

choices: You see that Sasha was standing behind you the whole time!
14411.content:
Sasha...? you think. What is it that I need to know about?

"Obviously, Sasha is a dog furry. Just like Earth dogs, I've noticed that Sasha can get a bit... attached. I fear that if you show her too much trust, she might get the wrong idea, unless of course, you don't mind a relationship with her. Sasha's a nice girl."

What the hell were you reading?! It was as if Uncle Derrick was giving you his blessing or something But he did warn you about Sasha's behavior, so you had to thank him for that.

"Of course, if she does get attached, you can simply tell her that you just want to be friends, but Sasha, like all females will most likely not take rejection too well. So better safe than sorry."

Oh, so now your uncle was some relationship adviser?

"I hope you heed this advice, and that you enjoy your time here, as I have.

Love,
Uncle Derrick"

You put the note back in the chest and close it. When you turn around....
14411.title: "Sasha"

choices: Bella makes Sasha jealous, causing Sahsa to attack her
144111.content:
As you turn around, and see Sasha had been standing behind you, you nearly jump out of your skin. Sasha can't help but burst out laughing at the site. "My, you're a jumpy one, aren't you?" She says, still giggling. "Don't do that, please!" You say "My brother always used to sneak 8up on me and grab me from behind, just to be a dick."



"Sorry I scared you." Says Sasha "I just saw that the attic door was open, and I thought someone might be up here. Find anything in that trunk?" "Oh, just an old photo of my uncle." You quickly lie. Youthink it would be best if Sasha didn't know your uncle left you a warning about her.



"Well, come on downstairs. Dinner is just about finished." As you follow Sasha to the kitchen you think about what Derrick's note had said. You couldn't be in a relationship with Sasha.Not because she was a furry, but because you already had a girlfriend back in California, Bella. Should you tell Sasha that you just want to be friends? If you did, how would she react? Would she be heartbroken, or worse, would she turn out to be one of those psycho women that would try to murder you? As you ponder the subject more over dinner, your cell phone rings.



"Hello?"
