"Hey baby! Guess who?"



"Bella!? Why are you...?"



"What? I can't call my boyfirnd when I haven't seen him for over a week? Anyway, guess where I am."



"Uh, the mall?"



"No, silly, I'm at the airport! I'm coming over to visit you!"



"Seriously!?"



"Yep! I should be there in about two hours! See you then!"



"Who was that?" Asks Sasha as you put your phone in your pocket. "It was a friend of mine from home." You say "She's coming over to visit! What are we gonna do? How am I supposed to explain to her that all the animals on this farm are anthros?!"



"Relax." Says Sasha "IT's no big deal, watch." Sasha gets up from the table , and you watch in amazement as her body shifts into that of a regular husky, instead of an anthropomorphic one. "Can you all do that?" You ask. Sasha nods. "Well, at least that solves that problem." You neglected, however to metion that Bella was your girfriend, and you just really hope she doesn't do anything that would make Sasha jealous when she gets here.
144111.title: An Inconvenient Surprise

choices: You confront Sasha in the middle of the night.
1441112.content:
Two hours go by and you get a phone call from Bella, and she asks you to come pick her up. Before you go out the door, you turn to Sasha and Tara.


"Okay, so make sure that everyone is in animal form when I get back, okay?" you say to Sasha.


"Sure." she says.


"And this goes for you two and the others, pleeeeease don't cause any trouble when she gets here." you say as you close the door.


"I wonder why he's so worried about us embarrassing him?" Sasha asks.


"Maybe embarrassment is not what he's worried about." Tara says. Sasha gives her a look of confusion.


Before long, you arrive to the farm with Bella, who was gonna be staying for three days. Luckily for you, Bella is the type of girl that packs light.


"So when my uncle left me this farm, he also left me his pets, and to of them live in the house." you tell her. You knew that Bella didn't mind animals, you just felt the need tell her. When you walk in, you're greeted by a happy, barking husky. "Aww! Who's this cutie?" Bella asks.


"This is Sasha." you say. "The cat, Tara is around here somewhere, too." You were looking for her because you didn't want Bella to step on her tail. You decide not to worry about it, since she was occupied with Sasha. "Oh, you have such a beautiful dog, sweetie!" she says to you. As soon as she says that, Sasha's tail instantly stops wagging. This is bad. "Okay, Bella. Why don't I show you where you'll be sleeping." you say, taking her with you, with Sasha following close behind.


When you get to your room, Sasha starts growling. She knows that you plan on letting Bella share a bed with you.


"What's wrong with Sasha?" Bella asks, concerned.


"Oh, she usually sleeps right by my bed, so she's a little jealous of having someone else in my room besides her." you explain. You go to Sasha and pet her head, leaning close to her ear. "Calm down." you whisper.


When you tell Bella that she'll be sharing your bed, she squeals in delight. "Oh, [your name]! You're the best boyfriend ever!"


The minute Sasha heard the word "boyfriend," she snapped. She starts barking up a storm and goes after Bella, taking bites at her that, thankfully, missed. Bella screams in a panic, and you jump between her and Sasha. "What is up with you, tonight!" you say to her. You try to get her out, but she instinctively scratches your arm with the nails on her paws. Realizing what she did, Sasha immediately calms down and starts whining, attempting to lick your wound, but instead you send her out of the room.


"What was that all about?" asks Bella.


"I don't know." you say, although you have a pretty good idea of why Sasha was like that. "She usually doesn't act like that."


"Maybe she just needs to adjust." she says getting into the bed.

You think to yourself. Adjusting is not all she needs. You needed to talk to Sasha later tonight.
1441112.title: Hell Hath No Fury Like... You Know the Rest

14411121.content:
In the middle of the night, you get out of the bed, being careful not to wake Bella, and make your way downstairs. You want to confront Sasha about how she was acing earlier. After looking around the living room, you look out the window to see her on the front porch. When you open the front door, you see that she's still awake.


"I want to talk to you." you tell her.


"About what?" she asked. You could tell that she knew what you were talking about because she tried not to look at you.


"Why did you attack Bella earlier today?" you ask. "It's not like she did anything to you."


"Not directly." she says, more to herself than to you. This confuses you.


"What do you mean 'not directly'?" you ask. Instead of answering your question, she asks you another.


"Why didn't you tell me that you had a girlfriend?" she asks. You were afraid of this. This confirmed that Sasha was, indeed, jealous of your relationship with Bella.


"I didn't think it would matter!" you say, trying to make Sasha see that it's not a big deal.


"Well it does to me!" she says back. "How do you think I felt when i saw that you liked another girl?"


"Why do you care?"


"Maybe it's because I like you, too!" she says, finally admitting it. Her eyes widen as she realizes what she just said, and she changes into her regular husky form and runs inside. You really shouldn't have pushed her so far. Hopefully she'll feel better tomorrow. You go back upstairs and get back into the bed with Bella hoping that she didn't hear anything.
14411121.title: Confrontation

choices: Marie takes it slow for a change
She can't help herself and runs at full gallop!
144111211.content:
Thankfully, Bella apparently slept through your argument with Sasha, because she didn't ask any questions the next morning. Bella had insisted on making breakfast for the two of you, so you sat at the table while she stood at the stove, Sasha laying at your feet in dog form. The entire time, Sasha kept her eyes on Bella, giving off an occasional growl. "What's the matter with Sasha?" Asked Bella as she placed your plate on the table. "She's jealous that I'm showing you more attention than her."




"You make it sound like she's human."




You have no idea, you think to yourself.




Bella gets down on her knees next to Sasha and begin stroking her back. "What's the matter girl? Do you think (your name) loves me more than you?" You could see it in Sasha's eyes that she desperately wanted to bite Bella right now, but one glare from you forced her to restrain herself. Bella feels something brush agianst her leg, and turns to see a black cat rubbing against her and meowing loudly. "Aww! So here's that kitty you were talking about!" She says as she scratches Tara's ears, making her purr.



"That's strange." You say "She doesn't normally warm up to strangers so quickly. She probably just wants you to give her her morning milk." Bella pours Tara a bowl of milk before sitting across from you and eating. "So, what other animals do you have around here?"



"Let's see, there's a flock of chickens, a cow, a bat in the barn, a horse...."



"You have a horse? Can we go for a ride?"



You hesitate for a moment. You had never ridden a horse before, and you didn't know if Marie would want to run around with the two of you on her back. "Well, I've actually haven't ridden her, but wait here and I'll go see if I can find a saddle." You head outside to the stable and find Marie in her normal horse form. "Bella wants to go for a ride on you. Do you think you can handle both of us?"



Marie moves her head up and down as she whinnys loudly, so you take that as a yes. "Is there a saddle anywhere around here?" Marie motions to the corner of the stablle, where a saddle hangs from a hook in the wall. It takes some time for you to figure out how to get the saddle on her before you lead her out of the stable to the house, where Bella was waiting on the porch.



"Oh, she's beautiful!" "Yep, she's a beauty. Her name is Marie." You have some trouble at first, but you finally manage to climb up onto Marie's back and pull Bella up behind you. "Giddyup!"
144111211.title: Ignorance is Bliss

choices: Sasha goes into anthro form out of anger.
Sasha runs back into the house.
1441112112.content:
Supposedly Marie couldn't help herself, because she starts running at full speed the minute you say "Giddyup". You find yourself praying that you'll survive this. In an effort to slow it down, you try to tell her to stop.


"Okay, Marie," you struggle to say due to the wind. "You can stop, now!"


"No way!" says Bella. "Keep going!"


"WHAT!?" you say, surprised that Bella was enjoying this. Marie was more than happy to comply as she turns around and picks up more speed. Eventually you just couldn't maintain your balance and you fall off the saddle. You're a little disoriented, but nothing hurts, since you landed flat on your body, so no particular part of you hurt. You look at the house and see that Sasha's running out the house to see if you're okay. When you look in the other direction, you see Bella and Marie running over to you as well, and the look on Marie's face told you that she was really sorry.


When the three of them reach you, Sasha looks you over to check for any injuries, making worried whining noises.


"You guys, I'm fine." you say. Sasha calms down for a second, but then she starts growling at Bella, supposedly blaming her since she told Marie to keep going at the speed she was running. You give her a look and she stops immediately.


"I'm so glad you're okay, baby." says Bella. She then kisses you, to your surprise and Sasha's terror.
1441112112.title: Mach 5 Marie

choices: She wants to have a serious talk with you.
14411121121.content:
Sasha just stares at you and Bella, until she's finally fed up. It wasn't her intention, but she was too angry to make a good judgement.


"ALRIGHT! THAT IS IT!" she yells, startling Bella, Marie, and especially you. Sasha transforms into her anthro form, revealing her true self to Bella. "I am sick and tired of having to watch you and your little girlfriend clamor over each other!"


"Sasha..." you say.


"Don't 'Sasha' me!" she snaps back. "I told you that I was uncomfortable with you and Bella acting like that around me but you still go on and do it anyway! I'm not gonna keep pretending to be your pet so you can please her!" With that, she turns around and storms back into the house.


"Oh great. I really screwed up, now." you think. You think about going in after her, but you can't forget that Bella saw everything. YOu can't just go after Sasha and leave Bella wondering what happened. You decide that the best thing to do would be to stay with her. You put your arm around Bella and look at her. "Are you okay?" you ask.


What's Bella's response?
14411121121.title: Secret Revealed

choices: The rest of the visit goes smoothly.
144111211211.content:
You wave your hand in front of Bella's face, hoping to get a response. Unfortunately, you don't get one. Instead, she falls backward onto the grass, unconscious. You go into full on panic mode yourself. How are you going to explain this to Bella when she wakes up? You needed an alibi, and you needed it fast, but you couldn't think of one. Marie sees your concern and she runs her nose on your shoulder in an effort to calm you down.


"Okay, you're right." you say. After calming down, you figure out a solution.


"I've got it!" you say.


You pick Bella up and put her in the bed, tucking her in. After that, you go into Sasha's room and tell her to change back into her anthro form, and to never pull a stunt like that again. You were praying for this weekend to go by fast so Bella can go back home and things can get back to normal (or at least as normal as it gets living on a farm full of anthros). You go back to your room and wait for Bella to wake up. When she starts to come to, you put part two of your alibi into action.


"About time you woke up, Bella," you say. "It's one in the afternoon."


"What? But we were horseback riding and you fell, and Sasha became some human/animal thing and-"


"Man, that was some dream you had?" you say. "Why don't I make you some tea?"


Thankfully, Bella believes that she was dreaming. How does the rest of the visit go?
144111211211.title: Timber!

1441112112112.content:
The rest of the day goes by smoothly, but the following day, the day Bella was supposed to leave, has some complications. Bella was supposed to be at the airport for seven-o-clock that night, so she spent then entire morning packing. You tell her that you're going to milk bess, and she waits for you in the house while you head out. You see Sasha lying down on the foot of the couch, and tell her not to do anything to Bella. She grunts in response.


When you head over to the barn you see Bess in her regular cow form. You give her the OK to turn back into an anthro. As you get to milking her the two of you strike up a conversation, as usual.


"So I hear that Bella is leaving tonight." she says.


"Yeah..." you say.


"Something wrong, sugar?" she asks.


"It's just that Sasha's been making things complicated." you explain. "She's been getting jealous of Bella, she tried to bite her, and she morphed into her anthro form right in front of her. Thank God I was able to make her think it was just a dream."


"Don't worry about it, soon Sasha will be acting like her normal self." Bess says reassuringly.


"I hope so." you say.


When you finish milking Bess, you leave the barn and head back to the house. On your way, you see some rustling in the bushes.


"Oh, hell no." you say. "Not now, of all times."


You look into the bushes and see Vicky. "What are you doing?" you ask.


"Planning some mischief, as usual." she says.


"I know you can't help being a pain in the ass, Vicky, but whatever you're doing, can it wait until tomorrow?" you ask.


"Why?" she asks back. You proceed to tell her about the whole Bella situation. She thinks on it for a moment and...
1441112112112.title: The Worst Possible Time

14411121121121.content:
"Well, okay" Vicky said, "I'll wait till tomorrow. Just don't tell Sasha." "Um, okay..." You said. "Hey, if you do me a small favor I'll bring you a sandwich tonight," She gives you a suspicious look. "Um, okay. Sure. What do you want?" You were shocked that she would actually agree to do something for you. You say "because all the others are in animal form, could you do the same until I drive away to take Belle to the airport?" "Oh sure, that's easy." She said as she turned onto a fox and ran off. Wow. That was the smoothest encounter you'll probably ever have with Vicky.

When you got back into the house you looked for belle, but she wasn't in the kitchen. She wasn't in the living room. She wasn't in the bathroom either. She had to be done packing by now, you thought. Well, that is what you THOUGHT.
When you found her she was in her room, which was really Sasha's room. You didn't like this, but Tara always slept wherever she wanted and you weren't gonna put Belle in the celler, and if you slept down there she'd ask unwanted questions, so that's how it had to be. You hadn't really been able to explain that to Sasha because you two were almost never alone. You knew you would have some serious talking to do when you got back from the airport.

Bell was stuffing something in her suitcase. She said "I just remembered that I left my bra on the hook over there." You tried to sound casual, and act casual. You had been acting like this for 3 days. "Can't forget that," you say in a joking manner. She said "Hey, listen. About that dream I had a few days ago. It was so real! I just can't help thinking about it." "I had a dream like that once" you say, trying to sound casual. "Only I had been sky-diving and both my chutes wouldn't open." "And how did I end up in this bed?" "Well uh, YOU were the one that fell off Marie. You were knocked out cold. So I brought you here." You had never lied faster in your life. That was the one question you were not prepared for. "Oh. So that explains this bump on my head." She said. That did not explain that bump. She got that bump when she fainted, and hit her head in the ground. She looked at her watch and said "Oh crap, lookit the time! I'm gonna miss my flight!

Dropping her off at the airport was uneventful. She went on and on about how much fun she had, but you git the idea that she hadn't had any of the fun she was talking about.

On the way home you stopped at McDonald's and got a big mac, a large coca cola and large fries. When you got home you parked a little ways down the road and walked the rest of the way to Vicky's den.

"Hello?!" You called into the den "Oh hi, I was wondering when you'd be coming." She said as she walked out of the shadows. You hoped to get out of there as fast as you could. You said "Hey, I know I said a sandwich but how does a cheese burger and fries sound?" Her eyes lit up when she heard that. "great! Wanna come in and share some with me?" "Sorry, I gotta go." You said as you handed her the bag. "Okay, how bout a little kiss then?" "Keep dreamin' You said as you walked out the door.

When you got home, Sasha knew right away you were up to something. "Okay two things. 1. What took you so long, and, 2. What have you been doing with Vicky!?" She yelled. Tara looked at you, then Sasha, then you again. You finally said, "I saw her today causing some trouble and made a deal with her. She would wait untill tomorrow to cause trouble, and stay on animal form until you had I had dropped belle off at the airport, in return for some food." "You sure you're not lying?" "I've done enough lying today already. How did you know by the way? A little bird tell you? Did Luna tell you?(pun not intended) " "No, I can smell her on you." "I shoulda Known."

The rest of the night was spent in "serious talking" When you were finally done, you started walking upstairs to bed.
14411121121121.title: She agrees, no strings attached.

choices: tara wakes you up, Vicky escaped!
144111211211212.content:
You were just about to go into your room when you heard a thumping sound. You went over to the window and saw someone almost right on the window sill. For a second you thought it was Tara, but she didn't have that white streak in her face. You turn around and go right out the door. All the way outside. At first you can't see anything, and then suddenly she comes into view. It was Luna. Oh yeah, duh. Tara turned in a long time ago. And how the hell would Tara get on the window sill of the 2nd floor?

"Oh it was you I saw." You said. You didn't really know what to say, you just knew she wanted to talk to you about something. "Who else would I be?" she replied. "Well, for a second I thought you were Tara. But that got me really confused. How would she get to the window you were at? " "Yeah, I'd like to see her try. Anyway, I heard something by the driveway, I think it was Vicky. I dont know what she was doing, but what would she be doing at this time of night?" "I made a deal with her, she wasn't supposed to cause any trouble untill tomorrow." "She almost never holds up her end of any deal. And, technically it is-"

Just then you heard your truck start. Then you saw your headlights go on. "Oh hell no..." You said, and then ran into the house and grabbed a flashlight and a revolver, and loaded it with real bullets. It seemed to have been loaded with blanks. You ran out to the barn, which was pretty near the driveway. Marie called out to you "Hey! Vicky hit Sasha with something, tied her up and threw her in the back of your truck!" " Can you catch up to it?" "If it were day, yes, but I can't see at all out there right now. " You held to your flashlight and said, "we'll have to cope. I can't let her get away with this." "okay grab the saddle-" "we don't have time!" With that she turned into a horse, and you jumped on her back and you shot out the door. You had to hold on to her shoulders so you wouldn't fall off. You shined your flashlight at the ground in front of her. Then you saw the truck. Then your flashlight died. "Oh crap, just follow the tail lights! You said. You almost caught up when Vicky turned those off, too.

Than Marie started to slow down. Then she stopped. Neither of you could see the truck. You got off Marie, and she turned back into an anthro."I'm sorry, I just can't see." She said. "Shit Shit Shit Shit Shit. Now what?" Then you heard a voice behind you. It said, "You need to catch up with that truck? " You turned around and saw Luna. "Uh yes!" "Okay, turn around." You did, wondering what she was going to do. She started flying, and grabbed you under the arms with her feet/talons. Then she took you up into the sky. Then she swooped down over the truck. "What now?" She asked. You hadn't really thought about that part. You still had your pistol, you could shoot a tire. But you didn't want to damage your truck, and didn't know what the recoil would do to Luna and her stability while flying. She interupted your train of thought and said "keep your feet up. Open the door when you can reach it." She flew down on the passenger side of the truck. You had no idea how you were going to pull this off, but landing in the back of the truck would mean risking landing on Sasha. So she swooped down and you reached for the handle. Almost... Almost... Got it! You swung open the door and were in the seat before Vicky could turn her head. You gave her a look which would put chills down anybody's spine. Then you put the barrel of your pistol on her heart. You said "Stop the truck, NOW."

She,pulled over. "Where the hell did you come from? Humans don't just fall out of the sky!" She said. You answered "You're not the one who gets to ask questions here. I thought we had a deal! You aren't allowed to cause trouble untill tomorrow!" "It is tomorrow!" You look at the clock on the truck and it says 12:34 am. "So that's what Luna tried to say to Mr earlier..." You thought. "Why aren't you in bed!" "I couldn't sleep! You must have done something to the food-" "Oh crap. There must have been caffiene in that coca cola I gave you. I'm sorry about that. But that's no excuse for what you did. " "I know..."

You took the keys (which you never figured out how she got them) and went to see Sasha. She was out cold. Luna was already there. "Should I take her home?" She asked. "Sure, here." You took the housekey off the keychain and gave it to her. When she flew away, you tied Vicky up with the same rope she had tied Sasha with, threw her in the back and drove home. When you got there, you immediately went down to the celler, leaving Vicky in the truck. There wasn't much in the celler, so you took the bullets and the wine upstairs. All that was left there was a couch and a table. Then you untied Vicky's feet and led her down there. She laid on the couch, and you locked the celler. Then you went to see how Sasha was doing. She was fine, but still out. She would probably be out untill tomorrow. You thanked Luna and She went to find some food. Tara said she would sleep in sasha's room, and would wake you up if anything happened. Then you went to bed.
144111211211212.title: Luna knocks on the window.

choices: Let her go, with a warning for Tali's sake,
keep her in the celler for now, and deal with Tali yourself.
1441112112112121.content:
You woke up the next day at around 10:30 am, with a banging headache. You had dreamt last night, (or rather, this morning,) about every possible way that last night could have went wrong. Everything from Luna dropping you, to landing and killing Sasha, to trying to shoot your trucks tire but having the truck blow up in everybody's faces, to accidentally shooting Sasha... You woke up with a start at that one, REALLY glad it was a dream and that you were finally awake.

You got up, changed your clothes, and then went to see how Sasha was doing. When you peeked into the room, you saw both Tara and Sasha asleep. That wasn't like Sasha, she was usally awake a long time ago. But today was an exception for everybody. Heck she had been hit on the head with something hard! Your thoughts had been interupted when you heard a scratching sound, coming from the celler door. You grabbed the shotgun above the fireplace, and walked over to the door.

"Hey you're finally here! I was wondering if you were just gonna leave me here." She said. "Do you have any idea what time it is?" You answered,"Stop complaining. After what you did last night, do you really expect me to rise at whatever time you got up and just let you out or make you food or all that nice stuff? Or to even give a damn about you? You're not a guest, your a prisoner. Now I'll bring you some food, but nothing fancy" You closed the door, locked it and went to the chicken coop. These had been the only things not disturbed last night, (maybe Jane too, you didn't know) and you grabed a few eggs. You then went and grabbed a peach and went back to the celler. You gave the food to her, and then went to milk bess. By the time you were done, Sasha was awake.

You went inside to check on her, and found her standing up, displeased at the time. "What happened?" She asked.

You answered, "You probably won't believe me, so you should ask Marie and Luna. They saw. Oh, and Vicky is locked in the celler." "WHAT!?" "I said, Vicky is locked in the celler." "Okay. What did she do this time?" "Basically what happened was I was talking to Luna when my truck started. Then the headlights went on. I grabbed a flashlight and that revolver. Then I jumped on Marie, (not literally) and we chased my truck. Then my flashlight died. Then Vicky turned off the tail lights and we were blind. Then luna helped me get in the truck and I made her stop with the help of Smith and wesson here.(you held up the revolver) Luna took you home, I tied Vicky up and locked her in the celler. She can't handle caffeine worth a damn." She said, "I remember hearing something outside, and getting hit, but then everything went black" "She had tied you up and put you in the back of the truck." You had to admit, she was taking this well. But then you started to get the idea that she didn't believe you. "I think I'll go talk to Marie. I'm not gonna wake Luna cause if what you said is true, she deserves to be left alone. Why is it 11:00 already? I NEVER sleep in this late." You gave her a smug look. "Maybe its because you were hit on the head..."

Just then the doorbell rang. Sasha went to answer it, and you were close behind her. It was a fox, just like Vicky, but younger. Much younger. She looked about 10. Sasha said"Well hello Tali, what are doing here? And where's Vicky? " you could tell "Tali" was scared. There were tears in her eyes. She said simply, I don't know."

Sasha let Tali in, and you dragged Sasha off to a corner. "Who is that?" You asked. She replied, "That's Tali, Vicky's sister. I almost never see her." You were interupted by Tali, who was starting to cry. "Where's Vicky? I need her. She disappeared last night." You decided it was best to tell her the truth. You told her everything. (it would be dull to write it a third time and just wast time and space.) The only thing she wanted was to see Vicky. She begged you to let her go, but you had no idea what to do. You let Tali go down into the celler, where you heard a shout of joy and then a lot of talking. You talked to Sasha about what to do with Vicky. In the end you decided to
1441112112112121.title: The next day

choices: sneak in amd sneak out, somehow.
14411121121121212.content:
You decide that keeping Vicky in the celler would keep her from causing any more trouble. When Tali heard about this, she was very unhappy. You tried to reason with her, but to no avail. When she swung at you though, Sasha had her in the celler, door locked and bolted before you could say "knife."

"Sasha, I need to get some things." You say, grabbing the keys. "What do you have in mind?" I have some things back in California that I want. I have also been paying rent for an apartment I don't even visit. So I'm gonna move out of there and bring some things here." "How long will you be gone?." "well, that depends. I don't have a computer here to book a flight with. Also, that truck out there? That's not mine, but an airport rental. And I'm paying for that on top of my other car payments. I'll have to drive my car back up here. So, a week maybe? " "Um, okay, can I come with you?" "Well, I wish. But we can't let anyone know you're an anthro, so you'll have to be an animal almost all week. And they don't allow dogs on planes. So you'd have to ride in a cage in the back of the plane for 10 hours. Then when we get there Belle will be all over me, so you'll have to be careful. And then she'll wonder why I brought you, leading to unwelcome questions. Then there's the ride back. My car is a Corvette. It has two seats, not designed for dogs, not really designed for comfort for humans either. You'll have to ride in that for 3 days untill we get back here. Then the hotels will either charge through the roof to let a dog in, or you'll have to sleep in the car. Plus I need you to hold the fort here. You did pretty well when uncle derrick died, can you do it again?" "Well, okay, I guess..." She really seemed disappointed, but you couldn't do anything about that. "What about Vicky and Tali?" She asked? "I think they should stay here until I get back. Tali can be free, Vicky can only leave to use the bathroom. When that happens, Tali will take her place in the celler. That way, she would be leaving behind her sister of she tries to run. At meal times, or whenever you open the celler door, either you or Tara should have the shotgun. As for the meals, they shouldn't be fancy. Raw eggs are fine, scraps are fine, maybe a peach or two a day. But it shouldn't cause you any trouble."

After this, you got straight into the truck and went to the airport. You booked a flight for tomorrow and went home to pack. You had all your stuff at home, so you packed the necessities for a 10 hour trip. Basically nothing. You grabbed a book at the airport book shop, for one heck of a bad price. You left your cell phone with Sasha, because the dark didn't have a phone, and you had a home phone.

You decided that it would be hard to pull this off without letting belle know in some way... There were now 3 girls that wanted you. There was no way you were choosing Vicky, so make that two. Sasha would be hurt in a few ways if you didn't choose her. Plus you and belle didn't go very well at the last meeting. She never really had any fun, and by now, you thought, she may have found another guy. Telling her was out of the question. Try telling her that the person you love is a creature you didn't even know existed before you moved to the farm, that that creature she actually saw, and you had made her believe (code for lied) that it was a dream. Then, she would only want to see this mysterious creature, and then soon it would be public, and sooner or later there would be scientists involved... No. Not happening. You decide to sneak in to town. How hard can it be? You had lived in a city, with a large population. We'll see. Your Corvette wasn't a stealthy car, either. A flashy blue/purple checkered paint job, fancy underbody lights, EVERYONE knew it was yours. It wasn't new York, but that city never really slept either. What should you do?
14411121121121212.title: keep her in the celler for now, and deal with T...

144111211211212122.content:
When you got to the airport, nothing suprised you. Everything went well, until- *that* happened. One lone guy was walking up the escalater when a lady on the top floor tripped, throwing the pen she had in her hand on to the escalator. The guy slipped on the pen when he was 5 feet from the top of a two story high escelator. Then he fell backward, and soon he was falling down the up escalator, falling down many stairs but actually moving very slow. He was a slinky on an escalater. Never stopping, never progressing either. You just had to laugh at the sight. You reached down to get your phone to take a video when- you remembered Sasha had it. You went and stopped him from falling down the up escalated and when you looked at him you saw that he was pretty badly beat- up. He thanked you, and you ran to catch your plane.

The first half hour of the flight went fine. You were suprised to see the unfortunate escalater man had the same flight as you. Eventually you had to go to the bathroom.

When you were done, and were washing your hands, you heard a scream. Or rather, a bunch of screams, all at once. You looked out the door, and saw that the escalator guy had taken a wine bottle with a long neck, and broke the cork and the rim off, leaving him with a Sharp edge and a sturdy handle. With this weapon he had stabbed the security guy You close the door. You had noticed that most of the people on the plane were women, children and old people. He had already killed the man that could help you, so you were on your own against this foe. You looked at yourself in the mirror, wondering what you were going to do. There were no weapons to be had, wait... The MIRROR! You smashed the mirror with your fist as hard as you could. You got a bloody set of knuckles, but had also found your weapon. A triangle shaped piece of glass, that was pretty thick for a mirror, and was about 9 inches long. You cut a piece of your shirt off, wrapped it around the end of it for a safer handle. You walked out of the bathroom, "knife" in hand. The bathroom was at the back of the plane, and the man was trying to get to the pilots, at the front. Then he turned around, and faced you.

The man opened his mouth to say something. But you spoke first. "Wow. You look pretty beat up after the escalater incident. You sure you don't want to surrender now?" Stalling me won't change anything. Were 45 minutes in to a 10 hour flight. And the pilot doesn't know what happened, so that won't change. " "I guess that means only one of us is getting off of this plane alive, and I intend to be that person. Parents, cover the eyes and ears of your children. What may happen here will scar them for life-" with that, he ran at you, "bottle" in hand.

3 minutes later you both have cuts and bruses. He had the cuts, due to the nature of your weapon, and you had the bruises due to the nature of his, you were able to avoid the edge on that bottle. Eventuality you caught his bottle, kneed him in the balls, punched him in the face with your left, grabbed his bottle with your right as he fell to the ground. He sat up, with his and your weapon at his neck and heart. A little boy, as if on cue, ran to get the pilots. He banged and banged on the door, and eventually the co-pilot came out, and saw what had happened. Then the flight attendant, a female, came out from a corner and explained what had happened. You thought she used the word "hero" a little too much. The co-pilot went and got some zip-ties from somewhere, and you tied the escalater man up. You sat down in your seat, and were immediately upgraded to first class at no charge by the pilot. For the rest of the flight you were praised like a hero. You claimed it was all chance, saying to people, "I guess I was in the right place at the right time."

When you got out of the airplane you were greeted by a bunch of reporters and they made it hard to het back to your apartment.

When you got to your apartment you were greeted by the phone ringing. You desperately hoped it was Sasha, and not another reporter. It was
144111211211212122.title: plane trouble.

1441112112112121222.content:
You picked up the phone. The man was also talking to a coworker so he didn't know you had picked up, and you knew it wasn't Sasha. You said, "Hello, you have reached (NAME). I am currently not able to answer the phone right now, so please leave your name and number in a short message at the click." With that you hung up the phone. Yes that was a little mean, but you wanted to get in and out of town without all this publicity. Then the phone rang again. It couldn't be Sasha you knew, the time zones are different and she would have been in bed 2 hours ago. This time the regular answering machine answers. The person leaving a message was Belle! You thought fast. Then you picked up the phone right before she finished her message. "Hello Belle? Yeah sorry I was in the bathroom. Oh. Yeah that's me on the television... No I'm fine, he was fine too. Its wierd. Anyway, I just wanted to suprise you when I got into town, I'm moving to to my uncles-er-my farm. What's that? Oh. I was actually hoping that that would happen. I found someone else too- no I'm not angry. That's fine. I knew this would happen. No I said that already, I'm not angry. Anyway, ill be out of town in 4 days. Okay, see ya." Well that fixed the problem of sneaking out of town in a flashy car. Now you had to see if you can get out of town on time and avoid reporters.

You grabbed your tv and its devices, your CPU, and all of its toys, your lamps, your gun and its equipment, and a few other things, and discontinued the services you were paying for like phone, internet, rent, etc, and also went shopping for some "gadgets" like night vision goggles, a gps tracker in case Vicky stole your car again, and a tranquilizer gun, in the course of a few days. During those few days whatever time you weren't spending packing or sleeping you spent being interviewed, getting a medal, that kind of stuff. The presedent wanted you to come to dc so he could decorate you himself. Yes, it wasn't everyday that you prevent another 9 - 11 and the presedent wanted to give you a medal, but you couldn't be gone that long. You thanked him, but had to say no. So the mayor decorated you.

When that was finally done, and you could take the fake smile off your face, you were able to make it home.

When you for home, it was about 2 am eastern time zone, and about. 11 pm western time zone, and everyone was in bed. So you decided to go to bed as well, without waking anybody.

It reminded you of the first night. You walked in, and saw the kitchen, and saw that Sasha had installed a 2x4 over the celler door, and then went into the living room, saw the fireplace roaring; and Tara, curled up in a ball in front of it. Just like your first night. But this time you kept your distance. You put on your new night vision goggles and saw, and avoided her tail. Then you saw Tali, curled up on the couch. Odd. She must have grown on Sasha or Tara pretty much, or they wouldn't have let this happen. "Oh well," you thought, "I'll figure this out tomorrow. With that you went to bed.
1441112112112121222.title: unwanted publicity.

choices: the reporter had planted a bug!
14411121121121212222.content:
The next day, you thought you would have a little fun. So you got up earlier than everyone else, and made. Breakfast for everyone. You took yours upstairs, and left a bowl of milk and two plates of Bacon and eggs on the table at the correct spots. You then went upstairs to your took and looked at your watch, got confused, reset the time zones and then looked at your watch. 7:27. Any minute now... You started setting things up in your room. You put your computer on the table, hooked it up to the tv, hooked the electronic piano up to the laptop- and then you heard something. You peeped out the door of your room and just saw Sasha walk down the stairs. Then you listened. "Well Tara, it was nice of you to make breakfast for me and Tali" "But I didn't. I thought you did." "What? I just got up. Tali?" "Wasn't me" "well then who the heck made this?" "I did." You said as you walked down the stairs, with an ear to ear smile. You then braced yourself as Sasha came flying at you, and almost knocked you down in a hug. She kept saying stuff like "Oh (name) you're finally back! I was worried sick after hearing what happened on the plane on the radio. Your not hurt are you? Was he hurt? Didja kill him? Wow look at that car in the driveway! Is that yours? It is?" To every question she asked you could always answer with a simple yes or no. Tara didn't really jump on you the way Sasha did, she just wondered how you got here without waking them up, and why you didn't wake them up. Tali gave a nervous "hi", and that was all. You knew exactly what she wanted, but couldn't give it to her just yet.

You did your chores, and then heard from Tara that they needed more wood for the fireplace. But you couldn't do that just yet. Now no one ever came down the road unless they were going to your farm, so you used that to your advantage. You installed a security system. And about 70 yards down the road from your farm you put a motion sensor out on the edge, well hidden, so that when a car came by, it would trigger an alarm by the house that no human ear could hear from that distance. Then everyone would know, and could change into animal form if needed. You put a laser beam across the barn and stable doors, so Vicky couldn't get in without tripping the alarm. You also put in a special alarm that was ultrasonic. Sasha said it was very loud, and you could barely hear anything. This you put in the barn to wake Luna if necessary. You put about 15 security cameras around the place, and 2 were watching the road, just in case. You reinforced the window locks and door locks, and put your glocks in a few convienant places so you would have them if needed. That airport incident really scared you, but that wasn't the only reason you did all this stuff. Vicky and unwanted supprise visitors were the others. Now that that was done, you could start getting some firewood.

There was a dead tree in the front yard that looked like of was going to fall, and you decided it was a danger to the house. Now you needed a chainsaw. So you went to the stables, and found nothing, and went to the barn, and found an axe, a hatchet, a splitting mall and some brush trimmers. You got started, and in two hours you had cut down the tree, and had cut it into pieces. Now all you had to do was use the splitting mall, and chop it up even more, and then handle the brush, pick up sticks, that sort of thing. As you were splitting the large chunks the alarm rang.

You ran inside and looked at video footage. A blue Ford focus was coming to your farm! You told everyone to disguise themselves, and then ran back out in the front yard to cut the wood, as if this had never happened. As you saw the car pull in, you thought about if there was anything you forgot. Sasha was good, Tali and Vicky were in the celler, Tara was good, bess was good, Marie was good Jane was good, Luna was- oh Shit! She was in the barn, hanging from the raftors. Directly in front of the driveway. You never got to tell her what the alarm was for. You kept your cool as you kept chopping wood as if nothing else could be more important. The man got out of his car, and started walking your way. At least he didn't see Luna.

He said. "Hey, are you (name)? Hi I'm Steve higgens and im with the-" "you're yet another reporter who wants to get his own take on what happened on that plane last Thursday." You interupted. You whipped out a notebook and started writing. You wrote a small note, which said "handle Luna!" And said "it says here that you're the 24th guy to come and try to talk with me about that." Swinging the splitting mall and chopping some wood. He replied, "Uh yes, sorry to bother you. A little advice: if you don't handle this now, (swing) they'll just send someone else again and again until they get the story they want." "Wow. I already explained what happened 23 times and twice on national television. What more do you want?!?!" (swing) "well, I just wanted to tell you that the man that attacked you was traced back to Saudi Arabia. (swing) As you may know, there were a lot of terrorists there. We traced from there a few more back to the us and arrested 6 terrorists. Because of you we were able to save 500,000 lives.(swing) because of this, and all the publicity, a common question is "Where did he go?" And "why did he move to a farm?" I'm here to try and answer those questions."

You thought about this for a moment. There was a hill in your back yard... And maybe you could... Yeah. You could. "Let me show you around, and maybe you'll see why." You walked back around to the backyard. "Here", you said "I can do almost whatever I want. I'm too far away from anybody to bother them with any kind of noise. You grabbed a glock. He gulped. You gave him a look and said "I'm not gonna shoot you... If that's what your wondering. Here". You gave him a can that used to hold tomato paste. " throw it. Here I can do things like this." He threw the can, and bang bang bang bang, there were three holes in the can. (you missed once) "there are very few places where one can do that without getting yelled at." The real reason you did this is so Luna would wake up. You timed the shots so that the first one would wake her up, the second would drown out the crash, that usually occurred when she was woken up, and the third and fourth for show.

You took him into the house and offered him a drink. He declined, and during this time Sasha barked and barked like any other dog would. Sasha the note and she kept barking, but you knew she knew what had to be done. You "shooed" her outside, and she went to handle Luna. Tara, now that the dog was gone, was a lot more friendly. She walked up, sniffed the man, and walked away. "Do the cat and dog get along?" He asked. "Yes. They've never had a fight that I've seen. What I was trying to show you, was that it doesn't matter what I do here, but in the city there are so many limitations. The road you came from? That's my driveway. I can go as fast as I want in my driveway. I can shoot, I can make noise and nobody will care. That's why I'm here. Privacy and freedom. Now I've got to finish that tree while there's still daylight." "Ah yes, I'll be on my way." He said. "Thank you for your time." With that he walked out the door, and you followed.

Right after he drove away, you went to the barn. Where was Luna? You looked up, and there she was, a lot smaller now, as a normal bat. You said "hey Luna, its clear now." She flew down and turned into an anthro right in front of you. "What was that about?" We had a visitor, another reporter. Now he's gone. Hey by the way, can you hear this?" You turned on the high pitched alarm. "Are you kidding me? That would wake me up anyday." "perfect. If another unwanted visitor shows up, that alarm will go off. You know what to do." " Oh okay. What was with the gunshots then?" I had to wake you, but without making that guy suspicious." "Clever. All right, I'm going back to sleep." "allright, see ya."

You went to congradulate the others, this had went pretty well. Now you had to deal with Vicky. You let her out of the celler, and let Tali go as well. You never told them about the new gear, you knew the less they knew about it the better. You told her the next time she did something like that again she would be locked in the celler again, for 2 weeks. And if she did anything to your car... You gave her a look as you said that. A look that meant "instant death" that being said, she ran off into the woods.
14411121121121212222.title: does it ever stop?

144111211211212122221.content:
The next day, Sasha helped you with the chores. She milked bess on the right while you milked her on the left. She grabbed another brush and helped groom Marie. She helped shear Jane.

When she was getting the eggs, she saw Vicky, with a chicken under her arm. She for angry at this and threw a punch. What you saw after that, you didn't understand. You heard a large Zap, and saw a circle, about 2feet in diamitor, and what you saw through it was... Some sort of alley!? You were just who'd to get a glimpse before it disappeared. Then you noticed Tara, who had seen it from the window. She had the widest eyes you had ever seen. You went into the house. "Tara," you said, "was that-" "Yes... It was!" "Did they ever figure out how the portals kept appearing?" She shook her head, still dumbfounded. "Do you know what that really was? It was static electricity! Sasha's like a walking capacitor. She must have charged up when she had contact with bess, Jane, and Marie." She looked at you confused. "Then why am I here? And Luna? she never had contact with me or her on the day we came here" "You two must have been in the wrong place at the wrong time." It looked like a soap bubble wall would. As long as there was no hole, or a break in the circle, it would last, you figured. You asked, "Tara? Would you like to go home?"

"Did I ever tell you what my life was like there?" She said, with tears forming up in her eyes. She continued. "All my life I've had it hard. As a child, I was often picked on for my tail being so long. It didn't help that my full name is Tara Longtail. I would often get into fights at school, and I ended up getting expelled. I never exactly loved my parents either. They were still treating me like I was two when I was fifteen! So I ran away from home. For a few months I lived on the streets alone, eating out of garbage cans. During that time I became addicted to milk, cream, dairy in general. We cats naturally have a taste for it, but it became a constant craving for me. Then one day, I met this guy who said he felt pity for me, and he wanted to help me. He invited me to come stay with him. He even treated me to the first decent meal I had eaten in months. But when we got to his house, he said I wasn’t going to get to stay there for free. I told him I had no money, but that wasn’t what he was talking about." You instantly knew where this was going, and tears began to flowing from her eyes again. “Needless to say, he soon realized his mistake after I clawed him in the eyes and escaped. The point is, if one doesn't strike out well, or if you're different in any way..." The look on her face said it all.

"Also, you and your uncle have given me a life here, that I wouldn't trade for any other." "Would you trade it for the same thing, only without Vicky? " She looked at you with a look of excitement. "I'd get rid of Vicky any day." "Good. Now I'll have to stop Sasha from killing her. I'll send her home. Somehow, I'll need to find another material though, that Sasha can make the portal by touching. If Vicky leaves, she can charge, but without Vicky she can't discharge and make a portal." Tara smiled at you and said "Maybe you should just wait a week, and then you'll have a rug in the living room, and Sasha will be able to use that." You laughed, and ran and broke up the fight.

You finished your chores, and went inside and got on the computer. You designed a large rectangle, that was about 8 feet tall, and 15 feet wide. You then went to the local hardware store, and bought the materials necessary to build it. You also went to the local security store, and bought 4 stun guns, and then went to an electronics store and bought a power supply.

You brought this stuff home and assembled the rectangle. At each corner of the rectangle you put a stun gun. You hoped that these would supply power to the portal. The power they put through the air was almost similar to the static electricity, but a lot more powerful. You then hacked into the stun guns and hooked them up to the power supply, so thier power could be raised or lowered or shut off if needed. You then called Sasha, and explained what this thing was. She didn't understand hoe it worked until you told her the 4th time, and it still didn't really make sense to her. Eventually she agreed to try it. Now you needed Vicky's consent. You went down to her den, alone.

You had brought a glock, just in case, in a holester on your hip. Ever since the plane incident you always had one there. You walked up to the entrance of her den. "Vicky!? You here!?" "Yes, I'm here." She said as she walked out of the darkness. "Whazzup? You finally want to have some fun?" "Keep dreaming." "Then why are you here?" "Well, you see, I um, well, let's just put it like this. How'd you like to go home?" "I am home. There's no way to get back to my home planet if that's what you're talking about." "Actually there is." Her eyes lit up with curiousity. "But I need your help." "Why me?" She asked. "Why not Sasha? Or Tara?" "Because your fur is the only kind I know of that can start the portal. But here's the hard part: you'll have to work with Sasha." "Um... No." That simple no, stopped you in your tracks. You knew they were enemies, but maybe you could appeal to her better nature. "Why not raise Tali in a world you and her were familiar with? Around friends? Around people like you?" Just then Tali came around the corner, apparently eavesdropping. "you can get us home?" She said. "Um yes, but Vicky has to help. We can't do it without her." "What about me? Could you do it with me?" You thought about that for a moment. They were sisters, why not? "Probably..." Was the best response you could think of. "Then I'm doing it. Come on Sis." With that she started walking in the direction of the house. Vicky reluctantly followed.

When you got to the house, you had Vicky and Tali stay outside, while you went and got the others. When everyone was there, except Luna, you explained to then what the rectangle was, and how you thought it would work. You got a metal stick from the garage that was about 10 feet long. You held on the corner making a small triangle. You said "If you can get the portal to get on this triangle, it should work. Think of it like a soap bubble. Transfer the bubble to the triangle. Then I will spread it out over the whole thing." Sasha rubbed her hand on Bess's arm for 30 seconds, and did the same to Marie and Jane. Then she made an arc between her finger and thumb. Then Vicky did the same. And when they joined the arcs to make a circle between them, it worked! They were holding a portal! They quickly tried to transfer it to the triangle and it worked, until just before you turned on the taser in that corner. Pop. On the second try, you turned it on just in time, and then turned on the others, and moved the stick along the rectangle, making it bigger and bigger, until finally the whole rectangle was holding a portal.

You looked through. What you saw was a very blurry picture of an alley. Then you turned the tazers up.as you did the image got clearer, until it was clearer than blu-ray. It just had a hint of blue to it. You then saw a confused anthro fox, almost like Vicky but male, and about Tali's age. He Looked at the portal that had opened up in front of him, said something. But nobody could hear him. You took your camera, taped it to the end of the metal stick, and poked it through You waited about a minute until you thought he was done talking, and then brought it back and played the video. What he said was a lot of questions like "Who are you? How did you do that? Where is the other end of the portal? Is that Tali?"

When you heard that last question, you said to Tali, who was in tears, "Is that your brother?" She nodded her head, and you took another video, of you this time. By the time you were done, there was a large crowd on the other side. Yet nobody dared to touch the portal. You made the camera play the video, and stuck it through the portal. It said to them "My name is (name). I am a human. Explaining how I made this portal would be difficult useing a device like this. My end of the portal is on a planet that humans call earth. Until four years ago, the only intelligent life on this planet was humans. Four years ago, which would be about two years of your time, 8 anthros were sucked onto a dimensional hole. Then they found themselves here. They are all alive and well. They are Sasha, the husky, Tara the cat, News the cow, Marie the mare, Jane the ewe, Luna the bat, who is not present at this time, and Vicky and Yes, of is Tali, who are Vixens. Now nobody will be coming through the portal just yet, I'm not sure if it is safe. I need to do a few tests and then it should be ready to use. Also, the portal cannot be opened without a certain combination of anthros. You see, these dimensional holes are made by..." You explained to them how it worked, and told them that you would bring another portal to thier side, so contact could be made from both sides. As you watched them listen to you message, you saw what would have been loud cheering when the names were announced. Then you shut the portal down, and went to get a mouse from the pet store. When you got back, you put it on a tray, restarted the portal, and tested it. The mouse
144111211211212122221.title: The next day

1441112112112121222211.content:
Need I say more? After pulling the mouse out, you looked at the portal, and touched it very lightly and quickly. It felt like touching water, but when you withdrew your finger it was not wet. You then tried it again, sticking your whole hand in. The portal seemed to be about a half inch thick. You held your breath, and closed your eyes, and then stepped through.

The first thing you heard was loud cheering. Then you looked at them, and then looked back at the portal. It looked the same as it did on your side except you saw your driveway, and with an ear to ear smile motioned for them to come. Tali started running toward you. Then, something happened. It started to look funny, and then blurry. Then, you saw Sasha running, then POP.

It was gone.

You blinked, and then told yourself (not out loud) to remain calm. You were really about to panic. Then some little boy in the crowd said "What happened?"

"I... I don't know..." Was all you could say.


POV change to Sasha.

It worked. He made it. And there's Tali, going to see her brother. Wow, you didn't know they had a brother. Then you saw Vicky walking toward the corner of the portal. Then she turned a knob. "Vicky what are you doing?" Then the portal started to fade. "Vicky NO!" You yelled as you ran at her. Then POP! Then WHAM! You hit Vicky right in the nose. She fell to her back. "WHAT WERE YOU THINKING!? WHAT WOULD EVER DRIVE EVEN YOU TO DO THIS!?! NOW HE'S TRAPPED THERE!" "An improvement I'd say." She replied. You kicked her. "WHAT? YOU NASTY HEARTLESS BITCH! Wow. I don't even think that's insulting enough you fucking perverted asshole!" Then Tara grabbed your shoulder. "Hey hey hey calm down,"She said. "Were all still here, so we can make it again." Vicky got up. You said "Well that's true. Alright. Tara, you stand by the computer and hold the stick. I'll go "charge up""

POV change to Vicky.

Okay. Gotta find some way to escape. Fast. I gotta bring Tali with me too. Oh my. Look at that car. There's no way Marie would be able to keep up with THAT. "Hey Tali! Come here." She came slowly, wondering what you wanted. When she finally got there you threw her in the car, jumped in the driver seat and smashed your claw into the ignition. The car
1441112112112121222211.title: Survived! Its safe!

14411121121121212222111.content:
Well. This was a Very powerful car. You pulled out of the driveway, with Sasha screaming and running, but you left her in the dust. Then she started running the other direction. You didn't know what she was doing, but you didn't care either. Then Marie started chasing you, but you put it into 3rd gear, and she was left behind. Damn it was a fast car!

POV change to Luna

BANG!

"Wha-" CRASH!

"Oh... My head... This had better be good Sasha..." You said, rubbing your head. "Actually, its bad." You gave her a look. "You know there's an alarm you're supposed to use for this..." "No time to talk, Vicky just stole (name)'s car and Marie can't catch it. " "You know, she'll never admit it, but we both know I'm faster than her." "That's not all, this car, It's well, REALLY powerful." You thought about this. You had seen the car, but didn't really know much about it. You asked, "What kind of car is it?" She replied, "does it matter!? Stop it!" Okay... Looks like you'll have to do this again. "Sasha? Are you afraid of flying?"

Back to your POV.

A few minutes later the crowd had dissipated, and it had started to get dark. Then it hit you. Vicky must have dome this, and then vanished like a fart in the wind. They wine be able to re-open the portal. You would have to do it yourself. You looked at your surroundings. You seemed to be on the side of a road, in a city. In the alley you saw a dumpster, a trash can... It looked like a normal alley. What stunned you was how normal everything looked. Except you never saw a single human. Then you were approached by a bat. She looked just like Luna, but different in some way which you never could figure out. Then it spoke.

"Uh, sir? Are you the human that discovered the secret of the dimensional holes?" You nodded. "Listen. My name is Heather. I lost my sister two years ago, I was wondering if you knew anything about her." Well, you knew exactly who she was talking about. You said "Let me guess. Her name is Luna, she looks just like you and is nocturnal." "Well, all bats are nocturnal. But yes that's her. Do you know anything about her?" "Well, she is nocturnal, and I'm not, so I don't know as much as I'd like, but I have a incident where she really helped out."

"Well, in the other planet, there was a fox named Vicky. She just LOVES to be a pain in the ass. In fact I believe she is the reason the portal closed on me. She also hates Sasha, a husky, to the point of all out war. So one night she abducted her, and threw her in the back of my truck, and drove away. Marie the mare couldn't keep up due to the lack of light. Luna was the only one that could see, and she basically appeared out of nowhere, and helped me get in the truck. Vicky spent a week locked in the celler."
14411121121121212222111.title: Catch me if you can!

choices: The car drove off the cliff - With them inside it!
144111211211212122221111.content:
Back to Luna's POV.

You got up to about 300 feet up, and looked down and saw the car. You had grabbed Sasha backwards due to the rush, and you couldn't flip her around without risking dropping her. Sasha said "Okay, I told you I wasn't afraid of flying, but this is a little intense!" You would have given her a look, but neither if you could see each other's faces. You replied, "Really? I don't think so... Then again, I do this every night, and you haven't left the ground since the airplane incident on our planet."

Vicky appeared to have taken the road along the gorge, and 200 feet down, at the bottom of the gorge there was a deep river. You asked "Sasha? Did Vicky ever figure out how (Name) got in the truck with her that night?" "Um, I don't think so." "Good, because were gonna do the same thing. Hey, it looks like Tali is there too... Why is she standing up? Sasha, can you hear what she's saying?" Suddenly Sasha panicked. "SHE'S GONNA JUMP!" Oh Shit. What would make her do that!? There was no way Tali would survive the landing into the river. And even if she did, the chances were pretty good that she would have broken something. And, the chances of her being able to swim were lousy. You thought fast. You said "Sasha, do you trust me?" All you heard was "Oh crap. Do we have any other choice? Yes, I trust you. Don't mess up-Waugh! "

With that, you threw Sasha up in the air over the gorge, and swooped down as fast as you could. Tali jumped, and you caught her 50 feet from the water. You set her down on the side of the river, and then went for Sasha. She was falling fast. She had maneuvered into a diving position, which was not good for you. Also, she was heading for the one damn rock in the river. You again moved as fast as you could, which was faster than you ever thought you could, and caught her mere inches from the rock. You then flew up to Vicky, who had slowed down considerably because she thought her sister had just committed suicide. The engine noise, along with Vicky's crying, made it easy to sneak up on her, and after catching Sasha, you found that she was facing the right way. Before you dropped Sasha in the seat, you said to her, "Don't kill her." Then, you dropped Sasha, and then vanished under the gorge, to find Tali.

You found her, frantically trying to climb the wall out of the gorge, but it wasn't going well. When she saw you, she ran, and almost tackled you with an embrace. She said a lot of things, but the two that really mattered, (and the ones that you really could understand,) were "Thank you" and "Why did you save me?"

You simply asked her, "Why did you jump?" Her answer shocked you. "Because I and Vicky are the only ones that you need to start the portal, and I wouldn't leave (NAME) in a world he's never known. I'm not like Vicky. I was hoping I would survive, and be able to start the portal for you." You answered, I saved you because that's what I thought. But what made you think you would survive?" "I thought if I landed in a stick position, I'd be okay. But flying, (without wings,) is difficult." "Well, nobody would survive falling 200 feet like that, (unless you're me, I do it all the time) and there is also no way in hell that you would be able to survive the way you were gonna land, you would have broken at least 5 or so ribs. Now listen. Vicky doesn't know I saved you. Do NOT tell her I saved you, just say you were lucky during your landing. Okay?"

Suddenly you heard something. You looked up and saw
144111211211212122221111.title: Flying

1441112112112121222211111.content:
Oh SHIT. You shoved Tali into the river, (for show reasons,) and ran straight for the wall underneath Sasha. You were completely hidden, because there was a ledge above you that hid you, she couldn't see you from there. You listened, and you heard both Sasha and Vicky yelling Tali's name, and then saying something like "I'll go down on the left, you go to the right." It sounded like Sasha, so you went to the left, which would've been their right. You ran right past her, and flew away.

Back to your POV.

You had tried to make Luna sound like the hero in your story, but truth be told, it didn't work so well. Heather simply said "You know, I thought she was dead... I thought I had a chance at seeing her again... But now she's gone...." Her eyes forming tears as she said this. Then she started to cry, and then you remembered. You said, "It's not hopeless you know" she stopped crying, and said simply, "What?" You put your hand on her shoulder. I made the portal, and I know how it works, I may be able to do it again. She dried her tears, and said, "Really? Can you get me there? Or to earph?" "Well, it's actually pronounced 'earth', but theoretically yes. I just hope I can figure out how to make the tazers..." "You know, tomorrow, a man named Dr. Lansing will be looking for you. He has been studying and trying to figure out how to control or prevent the dimensional holes you came by. We didn't want to lose anybody else, so we hired him. He may be able to help you." "Why not now?" "Well, you are talking to a bat. Need I say more?" She was right, it was very dark out now, and had been for some time. Funny, it shouldn't be this late on earth, or rather, back home (its always that late somewhere on earth) It should be about 8 o'clock right now. She continued. "That reminds me. Shouldn't you be in bed? " "Well, the time zones are a little different there, I still have a couple hours left. But how am I going to so this? I have no money, no way to get a job..." "Tell you what. If you work on the portal, I would be more than happy to provide for you. Dr. Lansing has funds coming out his ears, he could pay for the portal. You know, he still hasn't figured out how the dimensional holes appear." That left you wide eyed, and you physically recoiled. "WHAT!?!? I figured it out on a lazy afternoon for crying out loud!" "Then it shouldn't be hard." She said smiling. "Come on, let's go to my apartment."

She started walking over to a car that looked like it was made 3 or 4 years ago. You both got in, and she started driving. You looked out a window, and were shocked at what you saw. The only creatures you saw were the ones you would expect to see at night on earth, except, they were anthro. All of them. You never saw a "Regular" animal. But that wasn't what shocked you. All that made sense. What shocked you was the fact that everything seemed so normal. Just like L.A., or Chicago, or NY etc. Tall buildings, flashy lights in appropriate places, (ie. Theater) huge traffic jams, all this had used to be the norm for you. It was so wierd.

Heather interupted your train of thought by asking "What is it like on your world?" You thought about this for a second. "Well, this city actually looks just like any other city I've seen on earth. It's really shocking. I lived in a city like this until my uncle died. You see, he left me a farm in his will. So I went there to see it, and that's when I found that there were 6 anthros living there. Now, being a human, and having never seen something like that before, I was dumbfounded. In then end I moved there." Just then you pulled into a parking lot. Heather led you into a building, you took the elevator to the top floor.

When you got in to her apartment, she told you to make yourself at home, and that there should be some food that you could eat in the fridge somewhere. She showed you a room, which was apparently the guest bedroom. The room was empty, except for what looked like a chin-up bar in the middle. You figured that that was what bats slept using. She then pulled a sleeping bag from somewhere, and said you could use that. Then she said she had to go to work, and would send Dr. Lansing an email. He would probably be there at 9 the next morning. You thanked her, and she jumped out the window.

You looked in the fridge, and saw what must have been jars of blood. You saw in the back corner of the fridge what looked like... Pizza!? This was so wierd. You ate the pizza without even putting it in the microwave, and went to bed.
1441112112112121222211111.title: Sasha, HIDE Vicky's coming!

choices: "That might not be a good idea..."
14411121121121212222111112.content:
The next morning, you were awakened by a loud noise. A VERY loud noise. You jumped up, wide awake, and covered your ears. You then went to see what made the noise.

It was a phone. It must have been set to ring that loud are certain hours of the day. Bats must be very hard sleepers you thought. By the time you figured out that it was a phone, the answering machine kicked on. You heard "Hello, you've reached the residence of Heather Blackwing. I am not currently available to receive your call, so please leave your name and number and a short message at the tone and I will return your call at the earliest, or latest convinence, depending on your race. (Beeeeeep) Hello, this is Dr. Butch Lansing. If there is a (name) in the house, would he please come to the phone?"

You picked up the phone. "Hello, this is (Name)." "Hey, I'm in the parking lot in the only orange car there, Heather told me in an email that you knew about the dimensional holes, and that you would be here. She also explained your situation." "Well, I didn't tell her the entire story really." "Well, come on down, I'll get you to my lab and we can solve this." "Okay, be right there."

You hung up the phone, and made sure you had everything. You had your phone, great. It had some information about the portal on it in the calculator memo. You looked at it and found that it had half a charge, not good, you would have to be careful. Your glock had never left your side, good. Were you all there upstairs? Not really. You thought you were crazy, but whatever.

You ran down the hall, and got in the elevator. All the way down, and your ears popped. It was in the elevator that you noticed that the building was 150 stories high. It took 2 solid minutes to get to the ground. There it was, that Orange car stood out like... Well, examples failed you. The car door automatically opened, and folded up, unlike the other cars you had seen. You got into the car, and the door again closed by itself. Then you looked to your left, and saw what must have been Dr. Lansing. He was a dog, not a husky like Sasha, but more like a German sheppard. He said "You must be (Name)" you laughed a little, and said "How could you tell? And you must be Dr. Lansing." "Oh please, call me Butch." He said as he started to drive.

As soon as you were on the road, he asked "So, how'd you do it? I've been working on this for two years, and I can't figure it out." You looked at him a little funny, and said "Do you have records of when, where, and who was present when the dimensional holes appeared?" "Well, yes, of course." "Have you seen any patterns?" "Well, I didn't really look for any." "Then there's your problem. I'll bet you a million dollars that there's some kind of pattern there." "I won't take that bet, partly because I think you're right, and partly because I don't have that kind of cash."

His lab was pretty close to Heather's apartment. Soon you pulled into a parking lot, and he parked in a spot with a sign that said "This Space Reserved For Dr. Butch Lansing." And then it had some fine print about a 500 dollar fine...

His lab was an entire floor of a 30 story building. He was on the 27th floor. You both had to go up by stairs, do to elevator problems.

When you was his lab, you were stunned. He had absolutely everything you could imagine in there, from soldering irons to welding equipment to a 3D printer, and you had only seen the first room. He took you to a room in a corner, which was the computer room. Somehow, it was running Windows. Windows! It looked exactly the same as what you were used to, too. "Now what are the chances of that." You said, more to yourself, but Butch's sensitive ears heard it. "What are the the chances of what?" That computer is running Windows 7 professional edition. I have the exact same thing on my laptop god knows how many light years away." "Well, there's always been a small link between us, nobody knows anything about it though. You would probably know more than I." With that, he brought up on the screen the records of every single dimensional hole that had ever appeared in their world. There were about 50. "Okay, the positioning will be random." You said before he had even showed that to you. "Bring up the names and species of those that were present. (Click) What do you see? Exactly what I thought." "Here, let me try this." He did some typing and clicking, but eventually it showed you what percentage of the time each species was present when dimensional holes appeared. The husky group had 99.5%. Foxes had 85.4%. "There's your pattern. You see that? Dimensional holes appear under certain conditions. Now before we attempt to make a portal, we need to make the frame.

The rest of the day was spent working on designing the frame. Butch was all about safety, you were all about speed. Butch made you wait while he made two small ramps for the bump on the floor, and you installed a rail on the top and bottom, and then put a thin metal bar connecting them, and then motorized it, so the portal could be spread across the rectangle at the push of a button. Then you did some welding while Butch built the tazers to go into the corners, and installed them into a fancy computer...

When you both were done, you looked at the clock, and then saw Heather, coming to pick you and she seemed interested in the progress. "Amazing! Is that it?" She asked. "Yep. Now we need some helpers." "Helpers? Why?" She asked as she walked around your invention. "I'll explain later." You turned to Butch. "I need the names and numbers of a husky, a fox, a cow, a ewe, and a horse, preferably immediate relatives of those who disappeared two years ago, and if possible, female." "Got it. I will have a list ready by tomorrow morning." "See ya then." You said as you walked out the door.

You got in Heather's car, and she surprised you by not asking any questions about the portal. When you got to her apartment, she said "You want to go up the slow way, or the fast way?" Well you knew exactly what she was offering. You answered "As long as It's not any trouble, the fast way." She smiled, and grabbed you the same way Luna had, and then she flew up in a spiral parrern around the building. When you were 1500 feet up, (a story is 10 feet, do the math) she flew over to the window, which you opened, and then she set you on the window ledge. You went in, and she followed you. Then she locked the window, and went into the kitchen. You followed, but kept a 7 - 8 foot distance. You said,"Well, this morning I was woken up by the phone... Damn that thing is loud..." "Oh, sorry," she said, "I never wake up unless there's a REALLY loud noise, or of I've had enough sleep. We bats are like that." So that's why that gun was loaded with blanks during that truck incident with Vicky. Yep, That must be how Sasha would wake Luna if she needed to. You said, "I guess that makes sense, Luna is like that too. Sasha had to use one of these to wake her if she needed to." You tapped your glock. "On that subject," she said, "What is that thing?" "You don't know what this is? Wow. Well there's one thing that's not the same about us. This is a gun. Model glock 21. It's a very powerful (and dangerous) weapon." You said. You took it out of the holester, and then removed the clip and made EXTRA sure there weren't any bullets in the chamber. "It uses an explosion to propel a bullet at supersonic speeds, and with such force it could bore its way through six inches of flesh. I only carry it for self-defense, and on the earth I carried it in case Vicky did something that required me to threaten her with her life to stop. (Which happened quite often you know). She looked at you, a little frightened. When you saw this, you realized you had made a mistake. You said "Don't worry, I will never use this on anyone here unless they threaten me with my life." "That's not what I'm worried about." She said. "I'm worried about the fact that you would kill someone if they become a pain in the ass." "You know, I only use this to stop Vicky. Once I have control of the situation, if I need to I'll bind her hands, and put her in a makeshift prison. I will never kill her, unless she is going to kill someone else. Okay?" "Okay," she said seeming to calm down. "But couldn't you use a less dangerous weapon?" "If I had one I would. You know, when you're not using it for a weapon, its a lot of fun just to shoot at targets with. I could hit a soda can from 50 yards away." "That's kind of cool, at least you can controlled what you destroy." "Yes" she went into the fridge, and you went to your room. You left your glock there.

When you came back out, she had put a new pizza in the oven. She then said "Anyway, you were saying that Sasha had to use one of those to wake Luna up. Did she shoot a bell or something? " "No. You see, the gun makes a VERY loud noise when fired. For safety reasons, she always loaded it with blanks. Blanks are fake rounds that make the noise but don't shoot the bullets. They are perfectly safe."

A few minutes later, the timer beeped, but that time you could barely hear it. Then you remembered the ultrasonic alarm you had installed in the barn for Luna. You figured it was pretty loud for Heather, but you couldn't hear it.

You then ate pizza and watched the news, and you were surprised to see Heather eat pizza too. Then you saw the cup of blood, and you didn't say anything. You didn't quite understand, but you had a pretty good idea and that was good enough for you. You just commented on the news.
