The news seemed to be the same too, except anthros were the ones giving the show. Then they started talking about YOU. They did it talk show style, and they were taking calls and asking people for any information they had, and/or their opinion on the matter.

You looked at Heather. She looked at you. Then you both smiled. "Should I call them?" She thought for a moment. Then she looked at the screen, then looked at you, and said
14411121121121212222111112.title: The next morning...

144111211211212122221111121.content:
"Go for it, but let me just warn you that you may be on hold for a while, and if they talk to you, they will most likely not let you go for at least 20 minutes. As long as you're okay with that, Go for it!" She said. "Okay. Here goes." You dialed.

You were answered by a recorded message machine. "Thank you for calling fox news. We need to know your name and species before we continue. You may simply speak your name and species and our advanced voice recognition system will do the rest. Speak now" "(Name), species human." "Species "Human" not recognized. If you like to try again, press 1 or if would you like to be connected with one of our staff, press 2." (Beep) "Connecting..." The you were answered by a feminine voice, that sounded like Vicky, you suspected she was a Vixen. She said, "Hello. This is Amy, and thank you for calling fox news." You said, "Yes. Your voice recognition system doesn't know my species." "In that case, I'll do it manually. It says here that your name is (Name), what is your species?" "Human" "I'm sorry, what?" "Human" "Wait. You're the one they're talking about?" "That's me." "Okay. I'll patch you through, and put you on the top of the callers list." You then heard everything that was going on on the tv.

Eventually you heard the words, "Thank you for calling. I think what he said there (about humans coming and taking over their world) is absurd. Why would they? It's not their planet. And - Oboy... our next caller just so happens to be the human himself! Hello (Name) how ya doing?" "Good, good, how are you?" "Good." "Thats good." (Awkward silence.) Then the host of the show said, "So, what do you think about that last question? Would that be something they might do?" "Probably not. But people there would probably not take this very well though. I mean, the fact that they are not alone in the universe." "How do you mean?" "Well, a sort of, - how should I put it - comfort has arisen among them, in the fact that they are alone in the universe. If that comfort is lost, the first thing they will do is get suspicious." "How so?" "Well, the same way that last guy was. Of attack. I believe it happened the same way for you as it did for us. Stories were written, horror movies were made... and a general idea of aliens was established. Some would support it, saying that you as a race, would never try anything like that. Others would stand on the fact that for most of you, that would be true, but it would be impossible to really be certain, and stand on it to the death. I suspect that this may already be happening, vice-versa, here". "Well, if, say, the humans attacked us, we have blades so sharp a handkerchief can fall on it and get cut with its own weight, and some have gotten pretty good at using them." "Well, I don't think it's a good idea to explain the power of our weapons on live television, and, if things work out, it won't ever matter. You see, the humans can't hurt what they don't know about. And so far, I am the only living human that knows about your existence. There was one other, but he died if age. You see, they must never know. I have been able to keep the secret, and where the anthros are on earth, nobody ever goes, ever. I lived in the middle of nowhere, and you would have to drive for an entire hour to find it, from the next nearest residence. I also have hidden security systems set up to alert if a car goes down the road, long before he gets to the farm."

The reporter asked next, "So how did you get here? You figured out the portal? That's what some of the other callers said." "Well yes, I did. I saw one, and it all made sense. All day today I spent working with Dr. Lansing. The portal is made by people. You see, huskys are like walking capacitors. When they have contact with certain species correctly, and then touch a fox, a dimensional hole is made. At this stage, it is like a soap bubble. You can transfer it to a metal frame. Then, if you supply power to it, (I'm not going to say how, this can't get out of control) it can be sustained, and made larger. In fact. Tomorrow, 5 people will be called, to participate in making a portal. It will not be shown on live tv." "Well, I'm sorry, it's time to take a break, stay on the line, we will continue after these messages... CUT! Thank you so much for calling. It's good to hear everything from the mouth of the one were talking about, plus, the amount of people we have watching is going through the roof right now." "Well, good. The more people know about this the better."
144111211211212122221111121.title: "Go for it"

1441112112112121222211111212.content:
It has now been two days since (Name) ended up stranded on an unknown planet. Why havent the others restarted the portal on their end? This is a flashback.

Tara's POV.

Oh, crap. "Marie, RUN! Sasha? Where are you going!?" You say. (Vicky has just driven away.) "To get Luna! She knows how to deal with this kind of thing" she said as she ran into the house. Probably to press the alarm (Name) put in. What should you do now? Nothing really. There was no way you could keep up with that car, and, OH SHIT! neither can Marie! There she was, panting and walking back. Well, at least we still have Tali... Where is she? "Tali? TALI!? OH SHIT! Sasha! She took Tali-" BANG!

A few seconds later, you saw Sasha and Luna fly out of the barn, and off in the direction Vicky went.

About five minutes later, you saw the car return. Here they come, You'll have to go get the handcuffs (Name) brought. You turned around, and CRASH!

Oh no. That had better not be what it sounded like...

Vicky's POV.

'(Name) will kill me for real when he gets back. He's been carrying around a gun ever since he got back. I'm dead.' You thought. 'I wonder what it's like to die. It shouldn't be much pain, its a gun. I wonder what happens after. Where the hell did Sasha come from anyway?' Then you got an idea. You waited until Sasha pulled into the driveway, and went to park. It was then that you made your move. The car always got parked next to where (Name) built the portal. So you reached over and jammed the steering wheel to the left at just the right time, and CRASH! Right into the portal. It was out of commission. Shock was written all over Sasha's face. Then her expression turned to horror, and then to anger. Then everything went black.

Later...

You woke up on a cold, concrete floor. You had a banging headache, and what you thought was a bump on your head. You recognized where you were, in the celler. You noticed that the table and the sofa were gone. It was a completely empty room. Then you found that your hands were bound. With handcuffs. You also found that your feet were bound the same way. You also noticed that your handcuffs on your hands were on a chain that went through a pulley in the wooden beams above you. Tali was not in the room. Then a door opened. Sasha came down. She looked at you, with a look of anger that gave you the fear of death, again. Then she spoke. "You know, you should consider yourself lucky. I wanted to kill you while you were out, but I couldn't find a gun, except one loaded with blanks. (Name) moved the bullets for that on me and now I don't know where they are. And we are out of ammo for the shotgun too. And you can thank Tara and Tali for convincing me not to just break your neck. I hope you like it here, because you're never going to see daylight again. (Name) is the only one that can change that, and we both know where he is. We both also know that he probably wouldn't change that anyway. Tali will not be allowed to see you. Ever. You've dug yourself into a deep hole my 'friend' Only (Name) can change these rules." With that, she went back upstairs. Well, at least you weren't going to be killed, yet.

Sasha's POV.

You went back upstairs. It was dark, very dark. You looked at the clock, 12:36 am. Time for bed. Tali was asleep on the sofa. Then Luna knocked on the window. You opened it, and she came inside. She said "So, did you kill her?" "No, she is in the celler. She just woke up." " What's gonna happen to her, and how long will she be there?" You looked at her funny. "I'd say she earned a 99 to life. She damaged the car, and ruined any chance of us getting (Name) back." You almost started crying as you said this. Then, to your surprise, Luna just said, "There is always hope." "What?" "(Name) made the portal, he can do it again. You can't forget that." She said as she flew away.

Now you had to wrap up the night. Tali was on the sofa, the bars on the celler door were down, Where was Tara? You looked around, and after about 3 minutes you found her, desperately trying to repair the portal, even though it was clearly demolished. Fumbling with the tools, trying not to fall asleep, trying to remember how it had went together... When you asked her what she was doing, she answered, in a fit of anger and determination, "Do you know what my life was like there? I was rejected, everywhere. I lived on the streets, sleeping behind this one dumpster, eating out of garbage cans... People attempted to violate me more than once, I will not let the same happen to him!" "Look, I'm sorry, but there's no way we can fix this without him. All we can really do is wait, maybe he will be able to make another and run it from there. It's not like there aren't any anthro's there!" She sighed, with a tear falling from her eye, and said, I guess you're right. But what if another reporter comes?" "Well, we'll just have the car parked in the forest or something, and if someone comes, the alarms will go off, and you know the drill, but if he doesn't see a car, he will assume (Name) isn't here. We'll be all right." She went into the house, and sat down next to Tali. Then you went upstairs to bed.
1441112112112121222211111212.title: Tara's POV

14411121121121212222111112121.content:
Back to (Name's) POV

The next morning, you were again woken up by the phone. This time however, Heather answered it. You walked out of your room, and figured she must have been talking to Dr Lansing. When she was done, she said, "Dr. Lansing will be in the parking lot by the time you get down there. You had better go now though, don't want to keep him waiting. Call me before you test the portal, I want to be there." You nodded as you went out the door.

When you got to the lobby you saw an orange car pull up. When you got in it, Butch handed you a list, the list you had requested last night. It had everything you wanted, and more. Male and female of each species, and their names and numbers. Most were related to the people you knew. Butch said, "I saw, or rather, heard you on the news last night. I'm glad you didn't tell them too much about how the portal works. That reporter guy tried to ask you about your weapons like 4 too many times." "I didn't think it was worth smashing their sence of security. Our weapons are far more dangerous and effective then a blade." "Really? How so?" You gave him a look and said "Now don't YOU start on me."

When you got there, you started calling the people on the list. Only one or two declined, for business reasons, but they were males, so you didn't think it mattered. About 40 minutes later they arrived. One husky. One cow. Two horses. Two ewes. Two foxes, one being that boy you met when you first came to this world. Then you remembered. You called Heather, to give her plenty of time to get there. 30 seconds after you Hung up the phone however, you saw her out the window, flying. Of course. She jumped out the window, and just glided her way here.

You now had 8 furrys in the lab staring at the portal frame, and Heather is less than a minute away. You decided it was time to tell them what they had been called there to do. When they asked how it would work, you explained "Huskys are like walking capacitors. When charged, of they have contact with a fox, they discharge. The discharge releases a very large and long lasting lightning bolt. You all have probably seen this happen, already. It's called static electricity." On hearing this, the husky asked, "Then how do we get charged up?" "Simple" you said, grabbing a pair of nasty-looking alligator clips that looked like they came from a jumper cable. She recoiled back in horror, but then, Butch started laughing. Not a mad scientist laugh, just a laugh as if it was a joke. "Just kidding." Then everyone in the room started laughing, except Heather,who had no idea why they were laughing, as she had just got there. You continued. "If that were true, then why would you 5 be here? No. You charge by contact. How this works is you would clear rub her arm for 30 seconds, then his, then hers likewise. Then you would touch your hand to the foxes here, like this." You made your hands into C shapes, and put them together to make an O shape. At this stage, the portal you will have created, will be much like a soap bubble. Simply transfer of to the frame, in that little corner there. When that's done, I'll do the rest on this computer. Go ahead.

Soon, they had transfered the portal to to the frame, and you turned on the power. Then you pressed your magic button, and instantally the portal spread over the entire rectangle. What you saw on the other side was a blue sky, not a ground. You played with the fine tuning to try and fix this, but nothing happened. Then it hit you.

You walked over to the portal, and stuck a camera through, facing down. When you replayed it, you saw that the ground was a long way away. The portal was on the 27th floor, and the ground through the portal was almost 300 feet away. You and Butch said the exact same thing at the exact same time. "We need to do this on ground level. But how?" Then you saw the window washer elevator thing. Yep, you knew what to do.

Butch didn't really like the idea, but he didn't really have any other choice either. About half an hour later, it was at ground level. Then you moved it to the same spot you came to this world from. When the portal was started, the first thing you saw through it was- oboy. That must be why they hadn't started it from thief end. There it was, a perfect picture of your car, smashed into the first portal.

That wasn't what Heather saw though. She saw what was behind the wreckage, a certain bat in the barn.
14411121121121212222111112121.title: Almost there...

choices: lets you take the gun from her.
144111211211212122221111121211.content:
Even though you were right in front of the portal, you were not the first one through it. That was Heather, and that fox boy. He ran like heck and almost tackled Tali. You then looked over and saw Heather desperately trying to wake Luna up. You forgot about the car, and ran through the portal, grabbed your glock, and fired a shot into the ground away from everybody and everything else. THAT woke Luna up. It also got the attention of everybody in the house. You ran toward the door, and when you got about halfway there Sasha ran out the door at full speed, and almost tackled you in an embrace. Just like when you came back from California, she started asking questions at a very high speed. Again, you could always answer every question with a simple yes or no.

When she was out of questions, you then braced yourself for Tara, who also came flying at you at a PDQ. She hugged you the same way Sasha did. But, she was in tears. When you saw this, you remembered what she said her life had been like there. She also asked a lot of questions, but slower than Sasha and all of them concerning the safety of your "trip". Your conversation went something like this:
Tara: Are you hurt?
You: No.
Tara: Did anyone try anything with you? (You knew exactly what she meant.)
You: No. You see, 4 or so minutes after the portal closed, this bat came over to me. Her name was Heather blackwing. Sound familiar?
Tara: Luna... Her sister?
You: Yep. She told me who she was, asked me what I knew about Luna, and then asked me if I knew how to remake the portal. She knew I was the only chance she had of ever seeing her sister again. So she proposed to me a deal. If I would work on the portal, She would give me everything I needed. She held up her end of the bargain, and I held up mine. She is in the barn right now.

Tara only smiled with relief, and then hugged you again saying, "I missed you."

A few minutes later, you asked, "So. What happened there?" Motioning toward the wreckage. "Well, Maybe you should ask Vicky."

She led you downstairs, and left you there with Vicky. She looked like she had seen the gates of hell. Too scared to cry, to scared to move. You noticed she was staring at your glock. You removed it, and set it on the steps. that seemed to calm her down a little. "Vicky," You said in the kindest, softest most comforting tone you could, "I'm not going to hurt you in any way. I just want to know what happened." Then she started crying. You didn't want to do this to her, so you went upstairs, taking your glock with you.

You went and found Sasha, and asked her what had happened. Her answer was, "If I ever find a gun I'm gonna KILL that bitch!" So you asked Tara, but her answer was the same as her first one. Luna was occupied, Jane didn't know, Marie didn't know the whole story, Bess didn't know, Tali was occupied...

So you went downstairs again, WITHOUT the glock. That you left on the table in the kitchen. When you got down there, Vicky had calmed down substantially. When she saw you, she said, almost in tears, "Oh (Name), I'm so sorry, I thought you were going to kill me..." You interupted, "Slow down, start from the beginning. Why did the portal turn off?" "I turned it off. I knew that you wanted to do that to me, because of the trouble I caused. So I did it. Then Sasha almost killed me, but Tara convinced her not to, and to simply re-start the portal. I thought you would kill me when you got back, so I had to take the one thing they needed that they had. Me and Tali. So I threw Tali in your car and drove off. Nobody could catch up. Then Tali jumped from the car, down into the river. I thought she was dead, so I slowed down a little, unsure of what to do. 30 seconds later, Sasha appeared out of nowhere, and choked me until I stopped the car. Then we went to see if somehow Tali had survived. She had, but was drowning in the water. Sasha ran like mad, and saved her. Then we drove back. I was certain you would kill me now, so I jammed the steering wheel to the left, and hit the portal. Then everything went black, and I woke up here."

Just then, the door swung open. It was Sasha. And she had your glock. "Finally! A gun! Say goodbye you little BITCH! " you smacked the gun, making the shot miss Vicky's head by mere inches. "WHAT THE HELL ARE YOU DOING!?" You screamed in her face. "Ending our little pest problem." She said as she
144111211211212122221111121211.title: Reunion!

1441112112112121222211111212111.content: With a look of hatred, she shoved you away, and leveled the gun once more. Time seemed to stop. What could you do?
1441112112112121222211111212111.title: Shoots again

14411121121121212222111112121111.content:
You moved faster than you ever thought possible. The bullet hit you under your left rib cage. It felt like a whack, and didn't really hurt, but you knew it would...

Sasha recoiled on horror at what she had just done. She ran up the stairs, to find Tara, you supposed. Then you felt it. Then, you leaned against the wall, ignoring the pain, and picked up the gun Sasha had dropped. You took it apart. Things were starting to go black. You grabbed the firing pin of the gun, and stuffed it into your pocket. The last thing you saw was Tara, rushing down the stairs...

..........................

Later, you woke up in your bed, with a Sharp pain in your side. You had been bandaged up, but you knew the bullet was still in there somewhere. Tara was sitting by your bed. You asked, "Is Vicky okay?" "Yes. It's Sasha you should be worried about, she looks like she could commit suicide." You smiled, and pulled the firing pin out of your pocket. "The gun won't work without this. Is the portal still open?" "They closed it, because they knew you could rebuild the portal, and I don't think you'll need to either. Nobody wants to go home." "Tara," You said, "Two things. 1. Sasha can never find this." You said, handing her the pin. "2, I need to drive myself to the hospital. That bullet is still in me, and lead is poisonous." She freaked out. 20 seconds later, you and Tara were in your car, which was still in pretty good condition, except for a dent in the front left corner.

You started driving. You said, "Tara, it's nice for you to want to come with me, but you can't be seen as an anthro. It's just too dangerous. Which means, you'll have to stay in this car, for a long time." "How long?" "I'll have to have surgery, and surgeries like this could take anywhere from 2 to 5 hours." "I don't care. I'm not leaving this car."

When you got to the Emergency Room, they told you you needed an X-ray. After that, they told you you needed surgery. You gave the lady a "You dumbass" look and said "No Shit Sherlock! When can this be done? I think the bullet was lead, and I don't know what it damaged." "We're ready now." She brought you to a hospital bed, and gave you an injection. Then she taped your eyelids shut. For the second time that day, everything went black.

............................

You woke up, removed the tape from your eyelids and looked around. Within seconds a nurse walked into the room. She has
14411121121121212222111112121111.title: Take the bullet yourself.

144111211211212122221111121211111.content: "Hey," she said, "How you feeling?" You answered in a happy and carefree tone, which was meant to confuse, "Like I've been shot. Like I've had surgery. Like I've been knocked out. Like I've been through one hell of a week. How are you?" Your effort at confusion gave you a lot more than you bargained for. It was a full 10 seconds before she answered, "Uh... I'm okay... Thanks? Anyway, during surgery, the doctors noticed something odd." She handed you a glass of water. "Your bones, were different, and not the same as regular human bones. They are an estimated 40 times stronger then average. We took a blood sample, and noticed a wierd strand of mutated DNA. We're going to have to put you in touch with a specialist. His name is
144111211211212122221111121211111.title: Bad news

1441112112112121222211111212111112.content:
- Dr. Butch Lansing." You choked on the water, and then swallowed some down the wrong pipe. After a fit of coughing and sputtering, you said, "Sorry, Dr. Butch who?" "Lansing."

You thought about this. Coincidence? Maybe. Maybe not. "And how did you figure out that my bones are mutated?" You said this to excuse the slight pause. "By the density on the X-ray, and the overall structure of the bones" "Is anything else mutated?" "Not that we know of, but a mutation like this, it could do anything. I would suggest seeing him as soon as you can. Can I schedule an appointment?" "How about tomorrow?" "Be here at 12:20."

When you got out to the car, You found Tara, waiting for you, in anthro form. This wasn't a good idea, but you had had your windows tinted, it should be fine. You got in the car, and asked her "What are the chances of there being a doctor on earth, that has the exact same name as one on your planet?" She looked at you, confused. "Well, we know of some sort of small bond between us, but that sounds a little far fetched. Maybe you should go back and see Dr. Lansing, he would know about this-" You cut her off. "I DID talk to Dr. Butch Lansing. He helped me build the portal, and the lady in the building told me to see a DR. BUTCH LANSING! What are the unimaginable chances of that?" She was clearly shocked. "I've got no idea. Why did she want you to see him?" "Somehow, my bones have changed. Their structure has improved, like way beyond natural, and bone density has went through the roof. They are an estimated 40 times stronger than average." She seemed lost in thought for a good 15 seconds, and said, "Just like ours..." "What?" "Your uncle had an incident one day, in short, his four-wheeler trailer ran over his arm, And he had to go to the hospital. He came back with a cast on his wrist. He showed us his X ray pictures, because we were curious as to why he broke something. Sasha could have had her wrist rolled over by that thing all day, and there wouldn't have been a problem. You see, you must have gotten that from us somehow." You thought about this for a moment. "Well, what now?" "I'd say you should go talk with our Dr. Lansing, and maybe go to a hospital there, and see if they know or can figure out what happened. Not tonight though, the only things awake will be bats, badgers, nocturnal people. Tonight though, you need to repair the portal, and In fact, since we're in town you should get some of the supplies required." "But I can't do that to you. You've been here how long, 4 hours?" "Look. I don't know what this mutation of yours will do. It may kill you. The odds are against it, but it could happen. So what's more important? GO!" With that, you left the hospital.

......................................

When you got home, you both went inside, and left most of your stuff in the car. You were going to find Sasha, but you heard something else. A sort of wimpering, like a puppy, but it couldn't be Sasha. It just wasn't the voice. You asked Tara, "What happened to that firing pin?" "Oh don't worry, I ate it. Sasha will never figure out where it is, it will never go anywhere, and even if she figured it out she wouldn't be able to get it out of me without cutting me open." "Um, will I be able to get it back?" "Of course. You need it?" You shook your head, and ran down into the celler, where the noise had been coming from.

You found Vicky, who despite the time, was still crying. Your gun was still there in pieces on the floor, and Vicky was hugging her knees and crying so loudly that she didn't even know you were there. You put your hand on her shoulder, and she looked up.

Then, she hugged you, so fast that it caught you by surprise, and then you hugged her back. Through the sobs she said, "Oh (Name), Why? Why did you do that? You s-should have just let her k-kill me... Why? Why did you save me? I've only ever cause you problems, I'm s-sorry, why?" "Because you didn't deserve to die, there is nothing you could have done that would drive me to kill you. But you and Sasha seem to have a little history, and it seems that she would. However, Until I see some MAJOR change in her I will not let her touch another working gun, so you don't have to worry about that. What you need to know is that I'll be fine, they got the bullet out and bandaged me up, it should heal fully in a month. Let me worry about your safety, I'll install a new lock on the door up there, and set it so that she can't get in. I'll do that right away." She just hugged you tighter, and then you said, "You know, I know of a little boy that really wants to see you... If you're all right your brother and sister can come down here." "My Brother!? Benny? How did you know I even had a brother!?" "He happened to be the first one I saw on that planet, and he came back with me. He and Tali are probably somewhere out there together right now."

You went and found them in the woods, in Vicky's den. As you walked back, you had to explain that you were all right. When you were done with that, you said, "Listen, guys, when we get there, I'll let you in, and in 5-10 minutes I'll come back and let you out. I have some work to do on the locks."

When they went down into the celler, you closed the doors like you said, and went to your room and looked through your "Gadgets" You came back with a eyeball scanner. You changed the locks to electronic, and set it to both your eyes and both of Tara's. After some testing before closing the door, you asked them if they were ready to come out. They weren't, so you locked the door. Now you had to deal with Sasha.

You figured she'd be in her room, and you were right. There she was, crying, or rather wimpering like a puppy, into her pillow, which was pretty soaked. Like Vicky, she did not even notice you until you put your hand on her shoulder. Then, like Vicky, she hugged you so fast, it took you by surprise, again. Her questions were almost the same. "Why? Why did you save her? All she's ever done is cause trouble." "Because," You answered, " No one deserves to die, I don't care what they do. And because, you would never forgive yourself afterwards." "What? After all she's done to me?" "Killing another being, is such a horrible thing, and nobody ever feels right afterwards. Everybody wishes they could change what they did, but they can't. I just couldn't let that happen to you. You were in a fit of rage, and that's when its the worst." "But why did you take it? Why didn't you just hit the gun again?" "Because, it was the only way. The only way to stop you. I can't fight you, I couldn't hurt you in a way that would make shooting her impossible, I'm not anthro." Not yet anyway, you thought. "I'm sorry I-I..." And then she broke off into sobs. You hugged her a little tighter, "It's all right. I know you didn't mean to, and would never. And I'm going to be fine. I will be back to normal in under a month, don't worry. They got the bullet out, and bandaged me up, it missed all vital areas, just a flesh wound." She seemed a little relieved at that.

You went downstairs, and went to check on the little foxes in the celler. They came out, and you closed the door. Tali asked you, "How long will she be in there?" You thought about this for a moment, and said, "Just until my car gets repaired. I have insurance, it should be simple. Probably under a week." "You mean, you're not mad at her?" "No. I would let her out right now, but if I don't do something Sasha may have a problem. I doubt it, but maybe."

As it was getting dark, you put on your night vision goggles and started to work on rebuilding the portal. You decided to put a new design in it. You made it work like an etch-a-sketch. Two bars, perpendicular to each other would be 3 inches from a side. Then, when you pressed *this* button, they would both ride on thier rails and make the 3 x 3 square spread throughout the entire frame. As you were building this, you heard something. It was
1441112112112121222211111212111112.title: Dr. WHO!?

choices: The next day (I keep saying this, don't I?)
14411121121121212222111112121111122.content:
You turned around, and saw the two bats. You didn't say anything, you didn't need to. Then they made a growling sound, and then, ROAR!

They were obviously trying to startle you, so you said, "Nice try you two". They looked shocked, and Luna, or Heather, you couldn't tell, said "Aw, no fair. How the hell did you know we were here? And what are you doing out here?" "I'm working on the portal." "Uh huh... My eyes have proven themselves FAR better than yours, and yet I can barely see a thing. What are you REALLY doing out here?" "Rebuilding the portal." "Okay, if you're not going to answer that, answer this then." The other one said. "How did you know it was us?" "Well, first I heard something, so I turned around and saw you." "You SAW us. Again, not possible." "What if I told you that you both are leaning on each others shoulders, and you both have your legs crossed to the outside. And what if I told you that you, on your right, my left, was the one talking, and using a lot of hand movement while talking, while the one on your left, my right, made no hand movements at all. Would you believe me?"

The one on your right said, "Heather, were you making hand movements?" "Uh, yes... Were you Luna?" "No... how the hell... Okay, I believe you. So how can you see us when we cannot see you?" Human technology. Can you see the headgear I'm wearing?" They squinted, looking VERY hard at your head. Then you turned on a small flashlight. "Can you see it now?" "Cool." Said Heather. Luna said, "So that thing let's you see in the dark?" You nodded. "Here, let me go get the other pairs... " You went into the house.

You came out and told them to try them. "Cool" they both said at once. Then Luna was able to notice your bandage. "Hey, what happened to you?" "You mean you two slept through both gunshots?" "GUNSHOTS!?" "Yeah, but it was an accident. Sasha found my gun and almost killed Vicky, I stopped her, but I had to take a bullet. Then I went to the hospital... Which reminds me... I have to finish this." "But, are you all right?" "Yeah, I'll be fine, it should heal in under a month. No big deal, I haven't had a claim on either health insurance or auto insurance in 10 years, they shouldn't be too finicky." "But why are you working on the portal now? I mean, it's midnight!" Heather asked. "I have to talk to Dr. Lansing again, the doctors in the hospital found some kind of, well, difference in me. My bones have improved, and are now 40 times stronger then average. Tara thinks I may have gotten it from you." "Me?" Heather asked, confused. "Not personally, but from anthros in general, or from something on your planet. I don't suppose you know anything about it?" "Sorry" "Anyway, I should really figure this out there rather than here. They know of my, and my race's existence. We do not. They would have an easier time figuring this out than we would. (When I say "we" I mean the humans)"

"Well, we would help you build that thing, but we need to find some food," She paused a second before saying, "or drink." Then you remembered Heather eating pizza. You also remembered that you had a few in the freezer. You didn't know if she was just eating it to be polite, but you might as well offer. "Hey, I have a few pizzas in the freezer if that would help, would that work?" "Pizzas?" Said Heather, "That's odd. I didn't think you had those here." Luna said, "Well, you'd be surprised how much is the same here as it is there. (Name) knows that better than I do. Anyway that would work, but in the case of bats, blood is the main food sourse. However, if we help you, will it be ready by tomorrow?" "Absolutely." "Then tomorrow morning we'll go get some blood there. It's a lot easier to get it there than it is here."

Heather volunteered to put the pizza in, so you gave her a house key. At about 2 in the morning you had the new portal finished. You were able to salvage most of the electronics from the other one, so you only had to buy one taser.

You thanked them and went to bed, setting your alarm for 7:00 am. Yes, it wasn't much sleep, but you didn't want to have to wake them. You'd rather catch them before they went "to bed".
14411121121121212222111112121111122.title: BOO!

choices: Everything in order, time to go!
144111211211212122221111121211111221.content:
You woke up the next morning to the most wonderful sound... The stupid "Buzzzt buzzzt" of your alarm clock. Normally you would hit the sleep button (or rather, slam), but today, you had to go figure out your mutation with Butch.

You found Sasha, and told her you had to go back to their planet, so she went to get the others. You grabbed some breakfast, and ran to the barn.

You caught the bats just before they got all "hung up", and said "Hey guys- er- girls, Sasha's starting the portal if you want to sleep at your apartment." "Good idea. We'll be there." With that, you ran out the door.

You almost ran into Tali, who had seemed to be looking for you. "Here," she said, "Its the best I could do. I think it'll work" she handed you your gun, the one you had taken apart yesterday in the celler. You looked at it, and saw that everything was the way it should be, except it was missing the firing pin. And only you and Tara knew that. "Thanks, it looks right." You said. You grabbed a holester, and put it on. You did that more for Tali than anyone else. You didn't need it, it didn't work anyway, but whatever.

You went through the portal, and saw the bats fly off to the left. You went to the right, to Butch's lab.

You found Butch working on his computer. "Hey," you said, "What's up?" "Hey, I'm trying to track this wierd radiation that's been going through here. The source seems to be within a 50 mile radius if here. Apparently its harmless, but they want me to check it out." "Interesting. But uh, I need your help again." "Again!? You helped me more than I helped you, I owe you one. What's up?" "Well, you see this? (You tapped your glock) It's one of our weapons. Long story short, I got hit by it, and I ended up on the hospital. After an X-ray, and surgery, the doctors discovered a mutation in me. My bones, they've improved, like, beyond natural. They are now 40 times stronger than average." "Cool." "Thats what I thought, until I heard the name of the doctor they were going to send me to." "Who?" "Dr. Butch Lansing." "WHAT!?" "Uh huh. You mentioned that there was some kind of connection between our planets, but you didn't say anything more. Can you explain this?" "Well, I know I shouldn't be surprised, but I am. I mean, after all the similarities between our planets, I should've known. I'm afraid I can't explain why, but everyone here feels a sort of bond with something they just can't quite place... It's very small, small enough that some ignore it so much they forget about it's existance. It's really odd." Well, I was hoping you could explain why I have this mutation, and if something here caused it." "Well, I'm sorry, I don't have a good answer. How much stronger than average did you say? 40 times?" "Yep" "Cool. How strong is average?" This brought back to you everything you knew about the human skeleton. Then you remembered the story Tara had told you, and a little memory on the strength of fingers. You said, "Well, let's just say this. My uncle broke his wrist under a, I don't know, 500 pound trailer. Upon investigation, it was concluded that anthros have much stronger bones than humans, an people suspect I got the mutation from here because of this. And, ummmm... What was it....? I think it takes about 12 psi of force to break the average human finger." "Okay, much weaker then. It takes about 60 psi of force to break the average anthro finger. So I guess I should take an X-ray, and a few various scans."

You had just enough time to take the X-ray, and a scan with a name you couldn't remember. Then you went back home. The portal opened in front of you when you got there, and you looked at your watch. 10:59, a minute early. Good job Sasha!

When you got back you found
144111211211212122221111121211111221.title: The next day (I keep saying this, don't I?)

1441112112112121222211111212111112211.content:
You got in your car, and drove away. You looked at the time. 12:03. You started thinking. What if you could get there in 10 minutes? The speed limit of your "driveway" was 20 mph, so you sped up. WAY up. Tires squealin', with you steering like mad due to a Corvette's nasty habit of "fishtailing" at high accelerations, to 40... 60... 80... 100... 110...120 mph! You just didn't have the stomach to go any faster than that, even though your spedometer went up to 200 mph. going now twice the highway speed, and 6 times the speed limit. Turning the steering wheel 3 degrees was just stupid. Especially because you had 15 miles of straight stretch before you.

This was fun. You never had really gotten a chance to "See what she can do" , but you did get a chance to take it to a race track once. But, as it was right after you bought a expen$ive paint job, you took it slow, and didn't really go for it. Now it was different. Everything was whizzing past you, a completely unrecognizable blur.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211.title: Everything in order, time to go!

choices: Let them fight their own war.
14411121121121212222111112121111122112.content:
You got to the hospital, and, after just making it to the front desk, you were stopped by a security guard. You then remembered your glock at your side, and knew why he had stopped you. He asked for ID, and took your gun. He told you to find him before you left to get it back, he just couldn't have you walking around in a hospital with a gun.

After the little incident, a lady led you "Right this way" into an examination room, and told you to wait for this new Dr. Lansing. About four minutes later, he came in.

"You must be (Name)." He said. He looked, well, like the Dr. Lansing you knew, without the fur, the tail, the muzzle, and the ears. His voice sounded exactly the same. You replied, "That's me, and you must be Dr. Lansing" "Oh, please, call me Butch." Hmm. That was the same thing the Dr. Lansing you knew said when you first met him...

"It says here that you have a mutation that increases the strength of your bones. I believe we should take a couple different scans, and another X-ray." He said. So the next 3 hours were occupied with these scans. You could never remember the names of any of them, except two. X-ray, and CAT scan.

After these scans, he brought you back to the examination room. He said, "Well, the only thing I can do is wait, and see what happens. You should probably come back next week. How about next Monday at 4:00?" "Fine by me, but um, is there anything I should do about this?" "Well, mutations like this sometimes occur at points of high emotion. Very high emotion. It doesn't really matter what kind, but It's rather difficult to do with anything other than thrill, and fright. So, why don't you do something like sky-diving?" "Well, I guess the chances of injury are pretty small..." "That's the spirit!" Go live life on the edge! Have some fun. Do the stupid things nobody in their right mind would do. (Within reason.)"

So, on the way home, you went to the one place where you could go sky-diving. they were pretty busy, so you looked around the little shop they had. Then something caught your eye. It was an advertisement about a new parachute. It was a safety chute, that used an airbag-like explosion to deploy the chute, and had two chutes, in case of a failure. It also had cartridges you could buy that made the explosion, which were optional. They were popular among builders and construction workers in the city- Hmm. That thought gave you a nasty idea. So, you bought one, and then, oh, Damn. You left your gun with the security guard. So, instead of going home, you went all the way back to the hospital and got your gun. Twelve minutes later you were again whizzing down your driveway at a plain old stupid speed. 10 minutes later, you were home.

Just before you got home, you looked at the time. 5:30. Oh well. You were hoping to go back to the anthro planet, but the time wouldn't really matter. You saw your house, so you slowed down. You were going about 30, when, a portal appeared out of nowhere, right in front of you! You slammed on the breaks and then pulled the emergency break, and started sliding sideways. On the other side of the portal, there was a road. However, you were going perpendicular to it. You then saw your parking spot. You saw Butch come around the corner, see you, and dive to the left. You slid right through the portal, and did a perfect parallel park between Butch's familiar orange car and someone else's, with just inches to spare. Well, there was now no need to go sky-diving. Heck, you might need a new pair of underwear.

"HOLY SHIT! WHAT THE HELL...!" Butch yelled. "You could've got both our asses killed!" "Well, next time you should start the portal 15 freakin' feet to the left. It's right in the middle of my driveway! You know what's really damn lucky? The fact that the emergency break works on this car and the fact that the portal didn't appear half a mile that way." You said, pointing. "I was going 120 mph back there." "Jeez. You're crazy." You got out of the car. "You know, sometimes I wish that were true..." "Anyway, I told you about the other project I was working on right? Well, in your DNA, I noticed something missing. When I looked further, I found what was missing, but it was very immature. I also found that same kind of immature pattern in the odd radiation they asked me to figure out. Basically, it's turning you into one of us. When I told this to the authorities, they told me that either you had to turn into an anthro, or leave this planet until the war is over."

The word "war" stopped you in your tracks. "War?" You said. "Uh, yeah... I thought you knew. We're at war with the Nazis, again. It's the second time they've started a world war." "You mean you're still fighting world war 2? We won that like 50 years ago..." "It started 60 years ago. Anyway, the radiation source is in their territory." "So that's why people keep asking me about our weapons." "Yep. And because you were so closed-minded about the weapons on the news last week, the authorities didn't even bother to ask you about doing some trading. We're starting to lose the upper hand as well. If we had better weapons we could secure the device and deactivate it."

Hmm. Butch was basically asking you for weapons. You thought about this. You didn't want to become an arms dealer, and that would only fly so long on earth. Anybody looks at you and sees what you buy, will think you're up to something. You didn't want to kill anyone, you weren't a soldier. You did know a gang of people that just finished serving either in the army, navy, or black ops, but then you would have them to deal with. You couldn't tell them what you knew, and then have them tell someone else, that would just be trouble. And then, with the weapons you had, you wouldn't be able to get very far. A couple of glocks, a shotgun and a revolver won't do much against an army. You probably should just keep your hands clean. What do you do?
14411121121121212222111112121111122112.title: Nothing, you're fine

144111211211212122221111121211111221122.content: Should you be an arms dealer or round up some of the backstreet boys and kick ass?
144111211211212122221111121211111221122.title: Arms dealer + other options

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
"You know Butch," you said, "I'd like to speak with these authorities you keep talking about." "You mean you're going to give us weapons?" "Not necessarily. You see, I don't think It's a good idea to become an arms dealer." "Why not?" "Let me put it this way. One has to jump through quite a few hoops to get a gun there. They want to monitor what you have, and how many of them you have, and the damage you could do with them. Because of this, the more dangerous weapons are very difficult to get. Now I couldn't afford to buy you hundreds of guns, you would have to pay me. Your currency isn't valid on my planet, so it would have to be in gold and/or silver. Now when someone buys a ton of guns, and all of a sudden gold starts coming out of nowhere, I'll look like a gangster. That means the other option is to buy one of each kind of weapon, and make a factory here. But, some of the materials I'm sure you won't have, like gunpowder. I don't know how that stuff is made, and every time you search something like "How to make gunpowder" on the internet, your name is added to a list. Every time you look at pornography, your name is added to the list. Every time that stuff is searched, your name is put higher on the list. Then, if something bad happens, and martial law is established, they will round up the people most likely to start a revolt. The top say, 400 people on the list, and anyone with a against them are usually the first people to go. So you want to stay off the list if you can. (Author's note: This is true by the way). But, I don't want to do nothing, so I'll tell you what I'll do. Before I inherited the farm, I had some friends that I knew very well, and 10 years ago, they all went into different branches of the military. I've been keeping tabs with each of them ever since. If there's anyone we can trust, it would be them. They have been trained to fight, with or without these weapons." "So, you won't give us weapons then?" Butch said. "No. It won't be needed. You really should see what these guys can do. Anyway, when can I see these authorities? I want to male sure they're okay with this." "I'll make an appointment with them tomorrow. Would you like to meet them here, or there?" He said, pointing through the portal. "There will be fine, preferably fifteen feet to the left though..." You both laughed. Yes, you both almost got killed, but really, what else could you do?

You got Butch to move his car, so you could get yours out of there. There was no way you'd be able to get out of there with the 2 inches of space on each end. Butch told you that they would activate the portal from their end sometime tomorrow. With that, you drove home.

Now, nobody at the farm knew that this had happened, so when you got there, you were flooded with questions. When they were finally done, you said, "You know, a funny thing happened to me on the way home... I was going pretty fast, and a portal opened up right in front of me. I almost hit Butch, and almost wrecked my car, and someone else's. But I started sliding and parallel parked perfectly, with 2 inches to spare on either side. He told me that there was an odd kind of radiation there, and it was causing my mutation. So, I wanted to shut it off. But, the source was in enemy territory. That's when I found out that you were at war." Sasha said, "Heather never told you? Well, yes, we were. What does this mean?" "It means, I either will have to turn into an anthro, or not return until the war is over. Now before this, I never figured out why people kept asking about our weapons. Now I know. But, I'm not going to become an arms dealer, I've bought too many guns already. And I'm not going to run a factory there, that would be dangerous and I don't know everything one would need to to do that. So, I'll just have to do it myself. But, I can't do it myself. Here's where you come in. Who here wants to go on a, well, boring adventure?" "Wait, you want US to be soldiers?" Asked Sasha. "No," you replied. So Sasha, Tara, and Tali all raised their hands/paws. Then Sasha said, "Then what do you have in mind?" "Well, if the authorities approve tomorrow, I will have to go back to California and round up some people I know. They are soldiers." "Wait wait wait." Said Tara. "I thought you said telling other humans about us was a bad idea." "Yes, I did. But these people I trust. I would trust them with my life. But, they would think I'm crazy when I tried to tell them, so I'll need some proof." "So you want one of us to come with you, all the way back to California, to reveal ourselves to them. Right?" Said Sasha. You nodded. Then you said, "So, who wants to go?" Both Sasha and Tara raised their hands. Who should you pick?
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Assemble your army (You're an idiot)

choices: The portal. They've made their decision.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
"Well," you said, "I cant really pick you both, there's not enough seats in the car. I'm sorry Tara, but I already spent some time with you these past few days, and, after the incident, I need to spend some time with Sasha. You understand, right?" She frowned. "Yes," she said, "I guess that's true."

Then, you went to do your long-neglected chores. When this was finished, you went to the local library, and got on a computer. You went on eBay, and watched a set of 5 2-way radios, and a base. They had a 60 mile range, and would be ideal with keeping in touch with your friends during an attack. Then you signed out of eBay, and then searched for a place where you could get an automatic weapon. You were NOT going up against perhaps half an army with a pair of glocks and a shotgun on your back. You found a place about three hours away, and got their number and address. You did not like the prices they charged for their guns. But, you didn't have any other choice.

By that time, it was getting late, but you decided to head to the police department to get a licence to own one of these guns. The lady behind the counter did a full background check, and checked your contacts. There were quite a bit. Belle, a pizza place, a bunch of calls to your insurance companies, a ton of calls from reporters, various calls to road-runner about deactivating services from your old apartment, that kind of stuff. Then she checked your email, and even your deleted items. Then she charged you for all this, and gave you the licence.

What a day. When you got home, you went up to your room, and collapsed into bed.

The next day, you had the portal opened by 6:50 am. You told Sasha to keep the portal running, it wouldn't be more than 15 minutes. You grabbed your parachute, and went to Heather's apartment. When you got there, you found them watching the morning news. "Oh hi (Name)," said Luna, "Right on time." You looked at your watch. 6:59. "You two ready to go?" You asked. "I think so." Heather replied. Then you remembered your nasty idea. You said "Hey, you guys up for a little challenge?" You said, walking further into the room. Heather nodded, Luna did not. "Something tells me you're up to something..." "Well, I've got fifty bucks that say I can get down to the portal before you can." "Well, first of all, your currency isn't valid here, and second of all, there's no way in hell you'de be able to get down the elevator, or the stairs faster than we can go out the window." "Well then, make it a little refrigerator then. And maybe I've got something up my sleeve, or know something you don't know." Heather said to Luna, "Whaddya think?" She replied "I think he's up to something. But I have absolutely no idea how he intends to pull it off. You can if you want to, but I don't trust it." "Hmm. All right, I'm in. Ready?" At this point, you had walked up to them and were right next to her. "GO!"

You ran and dove out the window! Heather and Luna yelled something, first your name and then something that you couldn't hear. You moved into a diving position, and shot straight down. You knew both bats would be behind you, but they couldn't go any faster than you. You watched the ground in front of you. You flipped around and saw both bats, flying the same way you were, at almost the same speed. You turned back around, and waited for just the right time. You had angled your fall so that the open portal was now almost directly below you, so you turned so that your back was to it, but still in a diving position. 3.... 2.... 1.... NOW! you jerked the cord, and it shot the parachute straight out from your back.It deployed, and the cords sort of swung you straight around, STRAIGHT THROUGH THE PORTAL. When the parachute ropes hit the top of the portal, it swung you up, about 10 feet in the air, and then straight down. Wham. You pressed the button, and the parachute wound itself up. Then the bats landed, and ran through the portal. The only thing you could think of to say was "I win!"

Luna thought it was funny, Heather did not. Then you got a bunch of bla bla bla bla blah from Heather about how stupid that was, how easily you could have got yourself killed, why you thought it was a good idea to scare her... While Luna was laughing the whole time, saying things like "I knew it! I knew he had something up his sleeve!". Then she went to get a couple of jars of blood.

Eventually, they hung up for the day. You had deactivated the portal, and explained to the others exactly what Heather was mad about. Tara thought it was funny, Sasha did not. Then you got the same bla bla bla blah you got from Heather. When that finally died down, you ended up wondering what to do. You played some Xbox, checked your stocks, and then played the piano. You played something like this.

http://m.youtube.com/watch?v=3ojt7e88g2I...

When you finished, you looked behind you, and saw Sasha, Tara, and Tali, standing there. Then they started clapping. "Wow, I didn't know you could play like that! That's awesome!" Said Sasha. The others nodded in agreement. "Thanks," You said. You realized this had been the first time anyone had heard you play in a long time. You had always played in your apartment, when you were the only one there, which was basically, always. You shook your left hand a little, saying "That song really gets to my left hand, so much playing, not much rest like the right hand." Tara opened her mouth to say something, but was interupted by
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Sasha

choices: Skip to the meeting in the parking lot.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
Sasha interrupted her "Shh- you hear that?" Tara and Tali listened. Then they nodded. You couldn't hear a thing, but you remembered their sensitive hearing. Then it hit you. You looked out the window, and saw a portal, moving around in an odd fashion, then stopping, then growing to the familiar size. You said, "Sasha, I'm going to need a soda can from the recycle, and a few pieces of metal from the old portal, down there." "Got it." She said as she ran off. "Tara," you said, "I'm going to need that firing pin." Then you left the room. You heard her start hacking as you went down the stairs. You grabbed the shotgun, your glocks, and some ammo. Then you went to greet your visitors. Tara caught you just before you went out the door, and gave you the pin. You stuffed it into your pocket, because you didn't have time to reinstall it.

You had 4,visitors. Butch, a doe, a leopard, and a white tiger. "You must be (Name)." The doe said, "And those must be the weapons you were talking about." You assumed they were talking about the guns you had in your hands. "Yes, I didn't know what Butch told you about them, so I brought a few for demonstrations if needed." Butch said "I told them everything you told me, and their decision depends on the power of these weapons. We brought a bow for comparison." You noticed that the doe was holding a crossbow. You also noticed that Sasha had set a stake in the ground, about 100 feet away, and had leaned a piece of sheet metal up against it. On the top of the stake, she had set the soda can. "Okay, hit the sheet of metal with the bow." It took the doe about 3 seconds to do this. For that crossbow, it was fast. The arrow made a dent in the metal, but not much overall damage. You said, "I should warn you, these guns are very loud- which reminds me. Sasha? Could you let the bats know what's going on?" She walked off to the barn. You grabbed the glock that worked, and put a hole right next to the dent made by the crossbow. Butch asked, "What kind of metal is that?" "1/4 in steel." Then the tiger spoke. "Then we have no armour that can stop a weapon like that. How fast do they shoot?" "Well, this particular weapon will fire as fast as you can pull the trigger. (Bangbangbangbangbang) But, we do have some that you can hold and run around with that fire 15 to 30 shots per second, and we also have one in particular that must remain on a tripod, that can fire 100+ rounds a second. If your decision is a yes, I, and my men will go and buy better weapons." The leopard said "And these men you want to bring, who are they? Have they been trained to use these weapons? Will they be okay if they run out of ammo?" "They have been highly trained in using these weapons, and in hand to hand combat, and can take on almost anyone without using weapons." "What if the people they are fighting have say, a knife?" "They'll still win." "We would like to see this, I mean, that almost doesn't sound possible." "Well, it is." "Oh, how many of you will there be?" "4." "Okay, and what will you charge? How does 20 million to each of you sound?" Your eyes went wide. You answered "I'm sure they wouldn't charge even a 10th of that." "Believe me, if you are able to end the war, with even a peace treaty, you'll all have absolutely every bit of that, and even more. People are dying every day, the entire nation, and our allies would simply beg to pay you." "Then your answer is yes?" Everybody except Butch nodded. "Then I'll have them here as soon as is possible." "About how long would that take?" You frowned. "Six or seven days." "WHAT!?" All four of them said. "You see, I have to drive there. They will require some proof, which means I'll have to bring one of you. Which means I can't take a plane. It's a three day drive. It's the only way." The doe said "Well, just keep in mind that every day, people are dying... Do you know about the prison camps?" "Actually, I believe I do." "Then go, now."

Sasha had gotten into the car, and right then and there you ran straight for the car. And, almost for show reasons, you floored it, leaving 75 foot tire marks behind you.

This time, you were going to get there FAST. 120... 140... 160... 180! The speedometer had went all the way up. Over the engine noise, Sasha said "I'm glad Vicky didn't gun it like this, there's no way even Luna can keep up with this." You smiled, and said "That's why I didn't want Vicky to know how we kept appearing right next to her in the seat. This car is too fast."

Once you got to the T in the road, you slowed down again. You went straight to the highway, and decided to call the men you were going to get. You told Sasha that it was pretty important that she not say anything. You first decided to call Kelly. You had known him quite well, and he had went on to become a navy seal. He had an in-your-face personality, and anyone that told him what to do, he always called "SIR!" It didn't matter if it was his commanding officer or his dentist, or even if the person commanding him was female. You had kept in touch for the last ten years via email and the occasional phone call. You had heard recently that he had gotten out, so he should be able to do this. He didn't really have much family, and the family he did have hated him due to the relations with his mother. His real dad had become a navy seal, so that's what he did.

You dialed, and put it on speakerphone. Your conversation went something like this:

Kelly: Hello?
You: Hey man, its (Name).
Kelly: Hey! What's up man?
You: I actually have an odd question for you.
Kelly: Shoot.
You: What would you do for 20 million dollars?
Kelly: Um, why?
You: Come on. Humor me.
Kelly: Anything, as long as it's legal.
You: Good. I hear you're back in town.
Kelly: Uh, yes... What does this have to do with 20 million dollars?
You: I have a job that would take probably under a year that would give you that.
Kelly: Uh huh... (sarcastically)
You: No, really. But, you're not going to believe me until I give you proof, so I won't tell you what it is. However, do you remember that parking lot at the Kmart in the country?"
Kelly: I think so...
You: Meet me there at 23:30 the day after tomorrow, I'll have some proof for you there. And don't plan on anything after.
Kelly: Hmm. Ok, I'll be there. But seriously, what kind of job are we talking about here?
You: You're not going to believe me if I tell you man. You'll probably ask me to get a CAT scan. Well, I've had 2 of them this week.
Kelly: Okay, fine. How long have you known about this job? And how many other people know about it?
You: You're the first one other than me that knows about this. I'm going to bring 2 others into this though. And don't tell anyone else about this. It's very important that we aren't watched. Don't worry, its legal, but it must be kept secret.
Kelly: Hmm. Well, okay. Where are you anyway?
You: I'm in my car, driving to the parking lot as we speak.
Kelly: So, if I go there right now, I would meet you there?
You: No, I'm in Pennsylvania, so I won't be there until the day after tomorrow.
Kelly: What the hell are you doing in Pennsylvania?
You: I think you should Google my name, and then ask me what I'm doing here. Anyway, I have to call the others. See you then.
Kelly: Okay, bye.
*Click*

Your calls to the others were pretty similar. Jeff was an ex- black ops soldier. He said his family didn't care about what happened to him, they were always doing their own thing. He had a quiet personality, when he wasn't being a soldier. He had always had a thing for guns, and the weapon he had never seemed to be big enough. He didn't give a damn about the bullet proof vests, and protective gear, because "Whenever I shoot, I expose my head unless I'm in a tank." You had been keeping in touch with him via email and the occasional phone call.

Don was a computer nerd when he went into the army, and a computer need when he came out. You didn't know what he did with the computer, but you didn't think it was good. However, he could fight. He could fight like hell. You had been keeping in touch via webcam and email. He never used phones. He would use radios, but not phones.

When you were done calling, Sasha stuck up conversation. It ranged from your piano playing, to why you played the trick on Heather, how you thought you would survive going up against an army with four men, to what happened when you called the news reporter on the television on their planet.

That night, you both slept in your car, because the hotels were going to charge 70 dollars to bring a dog in. You couldn't find even one place cheaper, so you drove into a suburb, found a pick'n'save, and parked way off in the corner, out of the light.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: The portal. They've made their decision.

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
It was 11:00 when you pulled into the parking lot. Even though it was early, Kelly, Jeff and Don were there. You had Sasha turn into a dog before they saw her. You pulled over to a corner, near a bunch of trees, and motioned for them to come over.

You had them park their cars in a square formation, so when Sasha did her thing nobody but them could see. Before you said anything Don asked "What's with da dog?" You answered, "Well, that will get answered soon, but not just yet. Did you guys Google my name?" "I did." Said Kelly. "Then, why do I live in Pennsylvania now?" "Because you inherited a farm there. And you liked the privacy? At least that's what CNN said." "That's true, but does that really sound like me?" Everybody shook their heads. You smiled. "Exactly. Now what if I told you that we aren't alone in the universe?" "Well, you said you'd have proof..." Then Sasha jumped out the open window, and changed into an anthro right before their eyes. Then she said "Is this good enough proof for you?" Both Jeff and Don yelled "WOAH!" And took a few steps back. Kelly didn't say anything, or move. He didn't even blink. He just looked at Sasha for a moment, and then looked at Don and Jeff, with a look that said "Are you kidding me!?" Then he said to you and Sasha "Okay, you got me interested. So, what kind of job is it?" Sasha answered, "Well, our planets are basically the same. The history is very close to the same. We don't know why, or how, but the maps are the same. Different names, same shape and size. We had a world war 1 and 2. However, (Name) tells me that about 500 AD you invented gunpowder. We made no such discovery. As a result, World war 2 did not end." "You want us to win a war for you. Well, there's only three of us. If (Name) comes, four of us. And we'll be going up against entire armys. If I recall, the Germans, who started the second world war, had millions of soldiers. Four men can't do this." "That's not exactly the plan. You see, if you demolish a few of their camps, free the prisoners, (which will act as reinforcements), you'll have them freaked out. If 4 men can do that, their every idea of victory will be gone. Also, do you know what happened to (Name)?" "I heard he shot himself. If he intends to fight with us, he'll have to wait until he is fully recovered." "Actually, I didn't shoot myself, its a long story, but when I went to the hospital, they noticed something. Kelly, break my arm." Now that caught Kelly by surprise. "I'm not going to break your arm-" "Exactly. You can't. No matter how hard you try. My bones are 40+ times stronger than average, and the more time I spend on their planet, the stronger they become. If we win the war, we will be able to control the device that's doing this to me. And if you spend time there, it should happen to you." Now Jeff spoke. "That's actuality pretty cool, but what can you really use that for?" "For instance, to kill me with a headshot, you'd have to hit me in the eyeball. I will never lose a tooth in a fight. A bullet, or in this case, arrow in the leg won't stop me. It won't even slow me down." Kelly said "Okay, fine. But, I doubt their currency is worth anything here, I mean, the lady behind the counter at McDonald's won't accept a bill with Abraham Lincoln with a muzzle and ears on the top of his head." Sasha laughed, and then said "I'm sure if they give you it in cash, you could go and buy say, gold. And hen bring it back here and get your cash that way... If you want to buy anything that we don't already have there. Almost everything is the same. The only things we don't have that you do would be guns and anything related to them, and clothing. We don't need it. Fur comes in handy that way. If you want, you will almost surely be given apartments at the most expensive places, the coolest cars..." "Well, it seems almost as though (Name) is turning into one of you. No offense, but I'm not sure I would stay." "That's the beauty of it. You see, his mutation is being caused by an odd radiation source. If the war is won, we will be able to go to that source and shut it down, maybe even reverse it. You in?" He nodded, and so did Don and Jeff. You said "Good. Then we need to go first thing in the morning. We have to get back to my farm as soon as possible, and I need to find some WiFi. I have to order some radios. There's a place not too far from my farm that sells automatic weapons. You will need some money, but I'm sure they'll reimburse you. Pack plenty of clothes, and if you have any military gear, bring it. I have some night vision visors, but not much else. Meet me here tomorrow at what, 0600 hours? (You got a nod from Kelly) And make sure you all have plenty of gas." With that, they left.

You drove over to the nearest McDonald's, and logged into their WiFi, and bought those radios. You bought faster shipping, they should be at your farmhouse when you got there. Then you went to a Walmart, and bought a cheap prepaid cell phone. You activated it, then went back to the parking lot, and went to sleep.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Skip to the meeting in the parking lot.

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
Kelly and Jeff were there right on time. Don was not. And he didn't have a cell phone, which was why you bought the cheap one last night. When he finally pulled in, he was driving a fat-ass RV. He yelled from the window "Hey, sorry I'm late, I hit a train. But, why don't we leave your cars here, and take this? It has a kitchen, a couch and a flatscreen, a bathroom, and 2 bunk beds, so we can save money on hotels and gas." He parked, and got out of the RV. You said "Well, why didn't you say something about this last night? I mean, seriously." Jeff said "Dude, its not a problem. Nobody ever comes here, we can leave our cars here." You looked at your vette. "Well, you can, but I can't leave my car in a state I don't even live in. But I guess that's all right. I'll drive, but you guys can share a ride if you want. By the way Don, this is for you."

You handed him the cell phone. He said "Well, thanks, but I don't use phones. You know that." "I bought it so if we get split up, I wouldn't have to wait for you to find some WiFi and then meet up with you somewhere... Or if you have to go to the bathroom during the trip. I'm the only one who knows where this is, so if we get split up, you'd be lost." He sighed, and took it. Why he didn't like phones, you never could figure out.

Don then said, "Oh by the way, who is she going with?" Sasha looked at you. You said to her "It's up to you. I don't blame you if you don't like the seats in that car, that car isn't designed for comfort. It's great for a few rides with your girlfriend, but not the highway." Don interrupted "You mean she's your girlfriend? Have you been bangin' her?" Everybody looked at Don. Sasha looked at you, and then him. Kelly looked at you, then Sasha, and then Don. Then he said "I don't think he has to answer that. I mean, so what if he has, and you're not supposed to ask that kind of question anyway. Plus, they don't really seem to me like they've done that." You said "Don, I'm gonna try to forget you said that, and not slug you upside the head with a rock hard fist and the velocity of a baseball bat." Don just rolled his eyes, and you said to Sasha "I'm sure you'll be more comfortable with them. (although maybe not with Don) Even I kinda wish I could go in that.-" Jeff interrupted "You mean you don't want to drive that? Great. I've always wanted to drive a car like that." He started walking toward your car. "Um, I'm not sure I trust you..." You said, staring at the dent in the front if his car. He replied "You don't seem to be one to talk." Pointing at the dent in your car. "That wasn't my fault... I wasn't even in the car when that happened. Heck, I wasn't even on earth when it happened! Anyway, maybe we'll just take turns. I mean, if we do this right, it won't matter what you do to it. Again, we've drifted off track. Sasha, where do you want to be?

What does she pick?
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: The next day (Again...)

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
"Well," Sasha replied, "I think I'd like to go in that." She motioned to the RV. "Okay," you said, "Then Jeff can drive my car, and I'll go with you."

You tossed Jeff the keys, and got into the RV. Shortly after, you heard your car start, and rev wildly as it did. You rolled your eyes, and explored the RV. Wow, Don was not kidding when he said that it was gonna be a better idea. You saw two tables, with 2 chairs each, and just beyond that was a couch, and on the wall opposite it was a rather large flatscreen. Beyond that were two bunk beds against the wall on either side, four beds in all. After that there was a wall, with a door right in the middle. That you assumed, was the bathroom. You sat sown on the couch.

Then Don started the RV and started driving. You said, "Don, where you going? You don't know where my farm is." He said "I'm going to Pennsylvania. Why don't you punch the address into the gps there? And call Jeff, and tell him to follow me. I'm not using one of those things."

You rolled your eyes again, and called Jeff. When you were done, you set the gps, and turned back to the couch. Kelly had sat down next to Sasha, and had just started a conversation. "Well, I don't think we really got introduced. I'm Kelly." He said as he offered a hand- er- paw shake. She shook and said "I'm Sasha. Nice to meet you. (Name) tells me you can fight."He almost scoffed and said "Well, you should see what I can do; with just my thumb." You sat down. She said "I mean, with your guns." He said "Well, any idiot can fire a gun, but not any idiot has been trained to use one like I have. It's actually kind of tough. We're trained to fight without remorse, and kill at the slightest breaking of the rules, follow orders to the most terrible ends, its hard on a guy. I've killed more people than I would care to count, and well, it gets to you at night. Most of the missions I've run were against armed terrorists, trying to steal or kidnap something or someone. Some back down and surrender, others well, I had to crush. To answer your question, yes, I am very good at using almost any gun. Almost." "Well, you'll be fighting people that shoot crossbows and throw knives and use swords." "Okay... Then it won't be hard to force a surrender." "Well, the president and some of the top soldiers will want to see you in battle before they send you into battle, they'll probably put you in the arena."

You said "Arena?" "Yes. It was originally a football stadium, that was built right where the border fell to the enemy. So, they worked on it a bit, and made it into a sort of prison. The prisoners of either side are kept on either side of the arena. So, if I were to get captured, they would put me in their prison on their side, in their country. If we captured any of them, they would go into our prison, in our country. The arena has been set up with arrow-proof glass all the way around, so real battles can be held there. Each month, one random prisoner from each side is selected, and they battle to the death. The survivor wins his freedom." Kelly said "Hmm. So, they're gonna put me in there with someone who's gonna try to kill me, and I have to show off my skills and kill him or her." She replied "It's good because each side videos it and puts it on national live television. If you want intimidation, that's a good way to start." He looked at you. "I don't know if that's a good idea right away. You see, I'd like to hit them hard once or twice before I do that. I'd like them to be completely oblivious to the fact that we are the reason say, 3 of their camps were demolished. Then we can show them. Once we show them what we can do, we can tell them that we are arming our army with the same kind of weapons and training them with the same skills. That's when they'll surrender unless they're just stupid."
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: The fat-ass RV

choices: The next Day... (I gotta find something better)
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
You basically watched movies with Kelly and Sasha until lunch. Then you swapped with Jeff and drove your car until dinner. Then you swapped again, until about 1 in the morning. Because Sasha wanted to know about the human vision of aliens, you watched Men In Black, and one of the Aliens series, and Independance Day. You had just finished when Don pulled over for the night. Sasha said "Interesting. We kind of had the sand idea about aliens, trying to take over for no apparent reason, but we never thought about the fact that that may be the same fear for them." Kelly said "It started out as a simple conversation starter, and then a possibility, and then, well, almost a certainty." She asked "Are you suspicious of us?" "Personally no. We have shown our good will to you, and intend to risk our lives to help you. You Sasha, have shown me that you have a good moral sense of right and wrong, and you seem to be just like one of us, and we wouldn't do that, so why would the majority of you even want to try anything like that? (I say majority, because half of my life was spent fighting the small amount of people who don't care about others, and are willing to kill for even small amounts of money.) By the way (Name), you keep talking about being on their planet, and how similar our planets are, how did you end up there, and in the beginning, who discovered who?"

"Well,"You said, "In their universe, about four earth years ago, there were reports of random dimensional holes appearing. They appeared in a different place every time, but nobody was reported missing. "Yeah." Sasha said. "Until the day I met Vicky in a cafe. We started arguing, and then she threw a punch at me.
