Then the portal appeared. We didn't understand why at the time, but it sucked us in, along with six others. I and Vicky were the only ones that had some history.The others were just minding our own business when it hit, but it sucked them in as well, and we all wound up landing on Earth on his farm, where his uncle was living, except for Vicky, and Tali, who landed near a cave less than a mile away. Why? Nobody knows." Kelly said "So, his uncle knows about you too?" She nodded and said, "Yes, but, he died about a month ago. He took care of us all for 4 years." "I'm sorry."

Just then, Don and Jeff came in, and Don said "Okay, lights out. Oh and uh, who's gonna sleep on the couch?" Both you and Kelly raised your hands, To make sure Sasha didn't end up on the bed. Then you both saw each other's hands, and you both put then down. Then back up, and then you all laughed a little. Then Kelly said "Go ahead man, I'm used to a hard bench, it'll be easier for me than you." You thanked him, and got in bed.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: That night

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
The next two days were about the same. Everyone was switching between driving the car or the RV, to watching movies. There were no real problems on the way, and Sasha was glad that there was a bathroom in the RV. Before, she had to act like a dog, and do it in public. Nasty business.

When you all finally got back to your farm, you saw
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: The next (few) day(s)...

choices: The room being filled with knockout gas!
People are walking down the hallway
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
...everything as you left it. You looked in the barn, but the bats had already went out, and you knew there was no way you would be able to find them. So you all went inside, and, it being 11:00 you all went to bed.

The next MORNING you went downstairs, and found Kelly talking with Tara and Tali at the breakfast table. When he saw you, he said "So it really wasn't you that made the dent in that car." "Yeah." "So this "Vicky" hit Sasha, threw her in the back of your truck, and drove off. After then she shut the portal down behind you. And then ran like the wind, and then destroyed the portal. Is that right?" You nodded, and asked "Why?" "Because that tells me about them a little bit. Either she doesn't know about the power of the gun she was more than once almost killed by, (Which I desperately hope is the case) or she has some serious balls. Which is it?"

You said "I guess I have bad news." "Damn! Do you know what this tells me? It means they won't go down without a fight. So in the arena we'll have to hammer them HARD and literally knock the hell out of them to make them want to surrender. My day just got a whole lot harder. And the only gun I have is a berreta 92."

"Well, that's what were going to do today. About an hour from here, or rather, from the end of my driveway, is a place that sells fully automatic guns. Were gonna get some stuff from there, and then go to their planet. What happens then, I've got no idea." You said. He replied "When do they open? Do they have the H&K Mp5? The m4? Jeff won't settle for anything less than a m124, and I think as a secondary we should have an Uzi mag 9."

When you heard him start saying the names of the guns, you grabbed a notebook and started scribbling. When you finished, you said "Well, they open in about an hour, so we should go. Are the others awake?" Just then you heard an alarm clock go off. You waited for it to stop, and it didn't, so you went upstairs to your room. Everybody had slept in your room, And when you got there you found Both Jeff and don, sleeping away as the alarm blared. You rolled your eyes and called their names. They still didn't wake up. So you went and grabbed two clothes pins and put them on the nose of don and Jeff. Then you ran out the door.

2 minutes later, they came walking down the stairs, grumbling. You didn't say anything about it, and they didn't either. You then told them that they had to go get some guns, so they grabbed some food and ran out the door. You and Jeff took the Corvette, and the others took the RV. You told Kelly to "Follow me if you can." He looked at you a little funny, but he didn't say anything. You started driving, and when you were a little ways down the road, you waited until Jeff looked like he was asleep, then you gunned it. Let's just say he was REALLY glad he left his suitcase in the RV.

you took them to get their licenses, and then to the gun store. You were amazed at what they had. Kelly recommended that you get an Uzi with a collapseable stock, and then either a AK 47, a M4, or a H&K mp5. Eventually you decided to go with the AK 47. You also followed his advice and bought an Uzi. Then you bought a few different straps and holsters, a bullet proof suit, 4 magazines for each weapon and a Shit-load of ammo. Kelly picked the same, except he chose an mp5 instead. Don did too, but he picked an m4 instead. Jeff? Well, they didn't have his M124, (If you haven't looked it up already, that's a minigun) so he settled for 2 large Uzis and one micro Uzi. You made them all buy silencers for their secondary Uzis, and checked out. The guy behind the counter looked at you like he knew you were gonna cause trouble, but you didn't care. If anyone came looking for you, they'd never find you. Ever.

In the RV, you had them gear up. When you got back, you showed them the portal. While Sasha activated it, you grabbed your parachute, just for fun. Then you all went through. It closed right behind you.

You started walking toward Butch's lab, and before you got halfway there, you were stopped by a black SUV. You knew it was armoured, but it didn't appear so. A gorilla got out, and said "You must be (Name), and these must be the soldiers you were talking about. My orders are to bring you to the police station, for a little evaluation. Get in the car.". He seemed friendly enough, so you did as he said.

When you got to the police station, they led you into a rather large room with security cameras, a bow backstop, and a table with 8 chairs. You all set your weapons down on the table, and looked at the backstop. Hay, and well, hay. But hey, it could stop an arrow, but not a bullet. You told them this, and a sheet of 1 inch steel was produced, and leaned up against the wall behind it. The gorilla told you just to wait until a few more people get there. What disturbed you all was the fact that they locked the door. You all sat down at the table, and waited. Then you heard something. It was
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Everything as you left it

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
You ran over to the door, which had a little window with chicken wire inside it, and looked out. A panther in handcuffs had shoved a police man into a metal door, knocking him out cold. He then started running like hell, and soon he was going to run straight past you. Kelly saw this too, grabbed his Uzi, and after checking the doorknob and finding it locked, shot it off. You both then burst open the door, and faced him. He was only 10 feet away. He said "Outta my way monkeys, or I'll do the same thing to you as I did to him."

Kelly said "Is that a challenge?" He gritted his teeth, and ran at you. You shot his right leg, and Kelly shot his left. He simply fell on his face. You both stepped back about 4 more feet, and waited until someone came.

Soon, the same deer, tiger and leopard came walking down the hall, led by the gorilla from before. When they saw the panther on the ground, and the policeman on the floor, they guessed exactly what happened. The gorilla called for a few more men, and presently both of the wounded were removed. Then you all went back into the room.

You all sat down at the table. When the praise died down, the deer said "You must have used one of these weapons, but why didn't we hear them go off?" You smiled, stood up, grabbed an Uzi, and "Ka-chink" fired a single bullet through the hey, and into the backstop. She nodded, and wrote something down on a clipboard. The tiger looked at you and said "So, these are "Them"?" You nodded and said "This is Kelly, Don, and that's Jeff." "And they can fight? I mean, without these guns?" Kelly simply nodded. The tiger said "Well, we were waiting for a soldier, the head trainer of our army. He called and said he will be here any minute now. As for these weapons, are they the kind that shoot 15 a second?" Jeff grabbed one of his unsilenced Uzis and said "This is a Israel model nine milimeter Uzi. It has a 60 round clip, and can fire 20 rounds a second." With that, he fired the gun for about a second, making a mess of the hey, and dropping about 22 spent shells clanging on the concrete floor. He then sat down.

Then a bull walked into the room. "Sorry I'm late." He said. The leopard said "Dont worry about it. In fact, you came just in time. Show here fights the best? Kelly, Don, Jeff, and the bull raised their hands. The deer said Kelly, show us what you can do.

The bull walked to the center of the room, and Kelly got up and walked right in front of him. Then they waited. And waited. Then the deer said "Uh, ding?" The bull swung at Kelly wildly, with too much force to stop, exposing his left terribly. Kelly ran to the left, kicked him straight in the ass, ducked another swing, and smacked him right upside the head, knocking him clean into the air, until he landed on his back. Kelly said "Oh man. No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no. You NEVER turn your back on your enemy. You need to back off a bit. You fight with too much rage. I only kicked you to make you angry, so you would swing again. When you swing, you shouldn't swing so hard you expose yourself that much. Take it down a couple notches."

He looked over at the tiger, and then the deer, and then the leopard. They had wide eyes, and the deer still hadn't picked her jaw off the floor. The leopard said "Well, then, I guess the only thing left is the matter of armour. We have some very-" You interrupted and said "We got that taken care of. I'm wearing it right now." You grabbed Jeff's micro Uzi, and shot a bullet into your sleeve. It bounced back onto the table, and the tiger picked it up. He looked and saw the deformed head, and also saw the tiny pattern of the threading of your bullet proof vest.

"Well, okay... I don't think an arrow could puncture that. Or a sword. Do you mind if we have a few minutes to talk?" They left the room. The bull got up, and asked Don of he wanted to try. Don got up, took one step, slipped on the bullet casings, and fell on his ass. He got up and said "Damn it, Jeff"

Jeff had already went, and started sparing with the bull. He simply taunted him. Dodging every swing, but never losing any ground, and just going in circles, he continued until the bull smashed his fist into the wall.

Just then the leopard came back in. He said "Well, were still doing paperwork, but as far as I'm concerned
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: People are walking down the hallway

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
You're hired. But, you still need to see our armour." Jeff rolled his eyes and said "I don't even need this." The leopard continued as if Jeff had not said anything at all. "If we had the resources to make enough of it for an army, the war would have been won long ago. This armour is the only reason we haven't lost the war already. You could have a tank roll over you and you would be just fine. You could even wear your armour underneath it if you wanted. Just, give it a look. Your armour seems to lack a headpiece, gloves, and boots. We will have some specially designed for you if needed, but please, it would honour our allies if you did." (They invented the armour) You answered "Sure, but don't design it just yet, I'd like to have a little input."

Within minutes you four were whisked away, straight to an army base. You eventually ended up in a large room, with a large table in the centre, and on the table a huge map, with little towers and flags all over it. The Tiger from before, had been the only one that followed you. He said "All right. We are here." He tapped a little tower with a long stick with a hook in the end. "All the little blue towers are our forts. The red and green and yellow ones are enemy forts or camps." Looking over the map, you saw that the enemy had about 20 forts, and 10 camps. What you didn't like was the number of blue forts. There were 15. However, you noticed that the enemy towers were rather spread out, but friendly ones were rather concentrated. You asked "Which ones are concentration camps? Which one is the nearist? (The tiger pointed one out) Good. We should probably hit that one first, and probably go in by stealth, maybe blow something up, and then start shooting like hell. Do you have C4? Grenades?" He nodded. "How much do you need?" "I'm not sure yet. And by the way, who should lead the show?"

Nobody moved. "Kelly?" "I've always followed orders. I don't know how to command." "Same here." Said Don and Jeff at the same time. Should you do it? Or should you let them run the show?
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: You're hired.

choices: Do nothing, and hope it doesn't come up.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
You thought you might as well, you have to say you did something in the war, otherwise you're just a... messenger really. You said "Well, I don't know how to command, but I guess that means I'm the only one left. If you don't do it I will." Nobody moved. You said "Okay, I guess I just got promoted. Um, wh-"

You were interrupted by the door, almost hitting you as it swung open. A falcon anthro was looked you in the eyes, and said "Oh, sorry, I didn't mean to hit you. Anyway, there's a bunch of people downstairs that would like to talk to you about your armour." "Okay let's go." Kelly, Don and Jeff immediately jumped up, and followed you out the door.

The falcon led you downstairs, into a room with a bunch of computers and people using them. The falcon led each of you to a different person at a different computer. You were led to a cat. He reminded you of Tara. Same black coat, same yellow eyes...

On the screen, you saw what looked like armour, in what looked like a designing program. You looked at the logo on the bottom and it said "Solidworks". You then recalled that back on earth, this was what was most commonly used to design almost anything. The cat turned and noticed you. He said "Hello. My name is David Longtail, but everybody here calls me Dave. I heard you had some design input for the suits. My job is to redesign the suit for your needs. What did you have in mind?"

The name "David Longtail" stopped you in your tracks. You immediately thought to tell him what you knew about Tara, but then a thought came into your head. Remember, Tara ran away from him. A family reunion might not be a good idea. Maybe he'll ask you about her, and then what? What should you do?
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Commander (Name)

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
"Well," You said, "What I had in mind was..." Then you heard something. It was Jeff. He was basically refusing the armour. You said to Dave "I'm sorry, one second." You turned around and said "Jeff, what are you doing?" He said "I told you I don't need armour at all. I don't even need a bullet proof vest." "Jeff, you're not going out there without this armour." He simply looked at you, almost in a challenging manner. You said "That's an order." At that, his attitude completely changed, and he said in that military style "Yes, SIR!" and immediately turned back to the computer screen with a completely different attitude.

This surprised Dave a bit, and he asked you about it. You said "Thy are trained to obey any order given to them by a superior officer. And I mean absolutely any order. I could order him to kill an innocent 4 year-old and he would do it without questions, and without hesitation. Not that I would, of course. Anyway..."

You really should've talked to your men about this, because in the end your suit was the most modified. It had tow holsters for your glocks right above the knee on the outside, at your waist on the right you had 6 slots for grenades and a radio, on your left you had a holester for your Uzi. In the middle of your back you had a parachute,and on the left of that you had a slot that fit the top of your AK 47. Between your glocks and your waist, you had slots for all of your clips. Every modification made had a button that had to be pressed to release the item. They were in the most convinient places possible. For instance, to grab your glock, you had to press a little button with your pointer finger which was right where the trigger would be, so it didn't slow you down at all. Your mask, or rather, helmet, would be equipped with night vision, thermal view and an air filtration system, (in case of gas) as well as a radio, both to your men and to the nearest base.

Kelly had holesters, but no parachute, and no mask upgrades, and Jeff and Don forgot to put a place for their clips, and had no mask upgrades either. In the end, they all ended up with a suit like yours, just modified to fit their weapons.

When that was finally finished, you noticed a few bats coming in to replace everyone. You looked at your watch, and well, yeah, it was 10:02 pm. You all were offered fancy quarters, and Kelly, Don, and Jeff accepted, but you didn't. You didn't know how loot you could go before you turned into an anthro. So you went home.

When you got back, everyone wanted to know what had happened, but not everybody at once. So first you had to talk with the bats, and then with Sasha, and then with Tara. You decided to leave the part about Tara's possible father out. Then you went to bed.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Are you sure this is a good idea?

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
You woke up, grabbed some food, and found that Sasha had already had the portal open. You hopped into your car, and drove through. You went straight to the army base. You parked your car in the lot, almost laughing at the fact that you had the only "car" there. There was now one car, and 43 other jeeps, halftracks, and even tanks on the lot.

Before you went to find the others, you thought you'd check on the progress of the armour. Eventually you found Dave, and you asked him to put a sort of slot on the belt, where an attachment could be installed if needed, on all of the suits. Because they had already made the torso of yours, he made you try it on.

You were amazed at the flexibility it had, and the weight. It fit you perfectly. He then asked you what color or camo you wanted. After considering this, you went with
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: The next day... (Sigh)

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
You figured you'd be doing a lot of your missions at night, and require some stealth, so you chose black.

You ran down the hall, around the corner, down another hall, up some stairs, around the corner, down another hall, up more stairs, and down yet another hall, until you got to their rooms.

They weren't there.

You ran back down the hall, down the stairs, down another hall, around the corner, down some more stairs, down that hall, around the corner, down the stairs again and into the map room.

There they were.

They had been trying to form a plan to attack the place you had chosen. They had a general idea of where everything was, but didn't really know what to do. After they showed you a map of the entire camp, you suggested "Why don't we enter from the sky? I mean, how else are we gonna get in? Don, can you hack security systems?" He answered "Probably, SIR! As long as they're the standard security cameras, laser beams and pop-up machine gun turrets, it'll be easy." The tiger, from before, said "The locks on the prisoners cells are most likely electronic. Either remote controlled, or equipped with eyeball scanners, or both. If they are equipped with eyeball scanners, only the guards will be able to open the cells. The prisoners will act as your reinforcements, but if you can't get the cells open-" You interrupted "I don't think we need to worry about that. Obviously someone will have to take out the guards before the doors are opened, otherwise everyone will be killed. That will be easy if we can maintain stealth. So, we'll have someone hacking into their systems, and shut down the defenses, mainly the cameras. We don't even need the cells unlocked. We can use the eyeballs of the dead guards for that, and if that doesn't work we can always just shoot the locks. Worst case scenario we lose stealth, kill the guards, blast open the doors and lead them out of the camp blowing off heads. Which reminds me. This main building here, (You tapped the map) is probably where the generals are, and that one there should be where the soldiers bunk. So I think one of us should set C4 in each of those places, and blow them to kingdom come. Whadaya think?"

Don said "Wrong order SIR! Shoot the guards first, then blow up the buildings, then open the cells and exit while "Blowing off heads". I mean, if the building is blown up first, the guards will know something's up, and our job will be 3 times harder. Not that I mind of course..."

You nodded. "Now I guess, the only thing left is to decide who will do what. That building is the workhouse. Kelly, I want you very near that building. The instant you hear the buildings blow up you storm it, and kill anything that's holding a bow, and get the workers out of there. Don, I want you to plant C4 on each corner of the Generals' building. Jeff, you put C4 under the bunker. That building is 18 inches off the ground, held up by wooden stakes. Why? I think it had something to do with flooding. Use it to your advantage and plant C4 in each corner, but equidistant from the center. I will go to the cells and handle the guards. I'll have the detonater. I want you to radio me when you are clear of the blast radius. Boom. Then when I lead them all out, I want you to handle any survivors able to shoot a bow, and the guards at the gate. When its clear, that's where I'll lead them out. Then we radio home and have transportation brought to take us the rest of the way hi-"

The door swung open, and the falcon from before said almost in panic
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Black. Sounds like fun.

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
"(Name)!" He panicked, "You have a call from an insurance agent back on your planet, Sasha has him on hold. You gotta get back there and handle it now!"

You ran out the door, and well, down the hall, around the corner, down the stairs...

All the way outside. You hopped into your car, and drove straight through the portal, and grabbed the phone.

When the call was over, you had settled the issue of car damage. All you had to do was drop it off at the "local" auto body repair shop, and wait until Tuesday.

Crap. How were you going to do that? You only had one car, so you'd have to stay in town for three and a half days! Then it hit you. The armour wasn't going to be done for at least that long anyway, you won't miss anything there. You already have a battle plan, you might as well have a little fun in town.

Okiedokie. So you went back to the army base and explained what you had to do. What did they think about it?
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: "The portal opened!"

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
Once they considered the fact that all they really had to do was wait, they didn't really think it was a problem. Then it occurred to you that yes, you probably could have say, don drove down there with you in the RV, and then just drive back in the RV. You told them this, and they agreed that this was a better idea. But, when you asked who was going to drive down with you, nobody moved.

So you flipped a coin. In the end it was Jeff.

On the way out the door, you were stopped by a cat. Probably Tara's mother, you thought. You almost panicked thinking she wad going to ask you about Tara. She wasn't. She said "Hey, you're (Name) right?" You nodded. She continued. "My name is Susan. I am actually very high up here, almost anything I want happens. Anyway, I was wondering if you would like a better car than an RV. I mean, its the least we can do, and I could get it to ya in under 30 minutes." You thought for a second before saying
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Not a problem.

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
"Okay." She said, staring at a clipboard, "Would you like the ferrari enzo, the lamborghini veneno, the Rolls-Royce-" "Woah woah woah woah..." You interrupted, "You don't need to spend 4 million dollars on this. No way. Plus, if I drive around with any of those cars, people would first comment about the car, then ask me how I was ever able to afford one of those. You really shouldn't spend more than $30.000 if you really want to spend money." "Well, alright, how about a '06 Ford mustang for $40.000?" You shrugged. "I guess that'll work. Thanks."

She immediately started talking into a radio as she walked towards an office. You decided to wait by the door. Within 10 minutes, the most amazing Ford mustang came rolling up to the building, with a nice engine sound to it. It was black with the standard two streaks of white down the middle of the hood, roof and trunk. You felt like an idiot.

You then remembered what year it must be here, considering their 1 to 2 year ratio. By '06 mustang, she meant '13 mustang. And by '06, she really meant 1006. Yep, you really messed up this time.

Another car was following it (Which would've been perfect for the job you needed one for) to apparently bring the driver back to the dealer. You looked at the mustang. This huge lady got out of the car, and dialed her cell phone. She clearly had a "coupl' xtra suitcases in da trunk". It really was a funny sight. It was a wonder her rear actually fit through the door. And a lady, that size, in a car like that? It was like seeing an old lady drop her cane, grab some six barreled monster of a gun and start sprayin' and prayin'. The cat from before ran out, signed some papers, and ran back in. The fatso got into the other car, and drove away. Right before she returned to her office, the cat said "It's all yours."

Jeff went immediately to the driver's side. You didn't care. Once you were on the road, he commented on the cars you could have had. He drove you through the portal, and you hopped into your car, put the hood down, and VRRROOOOOOOM! You and Jeff were cruising down your driveway at 110mph.

Is it really necessary for me to go into what happened in the three days of nothing that followed?
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Sure

choices: The next day (I'm gonna pretend I didn't hear that)
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
Nothing really happened during those three days. Kelly gave a little combat training class, and you got pretty good. He did it military style, but nobody liked the 15 minute non stop pushup sessions and the way he kept calling them "Ladies", and it scared a few people away, but you couldn't afford to quit. You noticed that the reason they were so easy for Kelly to beat was because when they fought, their animal instinct kicks in, and all training, all strategy is lost. They simply fought like animals.

They clearly couldn't be trained. There went the idea of reinforcements.

Now you found yourself in a plane at 3:00 AM 15,000 feet up and about 5 minutes from the enemy base, putting on the armour. It went on in pieces that linked together. You were amazed by it's weight, and the flexibility it gave you. it didn't slow you down in the slightest. Most of today was spent in getting used to it. How to reload your gun, how to do it without looking, how to grab your guns and return them to theory holesters easily. Everything had been tested and was ready to go.

"Testing, testing." You heard Don say into his mask. "Is this thing on?" You answered, "Yes. You guys ready?" All three of them answered in unison, "Yes, SIR!" "Activate night vision." You heard a few clicks and turned yours on too. You never really got to try this, and it was rather surprising how much you could see.

You all heard the pilot say, "As soon as you jump, I'll have to get the heck out of here. However, we have a few transports under a minute away waiting for your call." "Understood."

Everybody jumped and moved into a diving position, just like you had when you jumped from Heather's apartment. Same height, same maneuver, different reason. About 50 feet up you pulled the chute, and you all landed.

You whispered into the mike "Kelly, your building is on the other end of the compound. Let me know when you're there. Try not to kill anyone yet. Use your silenced weapons only. Jeff you got that one, and Don, you're over there." Again in unison, they replied in a whisper, "Yes, SIR."

Your boots were designed to be silent. They were perfectly silent. There were large lights illuminating the main paths, but you could stay out of them if you kept to the wall. Your building was surrounded by a barbed wire fence. You found a spot out of the light, and began cutting.

There was a 15 foot strip of grass between the fence and the building, and you followed that to the corner, but not around it. There they were, two guards. You had to get past them, without making noise. You walked around the other side of the building, and found a window had been left open. You looked in. You saw all the prisoners, but the thing that interested you was the large water bucket by the wall. Ka-chink! You put a hole in it, and a steady stream of water started pouring out.

The guards didn't hear the gun, but they heard the water splashing onto the floor. They both came charging in in a violent rage, screaming "No pissing in the cells!"

The instant they saw the water was the instant you shot them. You took care to shoot them in the neck, so their eyeballs would be preserved. You hopped through the window, attracting the attention of everyone in the room. You picked up one of the guards and opened his eye to the scanner, unlocking all the cells. You said to them "Wait, its not safe. We have roughly 4 minutes until someone notices they're missing. I-"

You almost messed your pants when you heard the words "Kelly is in position." And then "Don has set the package, and is clear of the blast radius." You took a deep breath and said, "Jeff, status?"

"Almost clear of the blast range... You can blow it now if you need to." "Good-"

You were interrupted by panther who said "If you're gonna get us out of here, you gotta get the people in the gas chambers building. They JUST got sent there and the odds are pretty good that they're still alive." "I'll try." you answered.

You spoke into the radio "Don and Jeff, change of plans. I need you two to in the prison room to lead them out, now. I gotta go and see if I can get the people being sent to the gas chambers." "You sure you don't need a hand with that?" A voice that really could've been either Don or Jeff said. "No, I got it. Remember, stealth is everything. You mess up and I won't be able to save them." "SIR yes SIR!"

There were three bats with you, and they seemed the most aware, the most awake. You said to them "Take the crossbows of the guards, and stay in the corners. Anyone except people in armour like mine you shoot." With that, you ran out the door.

When you got to the gas chambers, you peeked around the corner and saw a small crowd being shoved into a room by spears. You waited until the heavy door was shut, set your Uzi on full auto, and sprayed a long streak at about head level. You only missed one guy. He turned around, and said "Wha-" and fell down with 4 holes in his head.

You ran in, and ripped the door open. The room was already full of green gas. Most of the people ran out, but your thermal vision setting revealed two people passed out on the floor. You immediately ran in and grabbed them, and you were very glad they were children and therefore didn't weigh much. You ran out and gave them to the stronger looking anthros. You then spoke into your radio, "Switch to main weapons. Jeff, Status?" You started loading your AK 47.

"Don and Jeff are in position." They replied. You said "Kelly?" "Ready to Roll" you looked out the door, and grabbed the detonater. "Good, cause its showtime." (Click)

You heard a deafening explosion, the kind that one hears when two explosions sound as one, and your ear was ringing. Since you were sure none of them could hear you, you motioned for them to follow, and you ran out the door.

Then you noticed a problem. The building that had the generals quarters and the security equipment (which had "malfunctioned") must have had another bunker underneath, because soldiers were flooding out of the ground like ants. You started shooting like hell. When you had to reload you screamed "GO! GO! GO! GO! GO!" And pointed toward the gate, which Don and Jeff had already handled.

When they started running for the gate you yelled into the mike, "Kelly! Are you done?" "Yes, SI-" "Point your group toward the gate and run to the north west building that got blown up, I need really your help here!" "Yes, SIR!"

You tried to fire in short bursts to conserve your ammo. You ran toward the prison building and started firing from the door using the wall as cover. From this position the soldiers came flying out straight at you, about 20 yards away. Your gun stopped firing, so you threw a grenade and reloaded, and started shooting again. Then you saw Kelly. He was running towards the bunker entrance. Then he stopped in the middle of the road, and grabbed a manhole cover, and started running again until he was right behind the entrance. He threw the manhole on the ground, and stood on it. Then he threw a grenade down the hole, waited for the bang. Then he threw a pack of C4 Down the hole and said "Fire."

You started "But you'll-" "FIRE!" (Click)

Another deafening explosion made the ground jump. The manhole Kelly was standing on protected him from the explosion, but threw him up into the sky. Below him was a sea of fire, so he pulled his parachute. But the hot air caught that and threw him up into the sky even farther, just like a hot air balloon. He didn't seem to care though, he just started shooting the few guys that had survived the explosion.

Soon, he stopped firing. You said into the radio "So, Kelly. How's the view way up there?"

The answer you got wasn't from him, but from Jeff. "Way up where? I don't- HOLY SHIT! Don't tell me you stood practically on top of that C4!?" "Yep, that's what I did. That's a new one. You should try it sometime. Did you call the transports?" "Affirmative. The first just took off, and I have a visual of the second, but that won't hold everybody, so we leave on the third." Then you said "Then mission accomplished, let's get out of here."

A few minutes later, Kelly landed, and you all went out the gate to the second transport. You made sure the children that had passed out in the gas chamber got immediate medical attention, and then waited with the rest of the survivors for the third transport, which wasn't far out.

You couldn't help asking Kelly "So, what the hell made you think that was a good idea? And how come you're still in one piece? A blast like that would-" He interrupted "A blast like that would break every bone in the average man's body. Fortunately we're not average men. I probably would have survived that landing without the parachute too, even without the armour. By the way, the view was great up there. You know, nothing says we can't do the exact same thing to a few more camps as their mostly identical. This could get pretty easy." "I dunno, I've only got four shots left in my AK 47." "Well, buy a couple more clips and you'll be fine."

Just then the transport landed. You heard the voice of the commander, the tiger from before, say "Well done boys, first round 's on me." And then the voice of someone else say "And the second 's on me!"

You looked at Kelly and shrugged. You knew he was thinking the same thing: There was no way you were going to get any sleep tonight.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: No.

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
About 10 minutes later you found yourself in this huge (and I mean HUGE) room with high ceilings about 40 feet above your head, about to walk onto this stage when the president gave you your que. It was about 5 feet off the ground, had some huge speakers, and a decently sided jumbo-tron directly on the wall behind the stage. On the ground directly in front of the stage were a bunch of tables, and chairs, but everybody was sitting on the opposite side so they could face the stage. Here and there young waitresses popped up, bringing food, refills, taking orders...

To the side of the room were four tables, each elevated above the rest by about two feet. Each had on the tablecloth the name of You or one of your men, with many other chairs around the table. You were told that people that wanted to sit in one of those chairs had to pay around $300, but that didn't seem to matter because the tickets had gotten sold and resold, and now were valued at about $700. You were also told that a few people had had those seats from the start. They had been the popular people like the president, ambassadors from other allied countries, the inventor of the armour you wore, a couple of supermodels and movie stars...

A big booming voice blared from the speakers "Ladies and gentlemen, please put your paws, hands, legs and/or flippers together for President CHARLES FARGO!!!"

There was a roar of applause as an almost overweight badger walked out onto the stage with a Mic in his hand and said "Thank you, thank you.. I cannot tell you just what an incredible honor it is to be here today. Here, in the presence of true heroes, who went out against incredible odds to save those people over there." Another loud roar of applause broke out as he pointed to the left where there was a party already going, between families and friends who had been recently reunited. When the applause and cheers died down, he continued.

"They changed their plans to save those being sent to a gas chamber, which ended up with one of them running into the gas to save two dying children who had already passed out. I am proud and relieved to say that these children are here with you tonight, alive and well."

After another round of applause, he continued.

"Why they changed their plans, I do not know, but show better to ask then the heroes themselves!? So ladies and gentlemen, without further adieu, (Name)!"

He started to walk off the stage, and met you on the middle. He gave you a handshake, and passed you the mic. Some music had started playing, and a few fireworks went off, the audience roared yet again. You walked right to the center of the stage, and said,

"What better way to tell a story than from the beginning. I started about 1500 feet up falling straight down. About 50 feet from the ground, I pulled my parachute, and landed. Using a completely silent weapon, I snuck around the compound while the others did the same. Fortunately we were not discovered. I went to the cells where the workers were locked up for the night. I walked around the building until I found a window, and looked in. I saw the guards, but shooting them would mean having someone see them fall. Now if someone heard a scream but didn't see anything, they would just assume it to be from one of the prisoners. So, I had to get them away from the door of the building. That's when I noticed a large bucket of water on the ground. Now my weapon fires a small projectile, almost like a sling shot, but with 10 times the power. So I put a hole in the bucket, and a steady stream started pouring out. Now the guards heard this and thought that someone was peeing in the cells. As there are some younger children here, I won't say what he said, so let's just say I killed them and unlocked the cells. That was when a panther, whom I now know to named john blackpaw, told me of the people being sent to the gas chambers. So upon finding that two of my other men were done with their jobs, I told them to come and lead these people out. I went towards the gas chamber myself. Here again, I cannot describe exactly what happened, but I killed the guards and ripped open the door. Now thanks to Mr. George Ironclaw and David Longtail, my helmet was equipped with a thermal view setting. This revealed two children passed out in the corner. I ran in and grabbed them, as anyone would. Now, Jeff and Don were terrorists in the plan, they went and set bombs in or under the generals quarters and the soldiers' bunkers. I had the detonater. This is when I blew both buildings up. That would've taken care of everything and everyone there I thought. Well, that wasn't what happened. Under the general's quarters there must've been another bunker, because soldiers were flooding up the stairs, bows and blades in hand. Now I will have Kelly tell you what he did about this."

Kelly walked onto the stage. Again, there was another round of applause and a few fireworks and some music, until he got right next to you. You gave him the Mic, and he continued your story. He said,

"Well, my job from the start was to go to the forced labor factory, and when he blew the other buildings, I was supposed to head in and get the workers out of there. I shot anyone with a whip, sword, or bow, and led them out. That's when (Name) called me. So I pointed the group towards the gate, which Don and Jeff had already secured, and ran to the, well, scene if you will. I knew exactly what I was going to do. I stopped in. The middle of the road, and grabbed a manhole cover. I threw that on the ground directly above the underground bunker. I threw a grenade down the hole, and waited for the bang. Now each of us had been equipped with,a pack of C4, that I threw down the hole after the grenade. I stood on the manhole cover, and was shot sky-high by the explosion. The manhole cover protected me from most of the blast, but below me was a literal sea of fire, and a bunch of rocks still in the air. I figured I didn't want to land on that, so I pulled my parachute. The hot air from the fire caught my parachute, and lifted me up higher much like a hot air balloon. I just started shooting whoever survived the explosion. I mean, what else am I going to do, you know? After that, I waited 'till I landed, loaded everyone up on three different transports, and 12 minutes later I find myself here. Thank you."

The crowd gave him another large round of applause as he walked off the stage, and the same big booming voice said, Well, we now have a few bands who are still setting up, they should be ready to go in about ten minutes. Thank you for you patience."
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Party time!

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
After that, each one of you were led to your table(s). You sat down. You noticed that at your table were Dave, Sasha, Luna and Heather, Bess, Butch, Marie, and then five other anthros you'd never seen before, and two empty seats. You were very glad that all guests were required to wear name tags, or you'd probably have a few awkward incidents. I mean, these other people were movie stars, billionaires or multimillionares, maybe a sports star or singer... To anyone who lived in that country, these people would've been recognized by anyone. (What if you had to ask a guy like say, Will Smith, "I'm sorry, who are you?")

You sat down, and the commander, (Whose name you finally found to be Joseph Slash) true to his word, asked you what you wanted to drink. You thought for a second, and chose a fireball whiskey.

As he walked off, everyone at the table introduced themselves. There was a cat, not like Tara or Dave, but a calico. Her name was "Cali" Cottontail. She was a singer. Then there was a turtle named George, who owned some multi-billion-dollar corporation, a deer named bertha, who owned a different one, a fox, named Todd, who apparently worked for George, and a hulking giant of a tiger named Avory. He was a movie star, a weight lifter, and had a bunch of medals around his neck from something or other.

"...and the empty seats are for the others from the farm. Jane, well, you know why she's not here, and Tara. I really have no idea why she's not-"

"Tara?" Interrupted Dave, "Tara Longtail?"

"You know her?" Said Sasha.

"Know her, she's my niece! I thought she was dead!"

You thought for a moment. This could reflect badly on you, the fact that you kept this from him. The only thing you could do now was hope that it doesn't.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Next

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
"Well, she should be here any minute now." Said Bess. Then Avory started a long story about his medals. Apparently he was a seven time smack-down champion, who could rip your arm off without a second thought, if insulted in the wrong way. He gave you a couple storys about it. They all ran pretty much the same way. He got insulted, someone got maimed. Every time.

Then the great big jumbo tron started showing satellite footage of you and your men. There was a lot of sneaking around, now that you thought about it. After your team split up, the screen followed Don. It was a little odd, but you didn't mind. You were just confused because Don really didn't get to do much. That was when you saw it. Don had had a fight. Two bats had seen him. They cut around a corner and stopped right in front of him, crossbows ready. In one swift movement he shoved both crossbows to the outside. Then he just beat them up. Everyone laughed when Don ducked and one hit the other accidentally. Soon they were both out cold, and Don continued his route.

You laughed with everyone else, but then it hit you.

There were witnesses.

And they were still alive.

If they told anyone about that there would be preparations made for another such attack. You couldn't let that happen. You got up from your seat and ran over to Comm. Joseph and told him. He ran straight out the door, and you grabbed your team, and then followed.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: That was a close one...

choices: You make it to the chopper
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
Less than twenty minutes later you again found yourself in the air in the middle of the night about to jump from a chopper. Apparently Don had injured them beyond a whack on the head, because neither of them were flying. Satellites revealed them moving about 15 mph towards the nearest camp. They were already about halfway to their destination. The plan was to intercept them. Plain and simple.

"Pilot," said Don, "ETA?" She answered, "4 minutes closer than the last time you asked me." in a rather annoyed tone. He rolled his eyes and put on his mask. The co-pilot started talking on the radio. After a while he stopped and said "Apparently they've stopped. You need to jump in about 30 seconds. We'll be nearby when you're ready to go." You said to your team, "You know what? I want to handle this one. Doesn't sound that hard. You mind if I handle this?" Jeff answered "Sure. I may have had too much alcohol back there to do this right anyway." Don nodded.

You grabbed your AK-47 and jumped. You landed about 25 yards ahead of them. You turned on your night vision, and approached. You started to hear heavy and fast paced breathing, as if someone were in pain. As you continued you herd some hitting, on what and with what you couldn't tell. Soon however you saw some firelight, and that question was answered. You walked over and pushed a branch out of the way. There they were. One was laying on the ground, the other was starting a fire.

They both saw you and screamed. Then the one by the fire said in a completely panicked frenzy "We surrender! We surrender! Just don't kill us! We surrender!"

Then you noticed that the one laying on the ground was laying in a pool of blood. His arm had been broken and he was bleeding out. He was gonna die if he didn't get help fast. You ran over and yelled into the mike "Get a medic on the radio! I need a medkit now!" Your co-pilot answered "Were on our way down now. However the closest place I can land is in the clearing 100 yards away. However, a package should land near you momentarily."

(Thud) You said "I need you to put some pressure on it. Keep the pressure on. Look at me and stay awake." The other bat brought you a box. A standard medkit. This must've been the package he had referred to. You opened it and started bandageing him up. When you were done, you grabbed him and pointed your glock at the other bat. "We're going to the clearing over there. If you try anything I'll kill you both." He started running at top speed, and you were somehow able to keep up and carry another person at the same time.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: What the hell, Don!

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
Well, all in all it wasn't too difficult. You laid the wounded bat on a bench and handcuffed the other. He had been pretty quiet. The once you got in the air, he asked, "So there's four of you?" "You're not really in the position to ask questions. And if I were you, I wouldn't try." Kelly responded. "Why?" "Because there's a chance we'll let you go, but if we do, we won't want you knowing to much."

The co-pilot came back and helped you property bandage the winded bat's wounds, but other than that the rest of the ride was uneventful.

When you landed, four guards escorted the prisoners away, and someone had brought a few flashy cars to drive you back to the party.

The only thing you said in explaination for your sudden departure on the stage was "Just a little prisoner problem." Back at your table, that wasn't good enough. So after a brief explanation the party continued, and you noticed Tara had arrived. She and Dave were doing some kind of reunion party of their own. You were also told that her parents had been called and were on their way there.

When they got there, the party just got better. After a little reunion time her parents introduced themselves as Chuck and Sarah. After a little explanation they thanked for taking care of Tara while she were there.

The party continued until the sun came up. Then you went home to bed.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: You make it to the chopper

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
The next morning, or rather, afternoon, your training session with Kelly seemed easier. Sure, it had been getting a little bit better everyday, but this time it was through the roof. He had you carry your rifle and run 15 miles, and you found that you didn't have to breath very hard. In fact, you didn't have to catch your breath when you finished. He made you do 15 minutes of push-ups, 15 minutes of sit-ups and 10 minutes of chin-ups. He made the whole team do it, and he did it himself, but when you finished, you didn't want to stop. You had been provided with a weight lifting room, with punching bags and a regular boxing ring. That was where you would spar. You had gotten pretty used to the taste of that mat.

"Okay, Don, you verses me." Kelly said

"Yes SIR!"

Everyone had their lucky shots, their good days, but Jeff seemed to have the most. You seemed to have the least. So, you always watched them as they spared and tried to steal as many leaves from their books as you could.

Don won that round, so he got to challenge someone. He almost always followed these rules.

1. Never fight the same guy in a row.

2. Always pick the most skilled person. (without breaking number 1)

Suffice to say, he never picked you. So you walked over to the chin-up bar. Then you heard your name. You turned around. Don said "I challenge (Name)"

You grabbed a pair of gloves, and hopped over the ropes. You knew you were going to get your ass kicked. But that didn't mean you weren't going to put up a fight!

A little bell went off and the fight began. You focused on dodgeing without losing any ground, and swinging where there was an unguarded area. The problem was, there never was an unguarded area. Then, in the middle of the fight, a certain sensation swept over you, followed by a huge rush of adrenaline, a sudden swing, and a WHAM!

You had hit Don right above his left ear. You actually hit him. How? For the first time, you actually got a hit on- WHAP!

Don recovered quickly, and wasted no time in mashing you on the ground. Then he got up, and you got up.

"I sure didn't see that one coming!" He said with a big grin on his face. "I can't believe I actually hit you." You said. "That was your mistake," He said, "Never be afraid to finish someone off. You're in a war, nobody's gonna blame you. And nobody's gonna be angry with you except the enemy, and they all have 100 other reasons to hate you anyway. Next time, finish it!"

"I know. But that's not what shocked me. Something happened to me. I don't know what but it was, like, time. Slowing down. It was so wierd. I can't expalin it any better than that."

"What else happened?" Asked Jeffx ,"Do you think this may have anything to do with the mutation?"

"I don't know." You replied, "But during the training, everything was, well, too easy. It was like I had lost 50 pounds overnight. I could probably run for a solid hour non stop at full speed."

"Why don't you?" Asked Kelly. "If you can, you should. I'll have to make the training harder."

You nodded, and walked away. You had to waste another 6 hours before you talk to the prisoner, so, what the heck. You went home.

Butch had done some clever thing with mechanics and a few hairs from various different anthros, so you could go back and forth without bothering anybody, at the press of a button.

You grabbed the GPS out of your car, and looked down your driveway. A straight road as far as the eye could see. You wanted to know what had happened with Don, and how to reproduce that, well, whatever that was. You ran down the road.

"Faster, faster, faster, faster..." You kept thinking to yourself. When you thought you'd reached your limit... Something clicked. All of a sudden, that same sensation hit you, followed by an insane rush of adrenaline. Time didn't seem to slow down, YOU seemed to slow down. So you sped right back up. That was when you saw a bird. You watched it as you ran by. It was flying, but only flapping it's wings about once every two seconds. If one thinks about that, one would find that impossible.

This was so wierd that you slowed down, and stopped. Now the bird was flying regularly, flapping its wings about two times a second.

That wasn't the only wierd thing you saw. When you looked back, you couldn't even see your farm. You ran back, and in about two minutes you had made it back. You ran inside, straight up to your room. You opened your laptop, and looked at the gps tracker stats. Recently it had went 20 miles an hour... Then 40 miles an hour, then 20 again. That meant you had actually ran 40 miles an hour. You looked at the numbers in disbelief, when Sasha walked in.

"Just out of curiosity," She said, "What were you doing outside? When I heard the portal, I thought you'd come inside. Not go running down the driveway!" You said nothing, but simply pointed at the numbers and the route you had taken. She looked and said "There's no freaking way that happened." "I'm as confused as you are." You said. "That can't be right, but something tells me it is." "I can't even run that fast." She said. "I bet Marie can." "Yeah," She said, "She could probably tell you."

Two minutes later you found yourself about to ask a horse if it wanted to have a foot race with you. You thought you were insane. You walked into the stable and said "Hey Marie, wanna race?"
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: The next day... (no comment)

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
She blinked. "What?" You repeated, "I said, would you like to race?" "I can't beat your car, or that "Mustang" thing. They really should pick a different name for the thing if you ask me." She said, flatly. "I won't be using a car." You said. "Are you challengeing me to a footrace?"

You nodded.

"I accept! Where's the track?" She said. "Over here." You said, walking toward the driveway. You pointed down the road. "See that tree over there? The really far one? The third one down?" She nodded. "From here to there?" "Yep." Then she asked, "Should I use two legs or four legs?" "Whatever." You answered. "Considering you can only use two, I'll do the same. Ready?"

"Set?" You said,

"GO" You both yelled together.

You took off as hard as you could. Somehow she was still about 2 mph faster than you. You concentrated on that well, whatever it was that doubled your speed, and nothing happened. Nothing happened. You were about a quarter of the way there and you were already gonna lose. Right before you gave up, *click*

You easily passed her up, and continued as if nothing had happened. About halfway there though, you looked back to see how far behind she was.

She was right next to you, going about a half-a-mile-per-hour faster than you. You noticed that she was keeping her arms close to her body. You copied her, (Not very well) and was able to stay neck and neck with her. Then you started thinking. You had seen Kelly run. He moved his arms more, but jolted them forward, effectively lengthening his stride by about 10 percent.

You tried this, and she started to lag behind. You could see her try to push harder, but to no avail. You continued this way for the rest of the race. You finished about a half second ahead of her. You walked over to her.

She said "Well, I'm beat." You shrugged, and she said "I didn't know humans could to that." You said "We're not supposed to, its my mutation." She looked at you funny before saying "You run like a cheetah."

"Um, okay," you said, confused. "Is that a good thing or a bad thing?" "You tell me. But it looks like you're turning into a cheetah. They're the only ones who run like that naturally, and can beat a horse in a race." She said as she started jogging back. (at about 20 miles an hour) You caught up and asked "So, how fast do you think we were going back there?"

"A good 40 miles per hour, easily." She replied. "That's insane." "That's average." "For a human I mean. Half that would be an accomplishment for the fastest of us."

You got back to the farm, and took a nap until it was time to go back to the anthro planet.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: "Sure"

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
You found yourself in a maze like building. How you had gotten there, you didn't know. You were by yourself, as far as you knew. You were walking down a hall with brown doors on either side. Then you noticed your battle armour, and the fact that you had no guns. Just a knife. You pulled it out, and held it upside-down in your fist as Don had taught you. You continued down the hall, until you hit the end. You opened the door- and ran right through a set of laser beams! An alarm went off, and the door slammed behind you. You ran back and found it locked, then looked into the room.

There was a wall of soldiers, mostly large cats, armed with claws and teeth.

They charged at you. You ran at them and fought back. You started pulling moves you didn't even know you knew, but there were simply too many of them. You ducked a swing, kicked something in the balls, jumped back up, swung your hips around and kicked something else, but then something caught your foot. He twisted you around, slamming you on your face. Then you were picked up, and handcuffed. They walked you out of the room. Then you noticed the alarm still blareing. Come to think of it, that alarm sounded a lot like your alarm clock... Wait a minute. You pinched yourself, and-

You woke up.

Dazed, you went downstairs, grabbed some food, you went out and turned the portal on. You looked into the barn, and saw two cows and two sheep. One cow was milking the other, and one sheep was shearing the other. "Hey hun, what's up?" Said one of the cows, which you assumed was Bess. "Hey," you replied, "Who are they?" She replied "Oh, they've been coming every other day to handle and maintain the place, you seemed to busy." "I'm sorry about that, I-" "Dont be sorry," she interrupted, "You went off to war. You're saving lives, instead of a few things around here. What you're doing is much more important." "Well, okay, again I gotta go." "Bye bye."

With that, you stepped through the portal, and closed it. Your mustang was waiting, and you drove to the military base. It was pretty neat, now everyone knew your face. There were people pointing, starring, yelling to their friends "Look! There's "(Name)!".

You got to the base, and were led down the hall by a hippo. He told you the prisoner who had not been wounded was named Kyle Ventor, he had been a guard, and was on patrol when he saw Don. He wouldn't say any more, and was demanding to see one of your team. Preferably the leader.

So you got your armour on, and put on your mask, so as to prevent his knowing of your species. You were led into a room, and the door was locked behind you. There was a camera in the top right corner of the room, and a huge mirror on the wall to your left, and a table with two chairs in the middle of the room. You sat down, and waited.

A few minutes later, an octopus was man-handeling Kyle into the room. Literally. It sat him down in the other chair, as through your mask, you gave it a "What the heck are you doing?" Look. Then it left.

You said "You must hate that." "I do. He's manipulating me like I'm some sort of puppet." "Well, he's married, he knows what it's like."

He scoffed and said "So you finally agreed to see me. What took you so long?" "It shouldn't have been too long," You said, looking at the clock, "Did you stay up all day?" "Yes. I was beginning to think you were nocturnal." "You must understand," You said, "I will only speak to you at 9 AM and PM. I don't want you to have any hint as to what I am. Had you simply slept through the day this might have been a lot easier for you."

He didn't say anything, so you said "So, why did you want to see me?" "I wanted to know how we were beaten so easily." He said. You replied, "You're not going to fool me that easily. Tell the truth." He said nothing. Then you said "Okay, then I will. You wanted information in case you were released, or somehow escaped." He again said nothing. So you said "So here's how this works. There are two possible things I could want. 1. I could want you to be ignorant of how we did anything that happened back at your base, and therefore have nothing to say about upgrades and reinforcements to prevent this happening again. 2. I could want you to know it all, and then go back to your authoritys and panic the entire nation. I am not going to tell you which, and you are going to tell me everything you know. If you leave something out, I'll know. And then your chances of release will drop 90%. Do you understand?"

He nodded. You said "Good. What do you know?"
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: interrogation

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
"I'll start from the beginning. I have no idea how you arrived. You couldn't have entered by one of the supply trucks, they're all checked before and after departure. Septic systems are armed with motion sensors and thermal sensors, so you couldn't have gotten in that way. We always have people watching the sky, so you couldn't have done that either. My best guess would be that you hacked into the septic system."

"Okay... How did you see my partner?"

"Bat eyes and luck. Lots of luck. He, or she, made absolutely no noise. I whispered it to my partner and attempted to stop him."

"Why didn't you radio for help?"

"He would've heard me. I thought he was an escaped worker. And we had bows, workers never score a bow and if he somehow had, there were two of us."

"So you came around the corner right in front of my partner."

"Yes, and he beat us up. It was so wierd. He beat us like... like... I just can't explain it. It was like we simply couldn't hit him, but he could hit us. And the bows didn't even make him blink, he just saw them, and shoved them to either side and bam!"

"Okay, what do you remember after that?"

"Well, when my friend woke up, he woke me up. All I saw was destruction. By the way, how did that happen?"

"Please save your questions for the end."

"Okay... He showed me his wing, and I knew that if he didn't get help soon, he wasn't gonna make it. So I grabbed him and ran. I ran toward the nearest camp. The supply building was all but gone. Eventually though, his wounds proved to be to severe, and I had to stop to try to stop the bleeding. I couldn't see very well, so I had to make a fire... And that's where one of your guys showed up. Thank him for me, if he hadn't have done what he did my friend would've surely died. How is he by the way?"

"He's been given proper medical attention, blood, and a decent bed. He slept through the day, and is doing pretty well. He can walk, and I wouldn't be surprised if he was flying by the end of the month."

"Oh, thank you, that's such a relief. When can I see him?"

"After I see him first and confirm everything you've told me."
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: He tells the truth.

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
You found yourself in a hallway. You looked up, down around... It kind of reminded you of somewhere... You weren't sure where. There were doors on either side, but you decided to continue until the end of the hall. There, you found a door. When you went through it, you went straight through a set of laser beams, setting off an alarm. You looked back, but the door had locked itself, so you looked forward. A huge, endless wall of soldiers, anthro soldiers, were running at you, waving claws and grinding teeth. Then-

"WAKE UP! WAKE UP!"

You looked up, right into the face of Tara. "Tara? What th-" You started.

"They're under attack! They need you now!" She screamed, in complete panic. "Sasha is starting the portal with Tali. Go!"

You threw your sheets to the side, and jumped out the window. It was pitch black outside. You got into your car, fired it up, squealed your tires and turned right through the portal. You drove like a madman. Your armour was at the military base. You parked at the side of the building, broke through the window, threw open the cabinets and put on your suit. You grabbed your guns, all the ammo, grenades, a pack of C4... Everything you could think of. You then ran out the broken window and found that someone had parked an army jeep for you to use and moved your car out of the way. You jumped in the jeep and again were driving like a madman. What was really odd was the fact that you were the only one with a working vehicle. Everybody else's were parked in the strangest places including the middle of the road. And for some reason, the lights on your truck didn't work. You also had no idea where the attack was so you went the against the flow of foot traffic. You figured the civilians would run from the fight. And you were right. You said into your mask "Kelly, do you read me?"

The reply was mostly static, but you could tell that he was trying to answer but that you were out of range, or there was a jammer running.

A few minutes later you saw the battle. It was in a countryside on the edge of the city. You listened. You heard war cries, but no gunshots. Where the hell where your men? You drove straight for the advancing wall of soldiers. Then, this massive arrow flew and smashed the engine of your truck, stopping it completely. You however, didn't stop. You flew. Headfirst. Into the concrete. You were glad you had the armour. You jumped up, ripped out your knife, and started some hand to hand combat. It really wasn't that hard at first, these people couldn't fight worth a damn. But, there were too many of them. 1 vs 1 was easy. 2 vs 1 was easy. 6 vs 1? That was pushing it. Your free hand grabbed your Uzi, and you started sprayin'. Pretty soon you just had pretty much demolished this little group. You turned around, and saw a tank. Tanks on this world certainly wouldn't be bullet proof, but they were pretty well armoured and they all had a huge bow on The top. Then something hit you from the side, and you fell. You kept to your feet, knife and Uzi in hand, ready for anything. It was a brown horse... MARIE!?!? Then you noticed the huge arrow that barely missed you because of her. Oh yeah, tank. Right. You grabbed your AK - 47 and fired. Arrow proof glass is not bullet proof. You killed the drivers and the operators. Then you heard other gunshots. There was an overturned car nearby that could serve as a good shield. You ran over behind it and tried the radio again.

"Kelly, do you read me? I repeat, Kelly do you read me?" "Loud and clear commander." "Where are you?" "Listen to the gunshots." "Okay, I have Marie with me... And-" "What the hell is Marie doing here?" "I don't know. What does it look like up there?" "Plenty of enemies, but we can handle 'em. There's some heading around toward you though that we can't. You think you can handle them?" "I'll try. (Name) out."

You peeked over the top of the car and saw another set of enemies, like the ones you just leveled. Two tanks this time though. You handed Marie your Uzi and said "Its not safe to run back to the city now. This is an Uzi mag 9. Look flabby the top like you would an arrow, and pull the trigger. It should have enough ammo to last through these guys. They don't know were here, so we can get right up close to them. If we let them know we're here, the tanks will ruin our cover. Just wait for my signal, then jump up and start shooting. Okay?" She looked at the Uzi and said "Okay, I guess."

You listened. You heard the soft, rhythmic sound of their footsteps, and got an idea. You took the suppresser off of the Uzi and put it into one of your glocks. You were lucky that both guns were 9mm. You shot directly through the car, and out of sheer luck, hit a soldier between the eyes. He fell without a cry. You looked through the bullet hole and shot three more. That was when they figured out they were under attack. You grabbed your AK-47 and said to Marie "NOW!". Then you ran out from behind the car, spraying. Marie was a little slower, but she managed to get away before the tank blew the car away. She then started shooting anything and everything that moved. You took care to shoot the archers and the tanks first. Soon, you and Marie were the only ones standing. Marie gave you your Uzi, and then ran back to the city.

You looked around with your night and thermal vision, and finding no survivors, started running towards the gunfire. You reloaded your guns, and your mask highlighted your men. You saw that they were fighting hand to hand. You asked "Are you guys out of ammo or something?" "Yep." "Okay, I've got some... Anything you need me to hit?" Don replied "How about this tank that keeps following me around?" Your mask colored the tank red. "And then maybe the guys in that jeep... Save the jeep if you can though, we don't have any vehicles." Your mask colored the jeep green and the men inside it orange. You shot out the windshield of the tank, and threw a grenade into it. You heard the bang, and the tank stopped moving. You then aimed carefully, and shot the men out of the jeep. You then ran to the jeep, kicked the corpses put of it, and started driving. You used your Uzi with your left hand, and shot a rain of fire at the other tank.

Change to Jeff's POV.

You were amazing yourself at your skills. You were faster than them. Put simply. They couldn't hit you. You ducked a swing with a sword, stabbed something with your knife, jumped to the left and barely missed an arrow, jumped a spear, swung your foot kicking something away, slashing something else, punching something square in the nose... Then suddenly... *Click* Everyone slowed down. It was so wierd. You were fighting 5 at once, but everyone was moving at half speed. You stabbed something, and went to stab something else, but punched him instead. You looked down at your knife, and found it had broken. Damn. You kinda liked it. You dropped the handle, turned around and slammed your hands into a clap, stopping a sword from hitting your helmet. You yanked on it, and swung your foot around and kicked it's bearer in the face, causing him to lose his weapon. Then you swung it so hard it cut three soldiers in half. That was when the last 3 got so scared they ran away... Straight into your allies. What the hell took them so long? They quickly surrendered, and were handcuffed.

You heard (Name) say "Hey guys, I saved the truck, hop in." And saw him drive over to pick Kelly and Don up. then he drive to you. He contacted the commander, and drove back to the military base.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Skip to the next morning.

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
Back to (Name)'s POV........................................

You pulled the jeep up to the commander and said, "What the hell took so long?"
"It takes a while to mobilize an entire army. That's excluding the fact that they hit the entire city with an EMP."
Kelly interrupted, "It doesn't matter, we handled it easily. But there's something that bothers me. Why would they attack?"
"Same reason we attacked them I guess." The commander answered.
"But that's suicide! Considering what we can do to them-"
"But they don't know HOW. For all they know, it just might have been a couple of bad accidents."
"Then why would they attack us?"
"Suspicions. Nobody survived and two soldiers were missing from the wreckage. Only one place they could have went."
"Or they knew..."
"Impossible."
"They just thought we had a spy or something, and were sneaky."
"And if that was the case, they would have taken half the city before I could mobilize the troops."
"So then the question is; how did they know?"

Everyone thought for a moment.

"There's only one explanation... We have a spy on our hands."
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Next

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
You all get back to base and start narrowing the suspects down to about 3 people. Aaron Thompson, Mark Hofmann, and Glenn lindenBurke. It took awhile but you finally narrowed it down to them.

"Well we should bring these guys in for questioning asap, ok guys." Said Kelly, you all agreed with him and sent some soldiers to go get them. Then suddenly you hear a pop and then a loud ringing sound which hurts your ear drums more then anything. You drop to the ground and start to scream in pain. While all of this is happening Kelly is yelling,

"GET A MEDIC NOW!!!"

By the time the medic arrived you had passed out due to the shear pain. Hours later you woke up on a bed with Sasha and Tara sitting across the room.

"Ah my head, what happened?" You ask still dazed by the current events in which to you had just happened, but in the reality of it all they happened hours ago, you just did know.

"(Your name) You need to take it easy ok." Says Sasha

"Yeah you have been through a lot" Tara says.

"What happened?" You ask them

"I think you should see for yourself." Sasha says as she hands you a small handmere. You look at it and see your image but something looks wrong. Your ears had shifted to the top of your head and they now looked like Sasha's. You stared in amazement then you reach for one of your ears. It feels soft just like a huskies ear.

"Wow..." You say absent minded.

"All that pain just to change my ears... Man its going to suck when a bigger change happens." You say

"Well if it helps we will all be their for you." Says Kelly, he surprised you and it made you jump.

"Dam it Kelly you scared me have to death."

"Haha sorry but I need to get in on the conversation some how and you gave me a perfect entry point." He says with a big smile on his face.

"So what are you going to do man, because if anybody on earth see's you like this then your going to be screwed." Kelly says, and he was right. If anyone seen you, then you would be screwed.

"I don't know, I may have to live on their planet now."

"Or you could just wear a hat, I mean it shouldn't be that noticeable." Kelly's suggestion wasn't that bad.

"You know that's not that bad an idea, thanks Kelly." You say.

"Wait dude I was joking." Kelly says.

"I know but if you think about its not that bad of an idea. On earth I will wear a hat for safety and on their planet I don't have to." It was an ok plan but it won't help if something else on you changes.

"Its not a permanent solution but I guess it works." Kelly says. He then looks at Sasha then you and then back to Sasha then back to you.

"Why do you keep looking at Sasha then me?" You ask him.

"Well it looks like your going to turn into a husky like Sasha, because if you compare your ears with hers they look just like each other." Then you and Sasha look at each other. You look at Sasha's ears and then take the mere again and look at yourself.

"You know I think your right it will be pretty cool if I do turn into a husky like Sasha because then-" That's all you can get out because your then hugged tightly by Sasha.

"Oh (your name) I hope you let yourself change fully, because then we can be closer to each other." She say sounding very passionate.

"What do you mean Sasha?" You ask dumbly

"Dude are you that thick headed. She's in love with you." Yells Tara.

"What!? Sasha is that true?" You ask

Sasha just looks at you indecently and says

"Yes."
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Back at the base...

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content: Your Name is supposed to be changing into a anthro cheetah not a anthro husky. And his name is now Rex.
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Hug her

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content: Are you actually going to become an anthro cheetah or do you become an anthro husky? Or do you become something else?
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Continue.

1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.content:
Congrats you chose Husky, we all know you were going for the long run for this and for Sasha. Now *cough* continue with the story.


(This was confirmation for the Husky choice)
1441112112112121222211111212111112211222.title: Anthro Husky

choices: Give Sasha a piece of your mind!
144111211212.content:
You expected Bella to freak out or faint, but instead she lets out a long sigh. "We need to talk." she says.


Later in your room, you and Bella sit on your bed as she starts talking. "So Sasha's actually some king of human-animal hybrid?" she asks.


"Yeah..." you say rather quietly.


"I'm guessing that all the other animals here are like that too. Tara, Marie, all of them." she concludes.


"Uh-huh." you say.


"Why didn't you tell me this before instead of keeping secrets from me?" she asks.


"I thought that you'd think I was crazy, and you wouldn't want to see me." you say.


"I might have been a little weirded out, but I would've come regardless!" she says. After she calms down, she continues. "[Your name], I think we should start seeing other people."


"What?" you say in disbelief.
