"I can't be with you if you can't be honest with me." she says, then she starts to pack her things.


"Bella this is ridiculous!" you say. "We've been together for two years, and I've never lied to you about anything. You can't just want to break up with me because I lied one time. It's not that big of a deal!"


"I think living on a farm with a bunch of walking, talking animals IS a big deal [your name]!" says Bella, who had finally gotten all her bags. "Take me to the airport."


You stay quiet for a moment. "Fine." you say.


You drop Bella off at the airport the airport, and on the way back home, you go deep in thought. Did Bella really have the right to be mad at you? You may have kept a secret from her, but it was in her best interest. Did she even consider how you felt? Maybe if she did... hold on a second. You're forgetting one important thing: It was Sasha that revealed the secret, not you. If she wasn't so possessive and jealous, this never would've happened, and you would never have to tell Bella about the fact that all the animals in the farms are anthros. Before you knew it, you reached home. What do you do?
144111211212.title: "We Need To Talk".... This Can't Be Good

choices: "As a matter of fact, I am."
1441112112121.content:
Who are you kidding? You have every right to be mad with Sasha, and now that Bella's gone you don't have anything holding you back. You open the door and head straight up t Sasha's room. You open the door without bothering to knock first. Sasha was laying down on her bed, but she was awake. She looks up at you and looks back down. "Back already?" she says.


"I hope you're happy with yourself!" you say.


"What?" she says, as if she didn't know what you were talking about.


"You know damn well what!" you answer back.


"What's with the attitude?" she asks.


"I should be asking you that question!" you say. "Because of you these past two days have been a disaster. You attack Bella, you growl at her whenever she talks to me, and you reveal your anthro form in front of her! What is your problem!?"


"My problem is that you invite your girlfriend over without even telling me first, then you get all romantic with her in front of me!" she says, finally addressing the situation.

"...w-what?" you asked, looking at the black furred feline with no small amount of fear in your voice.

"you heard me, I want to know why you've been avoiding Sasha all day? she and I have noticed, and now Sasha thinks that something she did has upset you, so she's basically feeling bad right now." Tara half explained, half accused as you sat there on your bed, a guilty look on your face.

"well....I was in the attic today....and I found this..." you replied, slowly taking the letter from your pocket, having taken it from the attic earlier to avoid the risk of Sasha going back up there and finding it.

Tara looked at you suspiciously, before taking the note firmly and reading it with one hand, piercing yellow eyes scanning the page quickly, before looking at you in a half surprised, half annoyed way, making you instinctively fear that she might attack you there and then, she didn't however, slowly handing you the note back. "okay...that's a pretty good warning Derrick left you...and here's another one." she said, stepping towards you, keeping her usual scowl on her face. "if you hurt her....you'll be sorry..." she said, clearly giving you good advice with the threat.

you nodded quickly, scared out of your mind of the girl as she stood up, leaving the room, tail clipping your face as she went.

you sighed when she'd left, considering yourself to be officially screwed now, you decided to get to bed, fatigue taking you as you lay on your bed, not even taking off your jeans as your eyes closed, mind drifting off into the confines of sleep.

as you dreamed however, something was amiss. All you could dream about was Sasha, some dreams good, others bad, however, one constant remained within them all, in every dream, you couldn't get away from her, in some, you didn't even want to.

finally, you found yourself in a forest, it was dark, and there was an almost permanent fog about the place as you looked around. in your hand was a flashlight, you quickly switched it on, the feeble beam barely illuminating the black woods you were in. then it came, a blood curdling howl, it sounded like something from a horror movie, sending chills down your spine and making you, turn towards the source, your flashlight illuminating a dark shape sitting on a nearby rock. whatever it was it was huge, and very muscular, looking to be about twice your height, and it was looking straight at you.

you stumbled back, tripping on a tree root and falling flat on your back, you stared, petrified at the creature, before hearing something odd, laughter, the monster was laughing at you.

then, you felt your eyes adjust to the darkness, and slowly, you began to make out what the shape was, mouth opening in a gape as you realized just ''who" the beast was.

sitting on the rock, muscular legs crossed in a seductive manner, you almost didn't recognise her, but her black and white fur patterns gave her away instantly, however, you were justified saying you didn't recognise her. She had grown at least 4 feet in height, and her body was in essences ripped, arms and legs bulged with muscle as her breasts had grown dramatically, now each being twice as big as your head, while beneath them sat a hard six-pack and even her neck and shoulders seemed bigger, however, through all that, her face, remained as beautiful as it had been when you'd first met he-hold on...beautiful? when did you start considering her that? you thought, shaking your head to clear it, just seconds later hearing footsteps. you looked up to see Sasha sauntering over to you, a strange smile on her canine face as she got closer, and then, she leapt into the air, coming down on you with another howl and-

CRASH!

"OW!!" you yelled, having rolled out of bed, hitting your head on the dresser next to it on your way to the ground.

"sonofa-" you muttered under your breath, touching a small cut above your left eyebrow, some blood on your fingers, wiping it on your shirt you got up, dusting yourself off and going to the bathroom connected to your own room, finding some bandages in the medicine cabinet, you slowly put one on your cut, washing the blood that had dripped from it off your face, drying yourself off before going back to your bed.

You were about to go back to bed, when you heard a very familiar howl, looking to the window, you slowly went to it, looking outside you saw Sasha running off out of the farm, towards the forest, disappearing from view just as the clouds moved out away from the moon, which you now saw was full.

Another howl sent the same chill down your spine, prompting you to just get back into bed, going to sleep, mind swirling with thoughts.

the next morning you got up, going down and seeing that...
1441121.title: "I want to know why you're avoiding Sas...

14411212.content:
"...Tara?" you asked, confused as to why she was sat there, usually she was asleep at this point in the day.

"...yea..." she said, looking like she was trying to keep herself from crying.

"what's going on? where's Sasha?" you asked, both worried and confused.

Tara gestured to the seat opposite her at the table, beckoning for you to sit. you complied, sitting down and looking at her.

"...alright...I think its about time I explained a few things that your uncle didn't..." she said, looking at you with a solemn face. her amber eyes showing how much she didn't want to say what she was about to.

you just nodded.

"...alright....firstly...Sasha has a certain...darkness..." she said, looking at you.

" Darkness...?" you repeated, even more confused now.

Tara nodded, looking at you sternly, before she looked away.

" I don't know if you had the dream or not...but you should know that Sasha is probably the worst...especially if she takes a liking to someone..." she said, looking at you when she said the last part.

'the dream', that made you shiver as you thought back to your dream last night.

Tara saw this, sighing. "I guess that means you did have the dream then...so you know what Sasha is...."

you looked at her, astounded and also quite a bit scared. "...you mean that she's..."

" A werewolf...or WereHusky to be precise..." said Tara, looking at you with pity, as though she already knew your fate.

"....oh hell..." you said to yourself more than her. "....is she...well....attracted to me?" you asked her, almost sounding hopeful, but keeping yourself sounding grave, kicking yourself mentally for having that same attraction to her.

Tara looked at me seriously, her answer was clear before she'd even said it.

" to put it in laments terms...the second you stood up to Vicky you were her idol..." she replied, looking at you with a hint of admiration herself.

you blanched. "...greeeaaat....so...what other do I need to watch out for...?" you asked, wanting to get the image of Sasha's werewolf form out of your mind before your body betrayed your real feelings.

"well...Vicky loves to mess with Sasha, so make sure your with Sasha a lot so she doesn't get herself hurt...also...Vicky is known to try and forcibly have her fun with the other girls, so do your best to check on them all, regularly. and lastly...don't ever try to follow Sasha into the woods on the night of a full moon..." she said, looking at you sternly as she emphasised the last part.

"uh...ok..." you said, swallowing hard as she stared hard at you with her amber eyes.

"good...and be careful none of the girls are causing trouble" she said, getting up from the table to go back to the living room.

"hold on..." you say, catching her attention as she looked back at you.

"yes?" she asked, looking at you.

"....where is Sasha now?" you ask her, the concern in your voice present.

"...she's out...she need to have some time alone...so leave her be..." said Tara, walking back into the living room, laying down and curling up on the rug in front of the fireplace.

You looked at her, before sighing, getting up and making breakfast, you ate then looked to a list posted on the fridge.

Dear Kevin.

I'm sorry I had to run out so unexpectedly, I'll be back by Friday, I've posted a list of jobs to be done on the farm while I'm gone under this note, I'll see you on Friday.

love from Sasha.

the job's were;

shear Jane.

Re-stock hay.

pick fruit for Luna from the orchard.

feed the chickens.

144112122.title: Mixing Things Up

choices: She doesn't want to talk about it
14412.content:
Just to warn you, Tara has had a hard life, so she has a hard time getting along or opening up to anyone. Also she has some anger problems, so it would probably be in your best interest to not piss her off in any way. Perfect, you think to yourself, I already did that last night by stepping on her tail. If Sasha hadn’t been there, she would probably have torn you to shreds.



I had hoped to get her to be nicer with the other girls, but I just never could. Maybe you can succeed where I failed, but it might be better for you to just leave her to herself. I hope you enjoy your time here as much as I did. The last few years I spent here were the best of my life. If you take care of the girls, they’ll take care of you.


Sincerely,

Uncle Derrick



Well, Derrick didn’t need to tell you Tara has anger issues. You could have figured that out for yourself. Yet, you couldn’t help but feel a little sorry for her. Your uncle’s letter said she has had a tough life, perhaps that’s why she alienates everyone, and tries to push them away.



As you head back downstairs, you see Tara laying belly-up in a nice sunny spot on the floor. Her chest and stomach slowly rise and fall with each breath, as she purrs lightly in her sleep. You could see the outline of a smile on her face. She must be having a really good dream.



You couldn’t help but smile as you watched Tara. She’s normally grouchy and scowling, but now she looked so peaceful and content. Step by step, you get closer to Tara, wanting to get a closer look at her. When you are directly beside her, you get down on your knees and lean in close to her.



You don’t know why you’re doing this. Getting this close to Tara, awake or asleep, was just asking for a serious, possibly permanent, injury. But there was something about her like this, something alluring about her in such a calm state, that just made you want to get closer.



Before you can stop yourself, you place your hand on Tara’s trim stomach and gently stroke it. Her purring audibly increases in volume, so you continue petting her belly for a good five minutes, the deep, rumbling sound having an almost hypnotizing effect as Tara’s long, flexible tail lazily swishes from side to side.



But the moment of peace is broken as Tara suddenly opens her eyes and gives off a yowl of surprise as she kicks you square in the chest, sending you sprawling backwards. She leaps to her feet and glares down at you with fire in her eyes. “Don’t you ever touch me again!” She says “The last person who touched me ended up in a body cast!”



You get back up clutching your chest. You really hope that doesn’t leave a mark. It felt like you had just been hit with a cannonball. It could be worse, she could have used her claws. “I’m sorry.” You say “You just looked so peaceful sleeping, I just thought you might enjoy a nice belly-rub”



Tara crosses her arms and scowls. “Why the hell would you think that? You never heard the saying “let sleeping cats lay?” You were about to correct her, but thought better of it. “My uncle left me a note about you.” You say “Told how you had a tough life and all. If you want to talk or anything, I’m here.”


Tara’s eyes widened in surprise. No one had ever said that to her before, but she quickly regains her usual demeanor. “I don’t need anyone to talk to. What I need is to be left alone.” You really want to help her, but she’s too stubborn to listen. Then you get an idea.



“I can tell you have a lot of anger locked up inside.” You say “You need to get it out or it will just eat away at you. I know a good method to release it, but you have to trust me.” Tara snorts. “And what is this method?” She asks sarcastically.


Later…..



“Wretches up ahead!”



“I see ‘em! Ready your chainsaw!”



“Incoming Berserker!”



Turns out your method worked very well. You and Tara had just spent the last three hours releasing her anger with the help of your Xbox 360. Turns out Tara was very good at video games. After kicking your ass in Mortal Kombat and Halo, you had decided to play co-op on Gears of War.



“So are you feeling better?” You ask as you score a headshot on Lambent Locust. “Oh yeah!” Says Tara excitedly “I haven’t had this much fun in years! Eat chainsaw, Rick!” You had told her to pretend the enemies in the game were people she hated. You had no idea who she was talking about, but it was nice to see her so happy.



But what surprised you was when she disemboweled a Grunt and said “Take that Sasha!” You paused the game and stared at her, shocked. “Why do you hate Sasha?”

“Why should I?”



“Well, if you prefer, I could just hang out in this tree all night, watching you in your sleep…..”



“Fine, come in.” Vicky climbs in the window as you stand there with your arms crossed. “Give me one good reason why I shouldn’t just go get Sasha right now.” You say. “Because if you do, you won’t hear my proposal. A proposal that would benefit both of us.” Vicky grins from ear to ear upon saying that last part.



“What are you talking about?” You say suspiciously. Even though you had just met her today, you knew better than to trust Vicky just from what Sasha told you. “You see,” Said Vicky. “I live in the forest on the edge of the farm. Being a wild animal, I must find food for myself. After a while, one gets tired of eating squirrels and robins and whatever else I manage to find. There are some days where I don’t eat at all.”



“What’s your point?” You say, not seeing where this was going. Vicky begins coming closer to you, a seductive grin on her face. “My offer is very simple. If you bring a me a little something to eat every day, then each time you visit, I’ll let you have some of this.”



Suddenly, she grabs your head, and forces your face into her ample breasts. For a split second, you couldn’t help but enjoy the warm fuzziness of her fur and the softness of her breasts. But you quickly pull yourself away from her chest, looking quite flustered.



You looked Vicky in the eyes and for a moment, you were about to yell at her, but then you had a better idea. “Tell you what.” You say. “I’ll bring you some food everyday, but in exchange, you stop stealing from us, and leave Sasha and the others alone.” Vicky stared at you, perplexed.



“That’s twice today you’ve rejected me.” She says. “I don’t get it. I mean, how can you resist this?” She strikes a sexy pose, and you simply stand there unfazed, which only frustrates and confuses Vicky more. “Are you gay?” She asks.




“No.” You say plainly. “I just don’t do interspecies. Now, will you take the deal or not?” For a minute or two, Vicky seemed to consider the offer. On one hand, she wouldn’t have to worry about going hungry, but then she would have to find some other way to entertain herself, as pranking Sasha and the girls was her favorite pastime. Finally, she decided to agree to it. You both shook hands, and Vicky gave you directions to her den before slipping out the window, and disappearing into the night.



“Damn it, what were those directions again?” The next day you were leaning against a tree in the forest, a bag full of food in your hand, as you tried to remember Vicky’s directions. “Was it take a left, or a right at the broken tree?” You remember she said something about following a stream, but you didn’t see one anywhere.



You can’t for the life of you remember if you were supposed to go left or right, so you do eniee-meaniee-mineie-moe, and end up going…..
144131.title: A Not-So Mutual Agreement

1441311.content:
You just decide to go left on a whim. Fortunately you find the stream that Vicky mentioned. After about two more minutes, you find Vicky's den. You walk inside, fearing for your life a little.

"I've been waiting for you." you hear Vicky says. You jump in surprise and turn around. "Relax," she says. "Don't be so apprehensive. I don't bite." Then she moves in closer and says "Unless you want me to." You pull back from her in an instant. "Well, you're no fun." she says with a snicker.

"Whatever. Here's your food." you say tossing the bag of food to her. "So how long will this last you?" you ask.

"For this much? I might leave you alone for three... maybe four days." she says. "I'll make it a week if you-"

"Whatever it is, no." you say before leaving.

"Okay, how about a little make out session?"

"No."

"A few ear scratches and tummy rubs?"

"No!"

"A quick peck on the lips?"

"NO, DAMMIT!"

"Please? Just 2 seconds. That's all I ask."

You were surprised at yourself for not leaving. Should you kiss her, or just leave?
1441311.title: Tryin' to Move in on Ya!

14413111.content:
Even though you knew better than to trust Vicky, you decided that if it will get her to stop bugging you, you might as well just give her a kiss and be done with it. Besides, if you don’t kiss her, she’ll likely go back to harassing Sasha and the others.




With a sigh of frustration, you turn around and walk towards Vicky, who closes her eyes and awaits her kiss. Before you get the kiss over with, you grabs Vicky’s wrists and hold her hands behind her back, to make sure she didn’t try to hold you in place once you kissed her.




Finally, you lean your head forward and quickly press your lips against hers, holding it for about two seconds before backing away. Vicky opens her eyes and smirks. “Aww, I was hoping when you grabbed my hands that you were going to take it further.”




“Keep dreaming. Are you happy now?”




“There’s just one more tiny thing.”




“What?”




“I get sore from sleeping on the hard ground every night, and I was hoping…”




“That I would bring you something softer to sleep on?




“No, though that would be nice. I was hoping that you would give me a quick massage. Just five minuets, that’s all.”




You grunt in frustration, but agree to give her a massage anyway. Vicky lays down on her front, and you begin massaging her shoulders and neck. “Oh yeah, that’s it right there.” She sighs in relief as you continue, resisting the urge to just strangle her right here and be rid of her. But you’re not a killer, even if she is a total pain in your, and everyone else’s ass.




You work your way down her back to her legs. You silently admit to yourself that even though she was a bitch, Vicky had a very attractive body. Even though you wouldn’t even consider her in any romantic way whatsoever, you couldn’t help but enjoy getting to feel such a goddess of beauty. (But you would never say that to her.)




As you finished rubbing her feet, Vicky rolls over onto her back. “Now I think my puppies could do with some attention.” She says, indicating her breasts. You were about protest, despite the temptation, when from the shadows at the back of the den, steps another anthro fox. This one however, was much younger than Vicky, she had to be about five or six. Other than that, she looked exactly like her. She stares at you with a bright curiosity, her head tilted to one side, a battered old teddy bear clutched in her hand.




“Who is she?” She ask, pointing to the little fox. Vicky looks over to where you were pointing and says “That’s Tali…”
14413111.title: Kiss her.

choices: Sasha come's into your room screaming bloody murder.
144131111.content:
"Wait you have a daughter?" you ask shocked by her answer. "Yeah sad really she's never left this cave ever since she was born." Vicky replied sadly she then turned her attention to Tali who looked upset. "Whats wrong sweetie was it the nightmare's again?" The small fox nodded quickly before running and tackling Vicky in a hug and started to cry softly in Vicky's chest fur. You watched shocked as she start's to comfort the crying Tali gently stroking her back in a calming manner. you suddenly realise why Vicky wanted the food so badly it was all to feed Tali and herself that when you got an idea you approach Vicky careful not to disturb Tali. "Vicky how about you two come and stay at the farm me." You suggest Vicky just stared at you for a minute before saying. "what Sasha and everyone we don't exactly get on well." You thought for moment. "Let me worry about Sasha as for everyone else i don't think they'd mind." You reply.

Vicky looked down at the now sleeping Tali in her lap before she nodded and got up gently placing her daughter's head on her shoulder. You gave her a bright smile before leading the way out of the cave and back to the house. You show her to a room where there was a double bed. "Sorry none of the room's have two bed's and it's too late to be moving furniture around." You say as you pull the cover's back for to place Tali down and she lay down next to her. "It's ok normally sleep together." She before she closed her eyes and fell asleep quietly you leave the room and shut the door then went back to your room and back to sleep.

next morning
144131111.title: "My daughter."

choices: She already knew Vicky had a sister.
144131112.content:
"She's my sister," Vicky says. "Say hi, Tali."

Vicky's sister gives a shy smile and says hello, albeit very quietly. You barely hear her Tali seemed to be the opposite of Vicky. While the former seemed to be shy and soft-spoken, the latter was mischievous, outgoing, and rather promiscuous. You kind of feel sorry for Tali. As far as you know, Vicky is the only older female figure she has, and Vicky doesn't seem like much of a role model. Knowing all of this, you assume that Tali's innocence will only last a few more years at the most.

"Um..." Tali says, looking at you. "Who is this, big sister?"

"Oh, this is [your name]. He's a friend of mine." her sister answers.

"What were you guys doing?"

"Oh, he was just helping me with some back pains I've been having."

"Okay..." Tali looks at you again. "Nice to meet you."

"Alright, now get back to bed, sleepyhead."

"Okay, Vicky."

Once the little vixen was out of earshot, you turn to Vicky. "I never would've guessed that you had a little sister." you say.

"Yeah, she's the reason why I asked you to give me some extra food." she explains. "I can easily gather enough food if it was just me, but I have her to think about. The days where I don't eat are the days when I can only get enough food for Tali."

"So she doesn't know that I'm the one bringing the food?" you ask.

"No. She thinks that it's all me. I don't want her to know that her big sister can't provide for her. She'll lose faith in me, and I don't want that to happen." Vicky has a sad look on her face. "I really appreciate what you've done, and part of the reason why I'm always coming onto you is that I wanted to repay you in some way."

"I didn't realize..." you say.

So you and Vicky say your goodbyes and you go back to the house. While you sleep, you think to yourself.

"Wow. Vicky wasn't as bad as I thought she was. Now I feel sorry for her. She must harass everyone here just to get her mind off of the pain she feels. Maybe if I tell Sasha about Vicky' situation, she might help them out."

So you tell Sasha about Vicky's sister and...
144131112.title: Awkward Introduction

choices: She relents and lets them stay with you
She'll let Tali stay, but not Vicky
No deal, neither of them get to stay
1441311121.content:
"A little sister?" Sasha asked, suprised at this new revelation. "We never knew she was looking after a little one, we all just thought that she was just doing it to screw with us." She takes a seat and holds her head in her hands to think.

"So what now?" You speak up. "We can't just let a small child live in a dank cave, surviving off of whatever her sister manages to get from us. We have to do something to help her."

"As much as I like your kind heart, what can we possibly do to help them? I don't want you making these food runs to her cave anymore, they're too risky. Predators could smell the food and attack."

"Well, if we can't bring the food to them, why not bring them here? We have room here on the farm, and if she's willing to put in the work, she should be allowed some of the rewards."

How does Sasha take your suggestion?
1441311121.title: She is surprised.

choices: She gets mad at you for saying tha
She relents and allows Vicky and Tali to stay.
1441311122.content:
"I already knew hat Vicky had a sister." says Sasha.

"You do?" you ask.

"Yeah," she replies, "but how do you know?"

"That's not important." you say, trying to change the subject. "I was wondering, since Vicky needs to support her sister, and they don't have much food-"

"I know where you're going with this, and the answer is no." Sasha interrupts.

"Come on, Sasha." you plead. "Tali's nothing like her sister, and I'm sure Vicky would be very grateful."

"Yeah, but she has her sister's genes." she argues. "With Vicky being the only mother figure in her life, Tali's bound to grow up to be just like Vicky."

"Well, if they lived here, you could be Tali's mother figure."

"Damn, I walked right into that one..." Sasha mutters to herself.

"Just give them a chance."

"The answer is no! They're not staying here, and that's final." she yells in atone that reminded you of your mom. Sasha turns around and begins to walk away, when you mumble to yourself:

"If it wasn't Vicky, you'd let them stay."

Sasha's sensitive ears pick up on what you said and she stops in her tracks.
1441311122.title: Not Much of a Surprise

14413111222.content:
Apparently, Sasha realized that what you said was true. She turned around and said "Fine, they can stay."

"Thank you, Sasha." you say gratefully. You were about to go and tell Vicky the good news, when Sasha stops you.

"BUT, if they cause any trouble, not only are they out of here, but it's gonna be on YOUR head!" she says sternly.

You gulped and said "Okay."

So you make your way over to Vicky's den and tell her that she'll be allowed to stay on the farm. Upon hearing this, she tackles you to the ground and hugs you.

"Thank you so much!" she says. "I can't believe you'd do this for me!"

"I did it for Tali, not you." you say, correcting her.

"Oh, whatever." she says.

"And another thing," you say, "don't cause any trouble while you're there, otherwise you and your sister are gonna get kicked out and I'm gonna get in trouble for it since it was my idea."

"Fine, I'll try." Vicky says, "but it's gonna cost you."

"Cost me what?" you ask.

"I get to sleep in your room." she says

"Fine, I'll get a sleeping bag for you." you say.

Vicky gives a devious chuckle. "That's not what I meant. I want to share a bed with you." You were taken aback by what she said, but you realize that you have no other choice.

"Fine," you say.
14413111222.title: She relents and allows Vicky and Tali to stay.

choices: She doesn't lay a finger on you.
144131112221.content:
Needless to say, everyone on the farm was surprised to hear that Vicky and her sister would be staying here. That night, you realize that you had forgotten to milk Bess today, so you run to the barn.

"Sorry I'm so late, Bess." you say.

"No problem, hon. Better late than never." she says.

You look up and see that Luna wasn't hanging from her usual spot. Then again, it was past sundown, so she must've left. As you were milking Bess, the two of you start talking.

"So do you really think it's a good idea to let Vicky stay here." she asks. "It's not that I don't think she and her sister deserve a place to stay, but Sasha-"

"I know," you say, "but this rivalry between the two of them in particular is way out of hand. They need to be civil for once."

"True, but isn't this a little risky?" Bess asks.

"It is, but I'm in charge, and it's time I start acting like it."

After you finished milking Bess, you return to the house, to see how everything is. When you walk into the living room, you see Tara lying on the couch, and Sasha sitting at the kitchen table with her arms crossed. "She'll get over it." you think. You get up to your room and see Vicky putting Tali to sleep on the air mattress you got for her. You changed into your pajamas in the bathroom so Vicky couldn't see you. When you get to your bed, Vicky crawls in with you.

"Don't even touch me while I'm sleeping." you say.

"You're no fun," says Vicky.

What does Vicky do while you're sleeping?
144131112221.title: New Residents

1441311122212.content:
Surprisingly, Vicky didn't try anything with you. You wake up the next morning and see her lying on her side with her back turned to you. Although you woke up feeling refreshed, breakfast was as awkward as it could be. You look over at Sasha and her face says it all: She dreaded having to cook for her worst enemy and her little sister. After you were finished eating, you ask Sasha to have a word with her alone.

You and Sasha go up to her room and talk. "Why are you so tense this morning?" you ask.

"Well, I don't really feel comfortable that the girl who's been messing with me and this farm for years is now living here." Sasha says.

"Well, deep down, I'm sure she's grateful for letter her and her sister stay here." you say. "Maybe she'll show it if you, oh I don't know, try being nice to her?" you say, putting some sarcasm in that last part.

Sasha stays quiet for a few seconds and lets out a sigh. "You're right."

You and Sasha go back downstairs to the kitchen, and Sasha lets out a nervous sigh.

"Vicky." she says. "I was wondering if you wanted to spend some girl time with me."

Vicky looks at Sasha for a second and....
1441311122212.title: Well, This is Out of Character for Her

14413111222121.content:
"Sure, why not?" Vicky says with a smile. You found it hard to believe that Vicky's being more mature than Sasha. When Sasha and Vicky leave the house, you realize that you have to look after Tali since her big sister is gone. You decide to ask Tara for help.


"Oh, yeah. Nothing would make me happier that to take care of Vicky's sister rather than relax." she says sarcastically.


"Well you do nothing but 'relax' all the time. One day without it isn't gonna kill you." you say.


Tara glares at you, but then she sighs and says "Alright fine. I doubt you can look after her yourself anyway."


The two of you go back to the kitchen and see Tali just sitting there. She notices you and looks at you. "Hi, [your name]. Hi Tara." she says. There was an awkward silence in the room, you you decide to break the ice. "So, Tali," you say. "What do you like to do for fun?"


"Well, um... I don't really do anything. I just sit around." she says shyly.


"Well isn't she a little bundle of joy." Tara whispers sarcastically to herself. "Come up to my room, Tali. I want to show you something." she says. You follow the two of them, wondering what Tara was talking about, but when you reach the bedroom door she says "You stay out here." and closes the door on you.


A few minutes later, you hear giggling coming from inside the room, from both Tali AND Tara.You peek inside and see Tali playing with a doll. "So you can keep that and play with it whenever you want." says Tara. "Thank you!" the little vixen says. You close the door so Tara doesn't see you, but she comes out of the room a few seconds later. "So how did it go?" you ask, as if you don't already know. "She'll be alright." she says. "I didn't know that you were so good with kids." you say. Tara blushes. "Yeah, well... neither did I."

Later that day, Sasha and Vicky come home, and you could immediately tell how their "outing" went.
14413111222121.title: Babysitting

144131112221211.content:
When Sasha and Vicky walked into the house, they were laughing with each other as if they were best friends. You had a smirk on your face as you think of what form of gloating you should use later.


Later that evening, you were able to get some time alone with Sasha. "Okay, I admit it. You were right." she says. "So how did it go, exactly?" you ask, curious to know how their day went.

"We just spent the day talking and doing chores together." she says "We actually had a lot in common. It was nice getting to know her."


"Well, that's good to know." you say.


"I'll call you when dinner's ready." she says.


You did it. You were finally ably to get Vicky and Sasha to get along, now you had another thing to take care of. You wanted to get Tara to open up a little. After seeing what she's been able to do with Tali, you thought that Tara would be a good person to have as a friend, if only she weren't so moody and reclusive. You want to try and get her to open up, just a little, but how?
144131112221211.title: "Admit It, Sasha. I Was Right."

choices: Excuse yourself, go to her den, and explain why you can't give her food tomorrow
Attempt to make a late-night delivery.
14413112.content:
You were able to resist Vicky's charms for the umpteenth time. "Nice try, Vicky, but I'm not gonna let you snare me."

Vicky grunts in frustration. Being rejected several times by the same guy does that to girls like her. "Are you SURE you're not gay?" she asks.

"For the second time, no." you say, getting a little annoyed at the implication.

On your way home, you realize something: You had agreed to bring food to Vicky every day, but she said that you didn't have to come back for three or four days. Maybe the fact that Vicky was attracted to you was a good thing. You just hope that Sasha doesn't find out. Tara probably wouldn't care, but it's best to keep this a secret from her, too.

When you get back to the house, Sasha greets you as you enter into the living room. "You were up early." she says. "You were already out of bed when I went to wake you up. Where've ya been?"

"Nowhere." you bluntly answer.

Sasha tilts her head in confusion for a second, then brushes the issue off. "Anyway, your breakfast is waiting for you." she says.

"You know, you really don't have to do everything for me." you say. "I don't want you overworking yourself."

"That's very nice of you, but I'll be just fine. Now go get your breakfast before it gets cold." she says before giving you a smile then turning to go upstairs.

When you sit down at the table, Tara was sitting across from you, lazily lapping her milk. She stops for a second, then looks at you.

"You're hiding something." she says out of the blue. "I don't know what, but it's something."

"What makes you say that?" you say, not giving the slightest hint of nervousness.

"I have a thing for figuring out when people are keeping secrets." she says. "And Sasha has a way of finding out what those secrets are, so I'd come clean now if I were you."

"Well, that would be pretty hard considering that I don't have any secrets to come clean about." you say.

"Sure you don't." Tara says. She starts drinking her milk again.

The next three days were quite peaceful, and Sasha was really confused as to why Vicky hasn't been around the farm lately. She eventually stopped caring, telling you: "The less often she's around, the better."

However, on the night before your next "meeting" with Vicky, Sasha says something that complicates EVERYTHING for you.

You're in your room, ready to go to bed, when your door opens and Sasha walks inside.

"Hey, [your name]." she says. "I was wondering if you wanted to spend the day together tomorrow, and we could share a bed again tonight."

You were screwed now. Your plan was to wake up early the next morning, then take some food to Vicky's den, but now Sasha wants to sleep with you tonight, AND spend the day with you tomorrow. You have no choice but to accept, but what are you gonna do about Vicky.
14413112.title: Your Will is Strong

choices: ...you let me give you a kiss."
...you let me watch you and Sasha tomorrow."
144131121.content:
You realize that you need to explain this to Vicky BEFORE tomorrow. "Wait here, Sasha." you say, "I'll be right back in about ten minutes."

"Uh... okay." she says. When you leave the room, you find a lantern in the kitchen, and make your way to Vicky's den. When you walk inside, you look around to see if you can find her. "Vicky?" you call out. "You in here?"

"I most certainly am, sweetie." you hear from behind you. You feel arms wrap around you from behind, taking you by surprise. "What the hell?!" you exclaim. Vicky then lets go. "I take it you came here this late because you want a sleeping companion other than Sasha?" she asks. You wonder how she knows that Sasha's shared a bed with you before, but you remember what you came here for.

"Nice try, Vicky, but I came here to tell you that I can't make it tomorrow." you say.

"Why not?" Vicky asks, raising an eyebrow.

"Sasha wants to spend the day with me, so I won't be able to make it."

"Aww... you have a little date then?"

"No, it's not a date!" you say defensively.

"Relax." she says. "Now, this is sad to hear, firstly because I won't have food tomorrow, and secondly because you find Sasha more attractive than me."

"I never called anyone attractive!"

"Whatever. My point is, I'll only let you off the hook if..."
144131121.title: Is an Explanation Good Enough?

1441311211.content:
"You've got to be kidding me!" you exclaim.

"If you don't, not only will I go back to harassing you guys, but I'll do it much more often, to you and Sasha especially." A devilish grin creeped across Vicky's face.

"Fine." you say. "How bad can a kiss on the cheek be, anyway?"

Vicky bursts out laughing. "You actually thought I meant a kiss on the cheek! That's cute!" she says in between fits of laughter. You're screwed.

"Fine. but no longer than three seconds"

"Ten seconds."

"Five"

"Seven" Damn, Vicky's good at this.

"Fair enough..." you say. "and don't grope me while you're kissing me."

"Fine, but it is okay if you grope me, just so you know."

"Not even in your dreams." you say.

"Eh, it was worth a try."

"And no tongue either." you add.

"You are just so picky." Vicky says, rolling her eyes.

"I'm glad you know that." you retort. "Now let's get this over with. If I'm gone for too long, Sasha will suspect something." With that, Vicky licks he lips, wraps her arms around your back, and plants her lips on yours. At about five seconds, you feel her tongue trying to enter your mouth, but you struggle to keep it out. Vicky finally lets go of you, and chuckled to herself.

"Sorry about that." she says. "I couldn't help myself."

"Yeah, whatever." you say. "I'm gonna head back to the house and wash my mouth."

"Those words can hurt a lady's feelings, you know." she says.

"What does that have to do with you." you say, trying to be a smart-ass.

"Funny." she says. "Seriously, though. If your in the mood for more than just a kiss, you know where I'm at."

"Ugh, gag me." you say.
1441311211.title: Bitch can Drive a Hard Bargain

choices: Vicky surprises the two of you!
14413112111.content:
The very next day, Sasha wakes you up from your deep sleep. "Wake up sleepyhead!" she says excitedly. She seemed to be extra cheery today. Then again, you had a dog once that would always get excited when you would go for a walk with him. The same must be the case for Sasha.



"I've already made your breakfast." she says. "Hurry and eat it before it gets cold."



"Okay, I'm going." you say groggily. After you eat your breakfast, you brush your teeth and bathe. Once you get dressed, Sasha pulls you out of the house. "So where are we going?" you ask. "You'll see." she says. On the way to the mystery destination, you and Sasha have some idle chit chat. You both talk about your interests, your lives prior to you moving to the farm, among other things. You eventually stop caring about where you were going because you liked getting to know Sasha.



You and Sasha finally reach the place she was talking about. It was a high hill that had a beautiful view of the countryside. "I know it might not be as flashy as the city, but it's quite a view." she says. "No way, this is amazing." you say. "Yeah, I always come here when I need to really relax. I always thought it would be nice to come here with a friend, but none of the other girls wanted to." she says. "I'm glad you took me here, actually." you say sincerely.



"Thanks, that means a lot." says Sasha. While you were taking in the view, Sasha looks at you affectionately, although you don't notice. Just then...
14413112111.title: A Day Out

144131121111.content:
As you were watching the incredible view, Sasha takes this opportunity to slip her hand into yours. You don't notice her furry paw grasping her hand until you finish watching. The look that she's giving you is making you feel uneasy.



"Uh... Sasha?" you say. She snaps out of her self-induced trance. "Huh? What?" she says. "You're holding my hand." She looks down. "Oh, I am, aren't I." she says, slightly embarrassed. She slowly releases your hand, but by the way it looks, she doesn't seem to want to let go. "Is there something that you want to tell me?" you ask her.



Sasha looks away from you for a second, blushing. "Well, it's just that... you're really nice, you remind me a lot of your uncle, only with more quirks, and I find that kind of.... attractive."



Needless to say, you were really surprised! You only had one girlfriend before, and she cheated on you. Now, a furry is admitting that she's attracted to you. "So, how do you feel about me?" she asks, turning to you. Now you're put on the spot. "Well, Sasha..... I..." you struggle to say. You look up at Sasha and she looks like she's expecting the worst. "I understand if you think this is wrong. I shouldn't have said anything."



"No wait!" you say, grabbing Sasha's arm. "It's not that, it's just that I've never thought of you romantically." "Oh, I understand." she says. "My last relationship didn't end that well, but I think i'm willing to try a relationship with you." Sasha's face brightens up and...
144131121111.title: Sasha's Confession

choices: When you woke up, Sasha was gone!
Switch to Sasha's Point Of View, as she's held up in Vicky's home
1441311211112.content:
Before you were able to react, Sasha kissed you. However, it wasn't on the cheek or anything like that, but rather more like a direct kiss on the lips!

At first, you didn't know how to react, but then you felt your heartbeat pumping slightly more faster, as you realized something; Even though Sasha was not a human being, you thought she was really beautiful. Then,just as Sasha was about end the kiss, you pulled her back in, as the two of you began to do the famed "French Kiss".

But as you and Sasha kissed, you both fell on the grass, as you and Sasha continues kissing, holding one another very close. Around 3 minutes later, you and Sasha ended the romantic make-out, as the two of you looked at each other with blushing red cheeks, both aroused and embarrassed.

Then, as the two of you stood up, Sasha was still blushingas she said, "I-I am so sorry, [your name]. I just don't know what came over me." But before she continued to apologize, you put a finger to Sasha's snout and replied, "It's okay, Sasha. You don't have to be sorry. I said I was willing to try a relationship with you, and that's what I intend to do."

Hearing those words from your mouth made the female Husky tear up in her eyes, causing her to quickly hug you tightly, further confirming that you wanted to be with her. However, both you and Sasha didn't know that Vicky was watching the whole thing from the bushes. Unfortunately, as she witnessed the part where you and Sasha French Kissed, Vicky became enraged with jealousy, wanting you all to herself, instead of allowing Sasha take you as her lover.

While you and Sasha went back to the farm house to get ready for dinner, Vicky began to formulate a plan to ruin Sasha and make you Vicky's boyfriend. As for what the vixen's plan was, one could only speculate.

As the day was done, you and Sasha had a wonderful time together, as the two of you got into the same bed, kissed each other goodnight, and drifted off to sleep.
1441311211112.title: A Dog's Romantic Kiss & Vicky's Jealousy

144131122.content:
You decided you would just have to get up early in the morning before everyone else and deliver Vicky’s food then. “Sure, I’d love to have some company tonight.” Sasha crawls into bed with you and licks your cheek as she wraps her arm around you. “Good night” she says as she snuggles closer to you. You gently stroke her back until she falls asleep before you pass out yourself. You knew you would need all the sleep you could get for later on.




You woke up at about two in the morning. You would normally have gone straight back to sleep, but you knew if you were going to do this, you had better do it now. You slowly slide Sasha’s arm from around you and quietly sneak downstairs, your eyes adjusting to the darkness.




There was no point in getting dressed. Sasha would know something was up if she found you in bed with your day clothes on after you got back, so you just put on your shoes and leave on your pajamas, careful not to wake Tara as she lays curled in front of the fireplace. You quickly throw some sandwiches together and grab a flashlight before heading out into the warm summer night.




You hear the light snores of Bess and Marie as you pass the barn and stable. Luna will have set out to find breakfast by now. As you come to the edge of the forest, you can’t help but notice how much creepier it is at night. Your flashlight casts the twisted shadows of the trees on the ground, and you hear an owl hooting in the distance.




You shake yourself to regain your composure. There’s nothing to be afraid of. This isn’t a horror movie, there’s nothing dangerous in these woods. You keep telling yourself that as you make your way through the forboding trees, twigs snapping and leaves rustling beneath your feet.




It was harder to find the path to Vicky’s den in the dark. You start to worry that you’ve been going around in circles the whole time like those kids in The Blair Witch Project. As you stop a minute and try to figure out where you are, you hear the sound of flowing water. The stream! It must be nearby! You follow the sound until you eventually do find the stream, following it to Vicky’s den.



You place the bag of sandwiches on the ground at the entrance of the den, but no sooner than you do, the batteries in your flashlight die, leaving you standing in the pitch-black forest with only the moon giving you minimal light.




“Well, this is just perfect.” you say to yourself “Just fucking perfect.” Now how are you supposed to get back to the farm? There’s no way you were going to try and find your way home when you couldn’t even see your hand in front of your face. Then, you hear a sound that turns your blood to ice. Footsteps approaching. You suddenly go stiff as a board, your body paralyzed with fear. You start praying to God that you were right when you said there was nothing to be afraid of in these woods.




The footsteps are getting louder, every twig snapping, and every crunching leaf seeming to echo through the entire forest. Whatever it was that was approaching, you pray it couldn’t see in the dark. Suddenly, you nearly jump out of your skin as you feel a hot blast of breath on the back of your neck.




It was right behind you!



Adrenaline surges through your body as your fight-or-flight response takes control of your body. Moving entirely on instinct, you spin around and deliver a punch to the creature’s stomach. Whatever it was you hit, it made a loud grunting sound as it doubled over clutching its stomach. You recognized that voice. It was….
144131122.title: If Only Pizza Hut Delivered This Late

choices: Reader's Choice (She doesn't suspect a thing).
1441311221.content:
You recognize the voice as Vicky's and you immediately rush over to her. She tries to punch you, but misses by an inch.

"What the fuck!?" she says. "What did you do that for!?"

"You shouldn't have snuck up on me like that!" you say in defense. "I didn't know it was you!"

"Who were you expecting?" she asks sarcastically. "The friggin' Boogeyman?"

"Ha, ha." you say. "Here's your food." you say.

"Why are you here so early in the morning anyway?" asks Vicky.

"I wasn't gonna be able to give this to you later in the day."

"Why?" she asks, tilting her head.

"You don't need to know."

"Well, I could cause a little mischief around the farm if you don't tell."

"Fine. Sasha wanted to spend the day with me."

"Awww! Ain't that cute?"

"Whatever, can you help me get back to the farm? My flashlight died."

"Well, I can't let you die in the woods, so okay."

So you and Vicky make your way back to the farm. "You know," she says. "You can hold my hand if you want. I can even give you a nice, long kiss on the lips of you get scared."

"Keep dreaming." you say.

"Are you sure you're not-"

"No, I'm not gay!" you say, trying not to scream. "Dammit, stop asking me that!"

You finally get to the farm, where you part with Vicky and head into the house. When you get to your room, you see Sasha sleeping right where you left her. You climb into the bed, and the shuffling makes her wake up.

"[Your name]? Is that you?" she says, squinting her eyes.

"Yeah, I just went to the bathroom." you say.

"Oh, okay." Sasha says before going back to sleep.

The next morning, you wake up next to Sasha, who was already awake.

"Morning, sleepy head." she says.

"Morning." you say. "So what do you have planned for us to do today?" You wonder what she has in store, and if she's onto your deal with Vicky. What does she have planned?
1441311221.title: Just the Girl I Kinda Wanted to See

1441311222.content:
You recognize the voice as Sasha's and you instantly felt guilty. You rush over to where you heard her voice come from.

"Oh, shit! I'm so sorry Sasha!" you say sincerely. "Are you okay."

"I'm fine." she says, somewhat weakly. "More importantly, what are you doing here? I followed your scent over here, and here we are outside Vicky's den."

"Do you mind if I explain that after we get home?" you ask. You plan to formulate a fake story by the time you get home.

"I guess your explanation can wait till then. Besides, this place even give ME the creeps at night."

When Sasha turns around, you quickly toss the bag of sandwiches into the den. "What was that?" asked Sasha. "I didn't hear anything." you say.

When you get home, you're about to go upstairs and get to bed, but then Sasha stops you. "Where are you going?" she asks. "To bed, I'm tired." you answer. "I can explain everything in the morning."

"No, you're going to explain everything now!" she says with a rather authoritative tone. You had your fake story ready, but you were still skeptical about whether or not it would work on Sasha. Maybe she won't be so mad if you just told her the truth. She was the reason you agreed to this deal between you and Vicky in the first place. You wanted her not to worry about Vicky bothering her again. So what now?

15.content:
A loud commotion suddenly erupts from outside. Sasha looks out the window and growls. “Speak of the devil.” “What is it?” You ask as she walks into the living room. “Vicky.” She says as she takes the shotgun above the fireplace and tosses it to you. “Know how to use that?” She asks. You shake your head. You never even held a gun, let alone fired one.


“Just point and pull the trigger, now come on!” She garbs your arm and drags you back into the kitchen and through the door. Tara doesn’t even get up. She just sits there, lazily lapping her milk. As Sasha pulls you onto the porch and down the stairs, you see the chickens running helter-skelter all over the place.


Out of one of the coops emerges an anthro fox, with bright orange fur covering the majority of her body. Her hands and feet were black, while her belly and chest were white. Long red hair hung from her head down to her shoulders. You couldn’t help but notice how beautiful she was, and how luscious her body was, with wide hips, a trim waist and stomach, and breasts that had to be at least G-cup.


The vixen holds a chicken under each arm, and clutches an egg in her mouth. “Stop right there!’ shouts Sasha as she drags you up to the voluptuous specimen of a fox. “Drop ’em!’ Sasha orders, growling ferociously. Vicky sighs and sets both chickens down, before removing the egg from her mouth, holding in her hand.


“What does a girl have to do to get some breakfast around here?” She says annoyed. She then notices you and smirks. “Well, who’s this? A new addition to the Funny Farm?” Sasha bared her teeth, practically snarling. “He’s the new owner of the farm, and if you try to steal from us again, he’s going to give you a good blast-full of buckshot, and make a rug out of you!”


Vicky smirks and leans forward laying her hands and head on top of the shotgun you ha been pointing at her the whole time, her breasts hanging. “You wouldn’t do that to poor me, would you?” She flutters her eyelids in a cute way. You can’t help but stare transfixed, entangled in her mesmerizing beauty. “I……um………ah…..” You can only stutter as she pushes the gun away from her and comes very close to you, her breasts pressing against your chest. Sasha looks as though she is going to attack Vicky at any second.


“What do you say? Can’t I have just this one egg?” She holds up the egg between her thumb and index finger. “O…o…okay.” You manage to say. “But I don’t want anymore trouble from you for a good while, understand?” You say, suddenly speaking in an authorative to, but that quickly disappears when Vicky gives you a lick on the cheek. “Thanks, handsome.” she says as she gives you a smile and a wink, before turning and heading into the forest.


Sasha face-palms herself. “You’re just like your uncle!” She says as you head back to the house. “I always told him he was far too lenient with the pesky fox. Looks like her tricks work on humans too.” You spent the rest of the day meeting the other animals on the farm. For the most part, they seemed to happily accept you, except for Luna, who stayed sleeping in the barn all day.


That night……….

151.content:
By 4:00 pm you were all done with the chores, and you decide to take a nap. You wake up at about 7:00 in the night, and go downstairs to the kitchen. On the fridge you see a note from Sasha and Tara.

"Out for a walk. There's food in the microwave if you get hungry."

You weren't too hungry, so you decide to go to your car to get your TV and your video games. What can you say, they help you relax. You were at the car and searching your pockets for the keys when you feel a sharp pain in the back of your head. You then collapse to the ground.

Your eyes flutter open, and you see that you're in a cave, and your arms and legs are tied with rope. You struggle to get loose, then you hear a voice. "It's no use struggling."

You look into the cave's depths and see Vicky emerge from the shadows. She was wearing a blue silk robe and was sauntering over to your side. "I tied those ropes as tight as I could. There's no way you're getting out." she said.

"Why are you doing this?" you ask. "I never did anything to you."

Vicky laughs. "Silly, this has nothing to do with anything you did." She gets up and looks out the cave into the night sky. "When I met your uncle, he had all the qualities I was looking for in a man, but he was way too old for me.""She turns and looks at you with the eyes of a predator. "And then you came along. You're young, and you're just like your uncle, and I am not letting this opportunity pass me by." Vicky gets on all fours and slowly crawls to you.

"I'm curious, how old are you?" she asks.

"Um... twenty one" you say.

"Perfect," she says. "I'm twenty two and I love younger guys."

When she grts to you, she gives you some gentle love bites, which elicits a moan from you.

"Ah, so I see you're enjoying this." she says. "Well there's more to come."

Vicky gets back to eye level with you and she leans in closer.....

1511.content:
Vicky presses her lips to yours as she wraps her arms around you in a loving embrace, her bushy tail slowly swishing back and forth behind her. You can't struggle, being bound so tightly by the ropes.

However, you begin to wonder if being trapped here isn't such a bad thing.

Vicky stays in the same position for about ten seconds until finally she breaks the kiss. The vixen looks deep into your eyes and continues to speak to you in a soft, seductive voice, her breath warm on your face. "I'm sorry for all the trouble I caused for you and your friends. I had wanted to take things a bit more slowly, but when I see a man I like, I can't risk missing an opportunity to get to know them better." She leans in and kisses you again.

As soon as your lips are free, you slowly regain your ability to form words, your heart racing with all kinds of emotions going through your mind. "B- But you keep stealing the chickens."

"Oh, I don't eat the chickens; I prefer fish and rabbits. I simply use the chickens to get their eggs. After I'm done with them, I put them back. Ever noticed there's no empty spots in the coop?"

Come to think of it, the coop had been completely full of chickens when you went to collect their eggs this morning, minus the one you relinquished to Vicky. No spot was left unoccupied.

"In actuality, I just borrowed the chickens so that I could get close to your uncle. He and I were very close friends, but of course the other animals hated me for my staged tricks. I've had to dodge bullets, claws and even knives just to talk with my only friend. When he passed away I was miserable. Now that you've arrived, I have a second chance. But this time, it's a chance to love."

The pretty fox puts her hand on your chin and forces you to look her in the eyes.

"Will you... will you love me?"

As you run through the woods, your mind only focuses on one thing, the fact that you were just violated by a fox!
