151122121222.title: Is it Legit?

1511221212221.content:
Vicky took the stuff for the pregancy test and went somewhere to get some privicy. But Sasha kept an eye on her to make sure she did not run off nor try to fake the test.

Thankfully nothing happened and Vicky took the test when told to do so. It took her time to figure it out with Sasha's help, but it was not too much trouble.

After Vicky took the test, what are the results?
1511221212221.title: "Alright, let's get this overwith."

choices: She insists that she is pregnant!
She caves and admits that she's lying.
1511221212222.content:
Vicky's eyes widen as soon as she hears Sasha mentions the pregnancy test.


"Pregnancy test!?" she exclaims. "Are you insane!?"


"What's the matter?" asks Sasha.


"I shouldn't have to to take some stupid test to prove to you that I'm pregnant!" the vixen yells.


"Well, If you're so sure that you're pregnant with my kid, then why are you so hesitant to take the test." you say.


"I don't see why you have to be so invasive!" says Vicky with a pout.


"What's so invasive about it?" Sasha asks, getting annoyed. "You just pee on the thing and it tells you f you're knocked up or not. You're making it sound a lot more complicated than it actually is."


She's right. Vicky was making this more complicated than it had to be. This wasn't like her. If she was confident that she was carrying your kid, then she would jump at the chance to prove herself right, especially to see the look on Sasha's face if that was the case. Now, she's being very hush-hush. Like you said before. She shouldn't have any problem with taking the test if she was, indeed, pregnant. The only explanation is that she's making up excuses.


As you think about this, Sasha and Vicky continue to go back and forth, until Sasha finally says:


"Okay, Vicky! Enough is enough! Are you pregnant or not!?"
1511221212222.title: Suspicious Behavior

choices: "You're taking this test whether you want to or not!"
"You know what? Screw it! Let's go home."
15112212122221.content:
Vicky continues to insist that she's pregnant.

What's Sasha's response.
15112212122221.title: Now What?

choices: Skip to the day of the birth
151122121222211.content:
With a sigh of frustration, Vicky finally gives in. "Fine. I'll take the fricking test, but only to prove to you I'm telling the truth." Vicky swipes the pregnancy test from your hand and goes back into her cave for some privacy. For several moments, the two of you waited outside Vicky's den, Sasha with her arms crossed and tapping her foot impatiently. Finally, Vicky emerges from the cave, and your heart sinks when you see the results.



"What did I tell you? Pregnant!"



Sashes growls at Vicky before sighing in disbelief. "So what are we gonna do?" You ask " Only one thing we can do." Sasha replies " She has to come stay with us." Needless to say, you couldn't believe what you just heared. "WHAT!? But you hate Vicky!"



"Yes, I do. And normally I'd rip out her throat for what she did to you. But I could never forgive myself for killing an unborn child. Besides, would you be able to live with the fact that you abandoned your own child?"



Sash was right. As much as you didn't want to admit it, Vicky was carrying your child. Despite what you said earlier, you knew your conscience would never let you get a good night's sleep again if you just abandoned your own child. Vicky, of course, was overjoyed to hear this. "Oh how wonderful! Our little bundle of joy is going to have a home!"


"Not so fast." Says Sasha "This is only temporary. Also, don't think you can violate (your name) and get away with it scot free. Sooner or later, you will be punished for what you did." As the three of you head back to the farm, you can't help but worry what Tara and the others will say. "Don't worry." Says Sasha "I'm sure they'll understand. Plus, they might be willing to help with the kid once it's born."



I certainly hope so, you think.
151122121222211.title: A Moral Dilemma

1511221212222111.content:
It's now been a day since Sasha let Vicky stay at the house. Yesterday, when Sasha told everyone about what had happened, they all seemed to understand, even Tara. You still felt kind of helpless, though. You could've wiggled your way out of those ropes and gotten Vicky off of you, right? If only you tried a little harder.


That morning, you wake up to the smell of Sasha cooking breakfast. As you get up, you wonder if Vicky could have done something to the test that made it read "pregnant," but then you pass by the bathroom door and hear some vomiting sounds coming from the other side.


Morning sickness. Yep, she's pregnant, alright.


After breakfast, you go over to the barn so you can milk Bess. "Mornin' sugar!" she says with her usual cheer as you get the two metal tubs ready to collect the milk. As you get to work, there's a long, awkward silence. Normally, you and Bess would be chatting up a storm, but with all that's happened, you don't really feel like talking. All of a sudden, Bess breaks the silence.


"It's not your fault, you know." she says.


"Huh?" you answer.


"I said that none of this is your fault," the cow repeats. "You didn't know that Vicky would do what she did, so you shouldn't feel any king of guilt. Stop beating yourself up about it. What's happened has happened, and now the best thing you can do is be the best father you can to that baby, regardless of the way it was conceived."


What she said made sense. "You're right, Bess, thanks!" you say. "I'm glad we don't have one of those automated milkers, otherwise you wouldn't have been able to give me that advice."


"No problem, sugar," she says.


For the rest of the day, you feel much better, and you get the rest of your chores done quickly. When you get to your room and prepare for a quick nap, someone comes into your room.


Who is it, and what do they want?
1511221212222111.title: Follow Vicky's pregnancy

15112212122221111.content:
"Hey, Sasha," you say.


"Hi, [your name]," she says back. "I was just checking to see if you're okay. You know, with all that's happened..."


"I'm just fine," you say. "Bess was able to cheer me up."


"Oh, that's good," she says. "She always knows how to make people feel better. There is something I want you to know, though." Sasha then takes a seat next to you on the bed.


"What do you mean?" you ask.


"It's just that... I'm really sorry that this happened to you," she says.


"You say that like it's your fault," you say.


"Well, I can't help but think that it somewhat is," she explained. "I should have investigated when I noticed that you were gone for a long time, but I thought that you were just running late with the chores. Little did I know, you were at Vicky's den getting..." Sasha's voice trails off and she starts to sob, leaving you wondering what to do so she can cheer up.
15112212122221111.title: Can We Talk?

151122121222211111.content: You wrapped your arms around Sasha and pulled her closer to you. Her fur felt very soft against your skin. Sasha returned the hug as she wrapped her arms around you. "There's no need for you to beat yourself up about this." you whispered into Sasha's ear "You know, in a way, Vicky being pregnant might be a good thing.". "How do you figure that?" Sasha asked, as she pulled out of your hug. "I could get her to help around the farm, plus she can show her child the ropes when they're older.". Sasha thought about this for a minute and nodded. "I guess well just need to try to make the best of this." Sasha said. You nodded in agreement as you walked into the kitchen to find,
151122121222211111.title: Give her a hug.

1511221212222112.content:
Five months go by faster than you realize. Vicky's stomach gets bigger, too, and despite the hatred you had towards her at first, you both started to grow on each other. You actually start looking forward to the baby's birth.


One morning, you hear groaning sounds coming from the bathroom, and you know who they're coming from.


"Vicky?" you call. "You okay in there?"


"I'm *groan* just fine..." she says. "Don't worry about me."


You were gonna take her word for it, but then you hear a loud splash and freeze in your tracks. There's no way.


"Agh! My water broke!" Vicky yells. Almost immediately, Sasha comes upstairs. "Vicky's water broke?" she asks in disbelief.


Over the next several hours, you, Sasha, and Tara help Vicky through labor, and what's the end result?
1511221212222112.title: It's Time

15112212122221121.content: Is the baby a girl or a boy?
15112212122221121.title: Success

choices: "Human" with Fox Ears and Fox Tail
151122121222211211.content:
So what kind of baby girl is your and Vicky's child?

Does it look like a full Anthro fox like Vicky (Except it may have enough of your human DNA, maybe a change in it's digestive track to be able to process Meat and Plant products)?

Or does it look kind of human, except for Fox Ears and a Fox Tail with abilities of a fox?
151122121222211211.title: It's a Girl!

1511221212222112111.content:
Everyone stared at the little bundle in Vicky's arms, it was like looking at a little clone of her, same orange and white fur pattern, same red hair, it was sort of weird, guess Vicky's genes kicked the crap out of yours. "Welcome to the world Elizabeth" Vicky said gently, this was a side of Vicky you had never seen she was gentle, caring, motherly. She ever so gently lifted Elizabeth up to her breast as she made small noises with her mouth, Elizabeth instantly latched onto the nipple and began to suckle as she found Vicky's breast. There was a soft "aww" that went through the whole room, Vicky silently crying tears of joy as Elizabeth ate her first meal, you however felt a bit different. You slowly backed up and as silently as possible left the room, heading downstairs although not silently enough as you hear the soft pad of paws behind you as you leave the room, turning to see Sasha behind you in the living room.

"What's wrong?" she asked, as even though she and Vicky weren't on the best of terms she could tell this was a happy moment.

"I-I don't think I can do this Sasha, I can't stay here" you say.

"What? Why?"

"I, I'm having thoughts I shouldn't be" you reply your head hanging low.

"What do you mean?"

"I can't stand seeing her happy, why does she get to rape me and not suffer any for it? Why does she get to be happy, and just brush this off? I've been having nightmares for weeks and I can't stand leaving the house without the rifle or one of you" you say tears starting to stream down your face. "I tried to just ignore them, to tell myself they would go away, as I stared at Elizabeth I thought of doing something so horrible, I-I just can't--" You broke down into great racking sobs, which stole your ability to keep speaking, you felt Sasha wrap her arms around you and she made soft cooing noise as she gently stroked the back of your head.

"It'll be okay" she said, the two of you sat like that for a few minutes, you gently sobbing into Sasha's coat, that was how everyone else found you, minus Elizabeth.

"Hey, what's wrong with him, Sasha what'd you do?" you were surprised as you looked up, the angry voice belonging to Tara.

"He, he can't stay anymore, he has to leave" Sasha replies hugging you tighter.

"L-leave, why does he have to leave, did any of us do anything..." Jane spoke up and then promptly fell silent as all eyes in the room turned to Vicky.

"You bitch" Tara yells suddenly lunging at Vicky, Bess grabbing her and holding her back "you bitch, I knew he was faking being happy, I knew it, I'll kill you, I'll kill you, we finally get someone who cares for us and you fuck it all up" Tara trying quite hard to literally scratch Vickie's eyes out, to her credit she didn't even jump back, just stood there. She slowly walked past Bess and Tara, Jane physically recoiling as Vicky neared her, Marie looking like she was doing everything in her power to restrain herself, a growl growing ever louder in Sasha's throat as Vicky got closer to you.

"Sasha, let me talk to him" Vicky says quietly.

"Fuck you, your the cause of all this farm's problems, even before he came here, all you did was steal from us and try to humiliate and degrade us, we let you live here because he accepted his responsibility as a father, even though he had no need to. You kidnapped him and raped him, he doesn't deserve to suffer because of you" Sasha says, her voice getting more and more...desperate, tears springing up in her eyes as she hugged you so tightly it hurt. You realized that the next words were aimed at you "please, please don't leave us, your the best friend we've ever had, your even better than your uncle, please don't leave" she cried.

"Sasha, I-" Vicky reached out to touch you and then quickly jumped back as Sasha snapped at her, attempting to bite the fox. Vicky stood back up slowly, "Sasha please" Sasha however wouldn't hear any of it and simply snapped at Vicky again and growled. That was when she did something neither of you were expecting she moved towards you again. this time however Vicky didn't move, adding her arms around Sasha's in a hug, Sasha's muzzle clamping down onto her upper right shoulder. Vicky however seemed to just ignore this as she spoke to you "I'm sorry, what I did was wrong, I know it was, I know you'll probably hate me to the end of your days, and I understand that, but please don't take this out on anyone else but me." Vicky stood back up, Sasha's muzzle letting go as she did.

Slowly you pushed Sasha away, standing up yourself, "so you admit this was all your fault?"

"Yes" Vicky replies.

You nod, every muscle in your being was telling you to exact revenge, no one here would stop you from kicking the shit out of Vicky, no one here would stop you if you did the exact same thing she did, you physically turned and spat as those thoughts crossed your mind. "Sasha can you go and get me the shotgun" you say after a few moments of silence, she nods and runs off, an almost happy look on her face as she runs off to get the weapon, Vicky for her part just stands there as Sasha returns carrying the weapon and two shells. You slowly chamber the ammunition speaking as you did "Vicky you took something from me I can never get back, my piece of mind, my sense of safety, so I should be able to take something from you, fair right?" Vicky just stood there seemingly accepting her fate although there were tears streaming down her cheeks.

"Promise me that you'll take care of Elizabeth" Vicky said her voice cracking slightly as she did. You don't answer instead raising the weapon to right in front of her face.

"Is that all you want to say?" you ask her, getting a nod as a reply. You just stand there, staring for a few seconds as she stands there, her entire body shivering before...lowering the weapon. You physically remove the shells from the gun before smashing it against the wall making it unusable. Vicky after she opened her eyes as well as everyone else just stared at you in shock before you spoke. "Vicky you took something from me, so you're going to give it back, you're going to work twice as hard as everyone else, helping do the jobs I do, on top of taking care of Elizabeth is that understood?" Vicky nodded. You turned to everyone else "no one is going to give her a hard time, is that understood" you say, the combination of our tone of voice and your eyes stating there would be consequences. One by one you got reluctant agreement from everyone "good" you say, turning as you felt a light tap on your shoulder, to face Vicky who was in tears.

"W-Why didn't you do it?" she says her voice like that of a frightened child.

You stared at her for a few seconds before responding "Elizabeth doesn't deserve to suffer for your mistakes, she deserves both a mother, and a father." Vicky slowly nods and tackles you to the floor kissing and hugging you with everything she has "thank you, thank you, thank you" she cries truly repentant for what she has done. You can't do any more than pet her head in rely. Finally she lets you stand up and Sasha slowly walks up.
1511221212222112111.title: Anthro Fox (with internal "Modiflications...

15112212122221121111.content:
"Are you sure you're okay?" asks Sasha with a concerned tone.


"I'm fine," you say. "I actually feel a lot better now."


Sasha then turns her attention to Vicky. "I'll get something for you shoulder," she says, looking at the bite mark she had given her.


"Thanks, Sasha," says the fox.


With that little... incident taken care of, you take Vicky up the stairs so you can both see your daughter again. There she was, all wrapped in blankets, laying in a crib that you and Sasha put together.


"She's so cute..." you say.


"She is, isn't she?" says Vicky.


The rest of the day goes by rather quickly, and before you know it, you're in your room, getting ready for bed. All of a sudden, you hear a noise outside your door. You check the time. Nine thirty, just like every other time. You walk over to the window and open it up.


"Hey, Luna," you say to your visitor.


"Hi," she says. "Bess told me what happened earlier today. It must have been pretty stressful,"


"Yeah," you say, "but it's all good, now."


"That's good to know," says Luna. "Congrats on the new addition to the family. Sorry I couldn't be there."


"No worries," you say. "You're nocturnal. It's in your nature to sleep during the day."


"So understanding," she says. "Just like your uncle... Well, I gotta go get some food. See you around."


"Bye," you say, and Luna flies off into the night.
15112212122221121111.title: Never Felt Better

151122121222211211111.content:
The next day went like any other, but instead of you working it was Vicky. You on the other hand, had a chance to get your mind fulling organized. You were still having nightmares about what Vicky did to you. You stayed in your room that entire day telling Sasha and everyone else to not disturb you.

"Why am I still having nightmares?" You say to yourself.

"I thought I sorted everything out yesterday... Unless..." You thought of something that you couldn't believe.

"Suicide..." You say and you begin to tear up. You never thought you would ever think if commuting suicide, but it just popped into your head randomly. You thought about it for a majority of the day. And then your mind stopped working. You went and grabbed a revolver from the basement and started to walk out into the forest. No one seen you so no one knew you had left. That's when you stopped. You looked at the revolver. It had one bullet. You chambered in the round and began to lift the gun to your head, when you suddenly start to cry. Your conscience had started to fight your mind. You thought about how this would affect everyone else, especially Elizabeth. Your still holding the revolver to your head, but your hand was shaking rapidly and you were crying out of pure emotional distress. Then you heard a twig snap behind you. You quickly look behind yourself to see who or what was there and you see Sasha standing there in total shock.

"Oh my gosh... Were you going to...?" Sasha says almost about to cry herself. You look down at the revolver and begin to sob. Sasha walks over to you and says

"I know you are truly suffering on the inside but suicide isn't the only option. You can talk to me if you have any problems and you know that." She says with a soothing voice. You look at her and hug her.

"I'm sorry Sasha its just I had another nightmare about what Vicky did to me, and I just snapped. I stopped thinking straight, and I...I..." You suddenly can't speak. You physically can't push out any words. All that comes out of your mouth are loud whimpers. Sasha then just hugs you tighter and says.

"Its ok you don't have to be sorry just promise me that you'll never do it again." You nod your head as you cry into Sasha's shoulder. She then lifts your head and she looks into your eyes and you look into hers. Her ice blue eyes make you stop crying and you suddenly realize that you have strong emotions towards Sasha.



What do you do?
151122121222211211111.title: Suicidal

1511221212222112111111.content:
"Sasha..." You say.

"What's wrong?" Says Sasha while still staring into your eyes. You had been like this for about two minutes. And during thoughts two minutes you got your mind cleared. You could hardly believe what your thoughts were telling you. The only thing that was in your hard was a voice saying 'JUST TELL HER HOW YOU FEEL!' And it got louder and louder. Until you decided to do what this voice in your head was telling you to do.

"Sasha... I... Love you..." You say. As you say this Sasha's eye light up. And she hugs you even tighter then before, and says.

"Oh I love you two (your name)!"
1511221212222112111111.title: Love

choices: "You can take her to the stables."
"You can take her to the barn."
151122121222211211112.content:
Six months pass, and Vicky slowly but surely gains her trust among the rest of the animals at the farm. Fulfilling her promise, she helped you out around the farm and worked harder than anybody else. She even offered to help make breakfast from time to time. The hardest chore for her to get used to was shearing Jane. The timid sheep would always flinch the minute Vicky even looked at her. You had to talk Jane down so that she could relax. Soon, Jane became more comfortable with Vicky, and now the vixen can shear her without having her run away in fear.


Elizabeth had been growing faster than you expected, as well. After a few months, she learned how to walk on her hind legs and was also beginning to say her first words. In addition to calling you "Daddy" and Vicky "Mommy," she also started calling Sasha and Tara "Auntie," much to Sasha's embarrassment and Tara's chagrin. Hell, your daughter's already drinking from a bottle! Sasha had explained to you that furries develop faster than humans, which is why Elizabeth can do so much at such a young age.


One morning you wake up to Sasha nudging your shoulder. "Wake up," she says softly.


You get up and let out a yawn. "Morning, Sasha," you say. "Where's Vicky?"


"She said she wanted to get all the chores done herself today," she explains. "She wanted you to have the day to yourself."


"That's nice of her," you say. "I guess that means more time to spent with Elizabeth."


"Come to think of it," says Sasha, "the poor thing's never really been out of the house, and she's been able to walk for awhile now."


"Okay, but where am I gonna take her?" you ask.


What's Sasha's response?
151122121222211211112.title: Several Months Later

1511221212222112111121.content:
“You can take her to the stables to see Marie,” Sasha says. “She loves kids.”


You think on it for a moment. “That sounds like a good idea,” you say.


As if on cue, Elizabeth start’s to wake up. You and Sasha turned to see the little fox letting out a yawn. She looked so adorable when she yawned. Elizabeth then blinks and looks around the room. “Mommy?” she says.


You approach your daughter. “Mommy’s working early today,” you tell her. Elizabeth couldn’t say much, but you somehow knew that she could understand you. “It’s just you and me today, kiddo.”


“Yay! Daddy!” she says as she pounces on you, wrapping you in a hug. You’re still getting used to being called Daddy, but it wasn’t that big a deal.


“Come on, Elizabeth,” you say, putting your daughter back on the ground. “There’s someone that I want you to meet.”


Elizabeth takes hold of your hand, and you both walk out the door. “Bye, Auntie!” the little fox says to Sasha, making the latter blush underneath her fur.


You and Elizabeth reach the stables, where Marie was sitting on a bale of hay.


“I see Vicky’s already groomed you,” you say.  “Yeah,” says Marie. “She’s grown on me these past several months.”


“That’s good to know,” you say. You then approach her with Elizabeth following close behind. “This is Marie,” you tell your daughter. Marie smiles at the little vixen, and she smiles back.


You and Marie spend the next hour playing with Elizabeth, and by the end of it all, she’s had her fill.


“Alright, we should get going, Lizzie,” you say, and she node her head. “See ya, Marie,” you say.


“Bye, Mary!” says Elizabeth. You chuckle at her attempt to pronounce Marie’s name.


Where do you and your daughter go next?
1511221212222112111121.title: Meeting Marie

choices: agreed with Vicky's offer to share you
grabbed Vicky and threw her off you.
1511222.content:
"Get away from him, Vicky!" Sasha's voice called out.

Vicky had a brief shocked expression on her face, but she recomposed herself before standing up and turning around, giving you a closeup of her behind.

"Turn around and step away from, so I can teach you a lesson!" Sasha yelled as stomped into the cave. While none of her anger seemed to be directed at you, she still scared you a little. You tried once again to struggle, but being bound ankle-to-thigh and having your arms tied behind your back made it a lot difficult.

"Why? Is it because You want him to yourself? He does have a lot of the same qualities as his uncle, but he is closer in age to us," Vicky said, as she sat in your lap. She even gripped your knees like you were a chair. "Or are you just jealous that I found a way to have him to myself before you could try to find a way for yourself?"

"I'm nothing like you!" Sasha growled as she stepped closer.

"You're right, I'm bolder and sexier," Vicky said with a chuckle. She wiggled her hips a little to rub her rear into you,

"Then why kidnap him and tie him up?" Sasha said with a smirk.

"Because I knew you'd follow me and didn't want him to run off if we talked." Vicky replied.

"What are you getting at?" Sasha asked.

"We're two sexy anthros and he's one hunk of a man. Let's agree to share him and keep him away from the others," Vicky said, clapping her hands together. "I'll even agree to work on the farm if you agree!"

To your surprise, Sasha seemed to be contemplating Vicky's offer.

Before you could say anything, Vicky's tail wrapped around your mouth to silence you.

"Why did you do that?" Sasha asked.

"This is a chat between two women." Vicky replied.

Sasha then...
1511222.title: Sasha comes to save you!

15113.content:
You're at a loss for words. You don't know what to say to Vicky, but it didn't matter, because what happened next took away your chance to answer her.


"Drop him, slut!" you hear a voice say. You move your head to the left and see Sasha standing at the mouth of the cave, teeth bared. She stomps over to you and Vicky.


"You've got some nerve kidnapping him!" she says. "All your other pranks were annoying, but this is way over the line!"


"Sasha wait." Vicky says. "If you'd just give me a chance to-"


"Don't even try smooth talking your way out of this!" Sasha yells. "C'mon, [your name]. We're going home."


Vicky decides not to argue, and she unties the ropes on your wrists, letting you go with Sasha. The two of you walk through the woods on your way back to the house.


"How were you able to find me?" you ask her.


"I notice that you were gone for a long time, and I followed your scent here." she explains.


"Sasha..." you try to say. "While I was with Vicky, we were talking and... she said that she was close friends with Uncle Derrick."


"You don't actually believe that crap do you?" she asks.


"I don't know..." you say. "She also said that she returns the chickens once she gets their eggs."


"That doesn't matter." she says. "Theft is theft, and I find it very hard to believe that she would pull all those pranks just to get close to Derrick."


"Well I think that we should... offer to let her stay here." you say.


"Are you out of your mind!?" she says.


"Look, if she steps out of line just once, we'll kick her out. She at least deserves a chance."


Sasha thinks about it for a second and says...
15113.title: You Can Always Count on Sasha

choices: Allow her to sleep with you in your room.
Let her sleep in the cellar.
151131.content:
"...Fine. But I'm keeping an eye on her. If she takes our food without permission, I assure you she won't escape me without a face full of buckshot!"

You nod silently, and run back to inform Vicky. After hearing the good news, she hugs you happily, saying "Oh, thank you so much! I promise, I won't let you down." You notice she's not acting like she had earlier today. Underneath her smooth-talking guise was a lonely vixen who just wanted some appreciation.

Walking back to the house with her, you see all the anthros on the farm eyeballing Vicky suspiciously. Once you're inside, Sasha simply crosses her arms and avoids eye contact with Vicky. "Hmph."

You see it's getting late, so you begin to walk up to the bedroom.

Before you can take another step, Vicky interrupts you and puts a hand on your shoulder. "Wait."

Sasha bares her teeth and growls menacingly.

"Cool down, girl. I'm not going to hurt him. I was just going to ask where I was going to sleep."

Tara smirks. "There's a perfectly good couch waiting for you in the basement."

Frowning, Vicky says, "I figured I wouldn't get much respect on the first day. Well, I'll see you tomorrow I guess."

She begins to walk toward the cellar door, trying not to show any hints of disappointment.
151131.title: Vicky's Redemption

choices: Sasha notices you blushing when you see her again and gets the wrong idea
Get ready for breakfast and start the day
1511312.content:
You watch Vicky until the doors close behind her, then turn around and resume climbing the stairs to your bedroom. You feel a bit sorry for her being treated this way, but what could you do about it? If you had let her sleep in your room, it would have upset Sasha. She was right about you being a bit too lenient with Vicky. While she does have a crush on you (And an obvious one, at that), you can't put the fox in front of your other friends.

Yet, you can't shake off the feeling that there's something mesmerizing about her. Is it her hair, her thin body, or maybe her soft tail?

Whatever it is, you decide not to worry about it now as you lay down on the cushioned mattress and pull the covers over yourself, slowly drifting off to sleep.

You wake up to Sasha licking your face. All the tension from last night seems to have vanished as she wipes the sleep right off of you with the wet pink towel coming from her mouth. "Get up, sleepyhead! It's time for another wonderful day at the farm!" She says excitedly.

You check the clock, expecting to see an early number like 4 or 5 o' clock. To your surprise, it's 9:32 am. These animals really do care about your 9 hours of sleep.

Scratching your back, you rise from your tomb and stretch your legs. "Yay, he's up!!" Sasha says, clapping her hands lightly.

"Will you keep it down up there? Some of us are still sleeping!" An annoyed voice that can only belong to Tara groans from below.

“Sorry, Tara.” Sasha says quietly as she hands you your shoes. While you bend down to slip them on, she carefully places a cowboy hat on your head. You stand up and take off the hat to look at it. “What’s this?”

“That used to belong to your uncle before he passed on. He hand-stitched it himself. It was his most prized possession, next to this farm of course.” Sasha replies with a grin.

The hat has a golden brown color, and it looks like it’s never been worn before. As you turn it in your hands, it almost seems to glow. Uncle Derrick must have been a master at sewing. Perhaps that was a hobby of his before he founded the farm. You put the hat back on in a crooked fashion and place your hand on the doorknob.

Before you turn it, Sasha says, “Hey, it looks great on you. Take good care of it!” she winks at you as you go downstairs.

You notice that the cellar door is open. “Where’s Vicky?”

“Woke up at 8, said she was going into the garden.” Tara mutters, still getting back to sleep.

You walk outside and see the vixen sitting on a bench under a tree, munching on a fallen peach. She turns around and spots you. “Oh, hi!” Vicky motions for you to sit down next to her. You do as told and ease yourself down.

“You know, I was thinking last night… cellar door. It sounds like the name of an entrance to a dark, damp, disgusting room. But if you modify it a little, you can get something completely different. Something… beautiful.” Vicky slowly and smoothly wraps her arm around you and pulls you a bit closer to her. You begin to blush, but you pretend to look at the clouds in the sky and hide it.

“And what is that ‘something’?” You ask.

“…Celladora. It sounds nothing close to a depressing door. Instead, it can make you think of flowers and stuff. You know, pretty things…” She says.

“…Like you.” You finish.

Wait, what the heck did you just say?

You can’t hide the blush this time, but it doesn’t really matter because Vicky’s cheeks are red too. You both look at each other.

This time, you’re the one that pulls her toward you as your lips meet with hers for the third time in the past few days.

As you pull apart from her, she smiles at you lovingly. “You know, you look really cute with that hat on.”

You smile back at her, then pull a peach from the tree and return to the farmhouse.
1511312.title: Celladora

choices: Tell her about your relationship with Vicky
15113121.content:
As you walk back into the farmhouse, you see Sasha sitting on the sofa. "Hi, [your name]. How are you- Hey, did you pick that peach for me? How thoughtful of you! I love peaches!" She takes the fruit out of your hand before you can stop her and eats a bite out of it.

Then she looks up at your face. "It's really go-" She stops mid-sentence. She studies your face for a while, then gets a big grin on her face. It takes a few seconds for you to figure out what's going on. And then the horrifying realisation hits you: You're still blushing from kissing Vicky, and now Sasha thinks you're in love with her.

"Sasha, wait-" Your words are eaten as Sasha kisses you, smack dab on the lips. Some of the chewed-up peach goes into your mouth.

You quickly break the kiss and back up a little. "Sasha, I'm not blushing because I have a crush on you!" You say sternly. Sasha's eyes widen. "Oh. Well, that was awkward. Sorry about that."

Sasha finishes the rest of the peach and throws away the pit. "So, why are you blushing, then?"

You hesitate for a while as you think about what to say.
15113121.title: An Awkward Misunderstanding

151131212.content:
You mind rushes as you try to come up with an excuse for why you were blushing. You consider making a break for it right then and there, but that wouldn't do you any good.


"Hello?" says Sasha. "I asked you a question."


"Well," you say. "I was with Vicky in the garden and-"


"This better not be going where I think it's going." she says, raising an eyebrow.


"No," you say. "We were walking around and I saw a fruit that looked pretty tasty. Vicky told me not to eat it, but I didn't listen, and the fruit turned out to be really spicy."


"What does that have to do with anything?" she asks.


"Well, eating spicy foods does cause blushing." you say. In your mind, you hope that Sasha bought the story. Imagine how she would react if she found out that you and Vicky kissed! Your excuse does sound legitimate, but Sasha might see through it. You hope for the best, but prepare for the worst.
151131212.title: Make something up and lie

15113122.content:
As you walk back inside, Sasha comes down to make breakfast. She sees the peach in your hand and takes it. "Hey, you picked some peaches for us. Thanks!"

"Well, actually I only grabbed one-" You begin to say.

"That's alright, look at how big it is! There's enough of it for all three of us."

"Um, three...?"

"Yeah. Me, you and Ta-" Sasha gets interrupted by a snore from Tara. "...Okay, just me and you then."

"Wait, what about Vicky?" You ask.

Sasha's expression turns serious. "That slut can find her own food. She's a skilled hunter, so she can find something in the forest." She splits the large peach in half with a knife. "Here, take your piece. I'll go fry up some eggs." Sasha leaves to get eggs from the chicken coop.

Suddenly Tara gets up and grabs your half of the peach. She takes a bite of it, gives what's left of it back to you, then returns to her sleeping position. You know you deserve that for stepping on her tail when you first arrived at the farm.

Maybe you can apologize to her sometime.

Sasha comes back in with the eggs and sets them down gently on the table. "Alright, egg time! Hey [Your name], do you like your eggs boiled, scrambled or fried?"
15113122.title: A Peachy Breakfast

choices: "Oh, so you're saying it's my fault?"
151131222.content:
You weren't entirely certain that apologizing to Tara would stop her from disliking you, but it wouldn't hurt, right? At least she'll know that you're sorry. You silently walk over to her and gently nudge her shoulder. She slowly wakes up. Her face turns sour the instant she sees you.


"Let me guess," she says. "You're pissed that I took a bite of your peach?"


"While that is somewhat true," you say. "That's not why I woke you up."


"Then what is it?" she asks impatiently. "I've been woken up enough times today."


"I just wanted to say sorry for stepping on your tail the other night." you say. "I didn't mean to do that."


"If you're so sorry, why did it take you this long to apologize?" she asks.


"In all honesty, I didn't think that it would've been that big of a deal." you say, trying your hardest not to make it sound like you're accusing her of overreacting. "Since it apparently is, I want to apologize."


"Hmph." Tara says. You were unsure of whether or not she was mad or just content.


"In my defense, it was pretty dark, and I couldn't quite see where I was going, and I didn't know you were there..." you continue.


What is Tara's response?
151131222.title: Burying the Hatchet

choices: Go into the garden to see Vicky again.
Eat dinner with Sasha and Tara.
1511312222.content:
"Alright, I forgive you. I can't really stay mad at you anyway, considering you're the owner of the farm now." Tara gives you a soft pat on the shoulder and walks out the door. "I'll be chatting with Marie if you need me."

You wave goodbye to Tara, feeling glad that you're settled your tab.

"Well, you just lost your free will." Sasha says.

"Uh, what do you mean?" You reply.

"I couldn't wait any longer for you to choose, so I decided to make you a boiled egg."

"That's just fine." You nod to her.

After breakfast, you do all your daily work. You collect and carton some milk from Bess, you get the rest of the eggs from the coop, and all that jazz. Soon, lunch passes by and dinner is almost ready. You worry about whether Vicky has eaten anything today, besides peaches.
1511312222.title: Water Under the Bridge

choices: Try to convince Sasha to make enough dinner for Vicky to join in.
15113122221.content:
"Guys, I'll be right back." you say.


"Okay." they say.


You go to the garden and look for Vicky. You find her sitting underneath the peach tree again. "Hey, Vicky." you say.


"Hi!" she says with a warm smile.


"So... I was wondering if you had anything to eat today." you say.


"Aside from a few fruits form the garden, not much." she says. "It's fine, though. I'm used to going days without eating."


"Well, you shouldn't have to deal with that anymore, Vicky." you say. "You live here now, so you're welcome to have three full meals a day."


"Even so," she says. "I don't think Sasha will want to cook for me."


"Let me take care of that." you say, as you walk with her to the house. On your way over, you wonder what you should do. Maybe if you ask Sasha to do it as a favor to you, she'll make dinner for Vicky. Then again, why take the risk. You know how to cook, so you could cook for Vicky yourself. What should you do?
15113122221.title: Same Place, Different Time

choices: "...You know what, you're right. You can come in, Vicky."
"Sorry, I don't think I can trust her yet. Maybe another day."
151131222211.content:
You tell Vicky to wait near the door and walk over to Sasha, who's frying bacon. You decide to move onto the subject of making dinner for Vicky slowly, so as not to get Sasha stressed and be denied.

"So where do you get the bacon, anyway?" You ask.

"Uncle Derrick would call people sometimes to have food delivered. It was a tedious business to undergo though; We had to made sure the delivery people didn't see Bess or Marie. We would usually have them wait in the chicken house until the delivery people left. If they knew anthros existed, we'd get a ton of unwanted attention." Sasha replied. "We still have plenty of food left in the freezer though, so you won't need to worry about ordering food for now."

"How long do you think it'll last?"

"I'd say there's enough to last us about two months."

"Well in that case, would you be willing to make some more food?"

"What for? Are you extra hungry from working today?"

"No, not exactly." You actually hadn't done much today. Since there were no crops, all you really needed to do was tend to the animals. "Actually, I was hoping you would let Vicky join us for dinner."

"What?! Why would I ever do something for her?" Sasha exclaimed.

"Sasha, just give her a chance. She hasn't stolen anything all day today- well, other than a few peaches from the tree in the garden. You can't regain your trust with Vicky unless you give her a chance."

Vicky steps in through the doorway. "Exactly. I've always wished we could be friends, but I knew it would be hard for you to trust me since I did all those dumb pranks so I could talk to Derrick."

Sasha takes in what you both said, then thinks for a moment and says...
151131222211.title: Attempting to Fix What's Already Broken

choices: Let her sleep with you in your room.
Spend the night with her in the cellar.
1511312222111.content:
Even though Sasha had a grudge against vicky, she was an overall nice person. You assume that she thought Derrick would want her to be nice, because what she says pleasantly surprises you.


"You guys have a point." she says. "Maybe I was a little harsh. You can come in, Vicky."


Vicky thans Sasha for letting her eat with the rest of you, and you all have a rather pleasurable dinner. After the food is done and the dishes are washed, you and Vicky hat in the living room.


"Thanks for convincing Sasha to let me eat dinner with you guys." she says. "I thought it would take her at least a month to get used to me being around."


"Nah," you say. "Sasha's is a nice person. I just needed to give her a gentle nudge. In the end, it was still her decision to let you have dinner with us."


"Even so, thank you." she says.


"Okay, everyone! Time to turn in for the night!" you hear Sasha call out.


"See you in the morning." says Vicky.


As you watch her approach the cellar, or rather, the Celladora, you wonder if Vicky is really comfortable being all by herself down there. Even when you change the name, the cellar is till the cellar, so she must feel somewhat uncomfortable. What should you do?
1511312222111.title: First Step to Forgiveness

choices: Nothing happens. You both sleep until the next day.
You and Vicky decide to take your relationship a little further.
15113122221111.content:
"Hey, Vicky." You say.

Vicky turns around. "Yeah?"

"Would you like to sleep with me tonight, instead of in the Celladora?" Wow, that name actually does make the basement sound not quite so uncomfortable.

"Really?! That's so sweet of you!" Vicky runs back to you and gives you a quick kiss on the cheek. Then you both walk up to the bedroom together, hand in hand.

You're glad Sasha and Tara weren't around to see that. Sasha would have been shocked to find out you're developing a relationship with Vicky. But you know that someday you'll have to tell her; you can't hide your love with the vixen walking beside you forever.

You both approach the bed. You take off your hat and shoes, placing them onto the nightstand with the utmost care. You pull down the covers and let Vicky get in. "Ladies first." Vicky stifles a giggle, laying down on the left side of the bed facing away from you. You get in too, then turn off the lamp. "Love you."

"You too." Vicky replies.

That night...
15113122221111.title: Together

151131222211112.content:
At 3 in the morning you randomly wake up to find Vicky still awake and looking at you with a gentle smile. "Did my staring wake you up?" she asks you jokingly. "Not exactly. I just had to look at you again," you say, spellbound by her beauty. She blushes at the remark and reaches over to you, before engaging in what must be the longest kiss ever. Who cares if she's an anthro vixen, she's still enchanting. You show no signs of hesitation as you exchange tongues in a sensual moment of seduction.

The moment you two finish Vicky makes a further move on you by putting her hand on your junk. She whispers to you that she wants to make love to you and you nod eagerly. You get on top of her and proceed to get underway in having sex with a fox. It's very enjoyable for the both of you as she is writhing in pleasure and once you both reach your grand finale euphoria takes over. "I love you more than anything Vicky. I want to be with you, always." You mean what you say and Vicky knows it. "I want to be with you forever too. And we will make it happen," she says assuredly as always.

"We can't keep it a secret forever though, should we tell everyone now or some other time," you ask Vicky, aware of the situation. What is Vicky's response?
151131222211112.title: She's Called A Vixen For A Reason

choices: Next morning, you find Vicky in bed with you
Next morning, Vicky is nowhere to be seen.
1511312222111122.content:
Your question hangs in the air like a thick blanket. Seemingly placing pressure upon everything in the room. The two of you were sprawled across the bed with limbs all splayed around, happily basking in the warm afterglow of your tender love making. It was a long while before the beautiful vixen beside you replied to your question.

"Soon..." she replied softy. "But not yet. They barely tolerate me right now as it is, I don't think they could handle the news of a new couple on the farm."

"They would probably lose their minds if they even found out we liked each other..." you began to say.

Vicky giggled deviously. "Or if they knew we were staying in the say room together..."

A smile grew across your face. "Sleeping in the same bed together..."

Vicky wiggled her way across the bed to lay her head against the side of yours tenderly. "Cuddling, kissing, snuggling..." she cooed.

"Tickling poor defenseless foxes..."

Vicky blinked in confusion. "What?"

You seized your moment. Rolling upright onto your knees you immediately dove for a tickle attack straight to the vixen's rib-cage. It was clear you had never tickled an anthro before as you had to work your nimble fingers through the vixen's lush fur just to feel the smooth skin underneath. Yips and squeals of delight escaped the fox as the onslaught continued, with Vicky fruitlessly trying to swat your arms and hands away.

The tickle fight swiftly came to end with you grabbing her wrists and gently pinning Vicky's limbs to the bed. There the two of you were, you straddling her waist with your legs on both sides of her hips, chests heaving with panted breath, eyes firmly locked into the gaze of the other.

You slowly slid your hands off her wrists and up her arms to gently cup both sides of her muzzle with your palms. Giving her the chance to do the same and lightly grasp both sides of your face in her own paws.

"Did you mean it?" she quietly asked.

"Mean what?"

"When you said you loved me, did you really mean it?"

You lovingly grasped one of her paws and raised it to your face to press a gentle kiss into her palm. The tough skin of her paw pad felt strange and unfamiliar to your lips, but the exotic sensation of it drove something wild in your fevered mind.

"One thing you should know about me Vicky...I don't mince words. I'd never say anything that serious and not mean every syllable."

Vicky took a long somber look at you and exhaled deeply. As if she had been holding in that nervous breath for hours.

"But we've only known each other for what a day? Two perhaps? Bit quick don't you think?"

"I seem to recall though a certain fox was the one who kidnapped me, hauled me off to her cave just to confess her attraction. That seem familiar?" you teased

The fox under you groaned with embarrassment as she turned her head away to face the far wall of the bedroom. "Uggghh, I'm so, so, SO sorry for that. I wasn't thinking straight. I know that is no excuse, but I was so wrapped up in seeing you for the first time I just...I just...." she stuttered.

"Hey, hey Vicky, it's alright, I forgive you, you know that right? I don't and will NEVER hold that against you, ok?"

Vicky slowly turned her head back to you, her face filled with anguish. "I'm afraid though,"

This caught you off guard. Gently pulling back, you stared tenderly into the vixen's sad, tear filled eyes wondering what sort of thoughts were plaguing her mind.

"Afraid? Of what?"

She took a steadying breath before continuing. "I've been alone for so long. All alone inside that musty cave, I'm afraid......I'm afraid if I close my eyes I'll just wake up and find myself right back there.....alone again,"

The vixen took one slow breath. "And you won't be there..." she said as a tear fell down her fuzzy cheek.

Needless to say, you heart was slowly ripping in two. This normally smooth talking, devious, sensuous vixen was emotionally unraveling right before you. You knew you had to do something, and you needed to do it quick. Promptly sitting upright, you firmly grabbed Vicky by her wide, supple hips and lifted her up towards you.

Whatever response she might have had was quickly silenced with a squeak as your lips connected with hers. In no time at all the vixen slowly melted into the kiss and your loving touch. But this kiss was something different, something more. More than lust, more than mere attraction.

"I love you Vicky," you moaned with conviction. "I don't care if its only been a short time, I know how I feel, and its more than you could possibly know..."

This time it was Vicky that began the next deep kiss. "Way to steal a fox's heart Romeo..." she giggled.

"What can I do to prove to you I mean everything I say?"

You soon found out as Vicky's paws began to roam up and down the smooth skin your shirtless chest, her tail beginning to wag with anticipation. "I can think of something..." she said with a lick of her lips.

You responded in kind with a third tender kiss and giving her plump, shapely rear a firm squeeze. This only served to drive a lusty purr from the already perky fox.

"Mind if I show you?" you huffed into her furry neck.

Vicky gingerly nipped at your ear and began rooting her black nose through your hair. "What took you so damn long?" she moaned.

You could only laugh. That was the Vicky you knew and loved. Once more the night air was filled with a chorus of breathy moans and naughty giggles. Roaming hands and paws and synchronized movements soon grew into a crescendo as both of you fell over the edge together.

The two of you collapsed exhausted in a heap upon the bed, but this time, never once leaving the other's arms. You laid on your side with one hand scratching her back, the other behind her head so you could gently finger through her flowing hair. Likewise Vicky had both of her arms tucked between her chest and yours. Her soft face nestled within the crook of your neck.

"It's strange..." you began to mutter quietly.

"Hmm?" came the fox's reply, her eyes closed in contentment.

"I came here looking to take care of an old rustic farm, now I find myself in bed, in love with a fox. Not how I expected my weekend to turn out..." you chuckled quietly.

Vicky's only response was to push herself tighter against you. Burying her muzzle further into your neck.

"Do you regret it?" she mumbled, her voice heavily laden with sleep.

Your immediate answer was to press a loving kiss into her rich crimson hair right between her fluffy ears.

"Not in the slightest" you replied firmly.
1511312222111122.title: "Not yet, but soon."

1512.content:
Just then, something long and black wraps itself around Vicky's neck. She starts choking, and gets off of you, trying to get it off of her neck. You look and see that the thing wrapped around Vicky's neck was Tara's tail!

"You are so desperate." she says.

"Good job, Tara." you hear someone say. You then see Sasha walking into the cave. "Are you alright?" she asks. "Increasingly better." you say. "Good." she says with a smile.

"I'll get you two for this!" Vicky says with contempt.

"Whatever," Tara says as her tail loosens its grip on the vixen's neck. Vicky falls to the ground as she gasps for air. You, Tara and Sasha bolt out of Vicky's den. "Where did you park?" you ask. "Over there." Sasha says, pointing in the direction. The three of you get inside the car and make your way back to the farm.

"How did you know that Vicky had me?" you ask Sasha.

"I saw the way she was looking at you earlier today, so I figured that she'd try something like this." she says.

"That... and the fact that we saw Vicky's paw prints in the mud." Tara adds.

"Well, thanks." you say. "Both of you."

"Don't thank me." Tara says. "I only came along because I was bored."

"Still, thanks." you say.

"Well, today was pretty... eventful." Sasha says, laughing a little. "Why don't we have some dinner, then hit the sack!"

"Sounds good to me!" you say. Tara just shrugs her shoulders.
1512.title: The Rescuers

15122.content:
You, Sasha, and Tara got home at about 9:30. It was a little late for dinner, but you were starving. You ate your fill and were about to go to bed, but then, Sasha approaches you.

"Hey, can I talk to you about something?" she asks.

"Sure, Sasha." you say.

She leads you to the front porch. She probably wants to talk to you in private.

"So what did you want to talk about?" you ask.

"Well, I... wanted to ask you something." she says, playing with her hair. "Do you like Vicky?"

You stared at her in disbelief. "Are you kidding?" you say. "She kidnapped me and tried to have her way with me. There's no way that I could like her!"

"Heh, you're right. It was a stupid question." she says.

"I mean, the girl tried to steal my virginity." you go on to say, then you cover your mouth.

"Wait, you're a virgin?" she asks, shocked.

"I really shouldn't have said that out loud." you say. "I know, it's pathetic."

"I don't think it's pathetic." Sasha says. "I think it's sweet"

"How so?"

"It means that you're still waiting till you find that special someone." she explains.

"Well, when you put it that way, it makes a lot of sense, actually." you say.

"It does, doesn't it." Sasha says with a giggle. "Well, goodnight."

"G'night."

You walk into your room and get ready for bed. As you were about to catch some Z's, there's a knock at the door.
15122.title: Later that night...

choices: "Would you mind... if we were more than friends?"
151221.content:
You see Sasha at your bedroom door, and you're surprised to see her. You thought that she was already in bed. "Hey, Sasha." you say. "Do you need something?"

"Oh, well... I was wondering if you wanted to sleep together again tonight." she says.

"Uh, sure." you say. There isn't any harm in sharing a bed with Sasha, right? It doesn't really mean anything. You get into your bed and Sasha crawls in next to you.

"Goodnight" you say.

"Goodnight" she says.

You were about to fall asleep when you feel Sasha's arms wrap around you, pulling you close to her. You were going to protest, but you kind of liked the feeling of her body on your back. It was quite comforting. You were about to fall asleep again, when you hear heavy breathing coming from Sasha. You felt a little uncomfortable, so you try to wiggle out of her arms. Just then, Sasha starts to gently bite your neck. The line was crossed.

"Sasha, stop!" you say.

"Huh?" she says. She sounded like she was not aware of what was going on. She must have been doing all of this in her sleep.

"You were biting me." you say.

"Oh my gosh, I'm sorry." she says.

You sigh. "It's fine, just try not to do it again."

You were about to try and get some sleep again, but Sasha interrupts once more.

"[Your name]?" she says. "Can I ask you something?"

"What is it?" you ask.
151221.title: It's Sasha

1512211.content:
You ask Sasha to repeat herself because you weren't sure if you heard her right.

"I said, do you think I'm attractive?" she says again.

"What brought that up?" you ask. Sasha's question was just out of the blue, which left you confused.

"I was just wondering." she says. "So do you or don't you?"

You think about it for a second. Sasha was definitely pretty in her own right. Her coat was beautiful, and the contrast between her icy blue eyes and her mostly black fur made her eyes stand out, which was a good thing since they were very pretty. Her hair was just as beautiful, too. You wonder why Sasha would feel insecure about how she looked. There was nothing unattractive about her, physically or personality-wise. Why would she ask you such a question?

"You're taking a pretty long time." Sasha says, with a hint of worry in her voice.

"Do you want me to be completely honest?" you ask.

"Of course." she says.

"I think you'e very attractive." you say. "You're a really beautiful girl."

Sasha smiles and her ice blue eyes start to tear up. She pulls you into a hug and licks your cheek. "That's the nicest thing, anyone's ever said to me." she says. Then, to your surprise, Sasha plants a kiss on you, slightly tightening her grip on you. Needless to say, you were in shock.

What do you do?
1512211.title: That's an Odd Question...

1513.content:
It was obvious that nobody was gonna come to your aid, so in a last- ditch effort to get free, you headbutt Vicky. Sure, your head was hurting too, but it was worth it. She let out a loud cry of pain, and fell to the ground, clutching her forehead. You take this opportunity to escape, but since you ere still tied up, you hop out. Hopefully, Vicky's headache was strong enough to keep her from getting up.


The entrance to Vicky's den was on high ground, so you were able to see the house. You quickly hop down to the woods and go in the direction that the house was in. After a good five minutes, you feel the ropes on your legs loosen from all your jumping. You get your legs free and start sprinting, as you were running for your life, hoping that Vicky wasn't on your tail, you start to wonder why Vicky wanted you in the first place.


"What is wrong with her?" you think. "Why does she want me? Shouldn't she be interested in male foxes? Well, I guess since there are no male foxes like her, she'll take what she can get. Still, though, it's just so weird. Maybe she's just a slut. That would probably make the most sense. There were quite a few girls like her when I was in high school."


Your thoughts are interrupted by the sight of the farm in the distance. Just then, someone surprises you.
1513.title: An Unnecessary Headache

choices: Vicky comes in the middle of the night.
15132.content:
You hear rustling in the trees and freeze in fear, thinking that it was Vicky. A few seconds later, you hear a voice. "Are you lost or something?" the voice asks. It didn't sound like Vicky's, but you turn around to see a bat furry hanging upside down from a tree branch.


"Are you Luna?" you ask.


"Yes I am." she says. "And you must be Derrick's nephew. What are you doing out here?"


"Vicky kidnapped me and now I'm trying to get back to the farm." you say hastily.


"Well, if that's the case, then I'll help you get there." she offers.


"No offense," you say, "but how are you gonna be able to get me home."


Luna smirks and lets go of the branch she was hanging onto. She then grabs your shoulders with her feet and flies upward, carrying you all the way to the farmhouse. "Thanks a lot, Luna." you say. "Anytime." she replies before flying off into the night sky. When you walk into the house, Sasha instantly rushes you. "Where were you? I was worried sick!" she says with a tone that reminded you of your mother. "I'm fine, Sasha." you say. "I just got into a little... altercation with Vicky." She growls in frustration. "I'm sleeping with you tonight in case she tries anything." she says. You thank her for going out of her way to do that. That saved you the trouble of asking her yourself.
15132.title: A Bat in the Night

151321.content:
That night, Sasha shared your bed with you. She instinctively wraps her arms around you since she was there to protect you. You were going to object, but you realized how soft Sasha's fur was, so you kept your mouth shut. "Don't worry, Vicky's not gonna be able to get to you when I'm here." she says.


Later that night, Vicky approaches the farm. "You won't get away that easily." she says to herself. She runs over to the tree that was outside your bedroom window and easily climbs it. Using her knack for pranks and mischief, she opens the window without making a sound.


She tiptoes over to your bed, still unaware that Sasha was with you. When she approaches your bed, she is surprised to see Sasha there. However, instead of being worried, she says "Awwww! How cuuuuute!"


Sasha's ears immediately perk up and she gets up in a flash. "The hell are you doing here!" she barks.


"I was in the neighborhood, and I figured that I should pay a visit." Vicky says nonchalantly.


"Very funny, now get the hell out!" says Sasha.


"Sure, as long as [your name] goes with me." says Vicky.


"Keep dreaming!" you say.


"You know, I've forgiven you for headbutting me, but I won't be talked to like that by a boy." she says.


"He should've hit you harder, since you still don't seem to have any sense in your head!" says Sasha.


The tension in the room was rising by the second. The breaking point was coming closer and closer and...
151321.title: The Night Stalker

choices: She was attacked or she was fighting someone or something

choices: Some other farm anthro or some other anthro

You see she was shot, luckly the wound in not fatal, but still needs treatment. As you start treating Vicky's injury you asked who shot her.

So who shot Vicky?

"I was shot by that bitch Sasha. I was on my way back to my den When she came out of hiding from somewhere and said and I quote, "I'm tired of you trying to take things that don't belong to you and that even includes [insert your name here] so now die.". She then shot at me I ran, but the first few shots misses me when one finally got me in the shoulder. I then dropped and went and played dead as to keep her from checking I was alive. After Sasha went back I came here as fast as I could. Sorry if I have awoken you from your sleep [insert your name here], but please I need to ask you a favor. Can I stay here and hide I promise to help out if you keep that crazy bitch away from me and not let her kill me." said Vicky honestly.

You say, ".......
15211.title: Sasha the Anthro Husky

15213.content:
"Did you get a good look at them." you asked, wrapping a bandage over the wound. Vicky shook her head. "Whoever it was, they were wearing a mask, so I couldn't see their face." Vicky replied as you laid her on the couch.

"I'll go out there and see what I can find." said Sasha, grabbing a loaded shotgun off of the mantelpiece. "No." you replied, stopping her "I'll go.". "Why." asked Sasha as you took the shotgun from her. "If I loose you, the farm is done for. You've got more experience working here." You replied. "OK" Sasha replied "Just be careful.". You nodded and turned to head outside. You kept your shotgun at the ready as you walked toward the nearby forest. Suddenly,
15213.title: Another human somewhere

choices: Sasha and Tara arrive to help
152131.content: You suddenly heard the chatter of gunfire and several bullets struck the ground surrounding you. You jumped and took cover behind a tree firing several rounds at your assailants. You heard multiple shouts coming from a thicket of trees. "Great." you said to yourself as you reloaded your shotgun "I've got more than one gunman.". You heard footsteps coming toward you. You realized if you didn't do something soon, you'd either be killed or captured. Suddenly,
152131.title: Someone starts shooting at you

1523.content:
It was dark already and past supper. The girls were already cleaning up and washing the dishes.

Suddenly you hear a knock on the door. You go out to check who it is. Suddenly, as you open the door, a red figure drops on you and wraps her arms on your neck.

"Vicki?" You say in suprise. You feel awkwark as she clings on you, looks into your eyes and her breasts press onto your chest.

"What are you doing here?" you ask. Her face looks looks in pain.

"When I was going back to my den, I must have stepped into an old snare." You look at her foot. I looked hurt, slightly swollen, but didn't seem broken. "So I limped down here in hope you could help me?" She said looking at yo with big glassy eyes.

You decided to help. You couldn't leave her like that in the woods. You brought her to the living room where you and some of the other girls tended her leg and gave her some food. Few minutes later Sasha came in from checking the farm. "Everything seems to be.. WHAT THE HELL IS SHE DOING HERE!!??" she yelled seing Vicky lying on the couch. After restraining her first reaction you exlain why she's here and that it's only untill she feels better. She reluctantly agreed.

"Ok, but shell be ONLY till she can walk AND she will have chores to fulfil. I'll not have freeloading here!" She stated sternly.

"Yeah, whatever.." Vicki said while rolling her eyes

"Ok, it's time for bed. Everyone go to your rooms." Sasha commended. "And YOU! " She pointed on the slightly confused vixen "I have my eyes on you!"

Vicki smiled mischievously and stroke a seductive pose "I hope you are enjoying the view." and she run her finger from her breast down to her hip.

Sasha blushed and angered at the same time. She imidiatly left the room before she explode.

Later that night you were in bed, sound asleep. A figure slyly moved in the darkness, hardly making a sound. Minutes later you feel the covers shift as someone cimbs into bed with you and begins licking your neck, as though they were grooming you. You reach for you nightstand and turn on the lamp to see who the intruder was.

Who is it?
1523.title: Was caught by a trap

15232.content: You see luna next to you. She cuddles up to you when she crawls in bed with you. She wraps her wings around both of you. You say "Are you luna?" She says "Yes i'm luna. Who are you?" "I'm the new caretaker here." You say. "Well can sleep with you tonight?" "Sure luna". You both fall asleep like that you wraped up in her wings with her.
15232.title: Luna

152332.content:
Kev looked around groggily, receiving a tongue right across his face, almost yelling out, but instead shaking his head, wiping the saliva off his face. "eugh, what the...?" he started to say, blushing when he was met with Sasha looking at him, her naked furry form right up against his body, warm and toasty, and very soft.

"S-Sasha...what are you doing...?" he asked, turning over in bed and sitting up, turning on a lamp and looking at her.

"...I...had a nightmare..." she said, looking at him with her frightened eyes, then looking away. "....sorry....I'll go if i'm making you uncomfortable...." she said, blushing through her fur, about to get out of her bed, when he reached out and took her hand in his. "...hey...you had a bad dream...come on...tell me about it..." he said, gently pulling her back onto the bed, letting her sit next to him under the covers, stroking her back as she told him about the bad dream, which involved her as a puppy being abandoned in a box under a motorway bridge.

Kev frowned as the sad husky looked away, before hugging her. "...hey...cheer up...it was nothing but a silly dream...your never gonna be abandoned...you hear?" he said, smirking and gently tickling the husky, who yipped, before bursting out into laughing fits, giggling and wriggling in his arms as he tickled her belly with a smile, glad to have cheered her up.

Sasha giggled till Kev stopped tickling, leaving her to catch her breath with feral panting, tongue lolling out of her mouth as she lay in his bed, Kev smirked, leaning against the headboard, fascinated by the anthropomorphic Husky girl, who lay panting next to him, then slowly sitting up as she caught her breath before looking at him.

"....Kev...." she said, seeming to have something on her mind with how she looked at him. "yes?" he asked, looking at her directly.

"....i'm sorry about today....about getting angry....i...guess i was just in a bad mood...Vicky being there didn't help..." she explained apologetically, looking at Kev with a bit of fear, making him realize just why she'd had that bad dream. "oh Sasha...come on, i'd never abandon you..." he said, placing a hand on her cheek, stroking her gently, smiling as Sasha's eyes lit up, before she hugged him tightly, making him blush as her furry chest pressed against his own firm toned chest, before he sighed, hugging her back and laying down in bed with her, turning off his lamp, and going back to sleep.

when Kev woke up, he was surprised to find...
152332.title: Sasha

info.brief_description: You inherit a farm inhabited by anthros
info.description:
(5/23/2016: Under new management. This is not originally mine)

You have just inherited your uncle’s farm. Why he left it to you, God only knows. So you move from your suburb home in California, all the way to Pennsylvania, just to check it out. But when you finally get there, you’re in for a surprise. Except for a flock of chickens, there are hardly any animals around the farm, and the only ones that are there aren’t what you expected.


The only real rules for this story are no overt sexual content, and no adding anymore character choices. I don’t want this to be another story where the option chapters go on forever. By "overt", I mean it may be implied, but not described.


Characters:

Name: Sasha
Species: Husky

Sasha is an energetic and friendly husky with an athletic figure. Her back, legs, and arms are black, while her hands, feet, belly, face, and tail tip are white. She seems to be the leader of the group, having been keeping things under control since your uncle passed on.


Name: Tara
Species: Cat

Tara is a moody, somewhat lazy cat with black fur covering her entire body. Her eyes are a glowing shade of yellow, and she has a small hoop piercing in her left ear. One strange thing about her, is that her tail is unusually long and flexible, with a tuft of fur on the tip. She can use this tail to wrap around and hold things. Her and Sasha are the only ones allowed inside the farmhouse.


Name: Bess
Species: Cow

Bess is a kind, motherly cow with a white coat with splotches of black here and there. Her breasts are pink and udder-like, each the size of a basketball. She needs to be milked daily, or her breasts swell bigger the fuller she becomes. She resides in the farm’s barn.


Name: Marie
Species: Horse

Marie is a brown mare with a black mane and tail. She has a kind, but competitive personality. She spends most of her time racing around the farm’s fields, loving the feeling of the wind rushing past her and her heart pounding. She lives in the stables across from the barn.

Name: Jane
Species: Sheep

Jane is a shy and quiet ewe. She spends all her time in the pasture, maybe eating some grass or simply walking around. She mainly avoids the other animals, preffering to keep to herself. The others haven’t even spoken with her once, she didn‘t even speak to your uncle. She hasn’t been sheered in months, so her wool is very thick, making her appear fatter than she really is.



Name: Luna
Species: Bat

Luna is pretty much a recluse, spending all day sleeping, hanging upside-down from the barn rafters with her wings wrapped around her. She only comes out at night, when she’ll go hunting for food. Not much is known about her, since the other animals rarely even catch a glimpse of her awake. Her entire body is covered in black fur, except for a single white streak going down her forehead to her nose. Her ears are long and pointy, sticking straight up. Her arms are also her wings, with hands on the ends.


Name: Vicky
Species: Fox

Vicky is a troublesome, mischievous fox from the forest at the edge of the farm. She often tries to steal chickens from their coop, as well as their eggs, and likes to play pranks on the other animals. Being a vixen, she has a naturally voluptuous figure, and is slightly vain. Her fur is a dark orange with her chest, belly, and tail tip being white, while her feet and hands are black. Long, fiery red hair hangs down to her shoulders.
